reviews.review: Great fun. Perfect puzzles to solve, very much fun and a bit of adrenalin too, when the time was running out in the end.

Really demanding. The room was awesome, puzzles were diverse and complicated. In 4, we almost made it to the end. I am puting away one star for the room master - she was angry that we came 2 minutes in advance and that we went directly downstairs. She repeated it 3 times. Also, she seemed bored and not caring about our fun.

Super family game! . My kids (11, 13) were bored stiff and frustrated with sightseeing, so I scrounged through the internet looking for things that would make Prague memorable for them too and discovered escape games. While granny explored the castle to her heart's content, we were just down the road locked in the "Old World"! We highly recommend this game to families like us who need a break from the crowds and something fun to do together. It wasn't too hard for the kids, because it doesn't depend on a lot of specialised knowledge. Their intuition and curiosity were a bonus and we made a great team of 3. I was astounded how we figured things out. We juuuust finished the tasks. Well, a few well-timed clues and a couple of extra minutes at the end gave us that sense of accomplishment as the door clicked open. I think we may be hooked!

Occultica is great for 8 persons. We are a group of 8 people and chose the Occultica Room. It was the second time we did an escape game and we really enjoyed this one. The setting is great, the puzzles are original. You get hints when the game master decides to give you a hint, we are glad they do not give them too fast so you really have the chance to discover everything by yourself first. The staff was very friendly and they take the time after the game to talk through the game and let you take pictures if you want to. The game is described as 'very hard', but every group should be able to manage to escape with some hints. It was a great experience, so do not hesitate to book this room!

Fun and intellect!. I heard a lot about The Room and when my step sister visited me in Prague and asked if we could do it, I decided to go for it :)We were 2 adults + 1 teen (16 years old) + 1 kid (11 years) and we decided for the Occultica.It is very large, very well designed, very challenging and a lot of fun!!!Unfortunately an electrical system did not work, so the helper there tried to fix it for a very long time, while we kept looking for other clues.Otherwise VERY VERY VERY gooooooooood game for family and friends!The staff is also very helpful and friendly!I can just recommend it! :)

Great Fun. did this as a group of 8, pretty challenging but keeps you really interested and makes you work as a team. This was our first escape room experience and we would all deff do another one! lovely staff who give clues as and when you need them.Give it a go!

great experience. The largest escaper room in Prague!! And the puzzles really bring us so much fun and surprise. It's quite excellent. However, it can be better if the room has more information about plot!!! A plot can be a soul of escaper room!!!
Amazing room!!. Very intensive well designed room.We enjoyed a lot! Thanks!Very suprizing and challenging.Keep on open mind.

bigger not always better. I have played both of the location of the room. Found the two locations very similar in appearance. Though the puzzles were slightly different.We were able to escape without opening all of the locks which I found odd as well.No story to the escape. Just sort of random things put together.
We were skeptical. It was Excellent !. All is in the title. Excellent roomAll is in the title. Excellent roomAll is in the title. Excellent room

Escape Game at its best. Different experience than usual architecture and nature filled tourist spots. 10 locks to be opened by solving various riddles and connecting the dots. Superb combination of ideas and puzzles. Fine use of props and keep you engaged. 66 minutes worth spent with gamekeeper maintaining the hints according to the level of participant. Our first experience with escape rooms, will try again.

Amazing game, perfectly conceived. We were 10 people and we loved the game ! The hostess was lovely, the game has several rooms in order to have enough space for everybody not to step on each other. We just managed to finish on time (with a little help :-p )!

So much fun!. We were a group of 6 friends that wanted to try this escape room on our last day in Prague. It was some of the best fun we had on the entire trip. The room is challenging, but as long as you keep your eyes open it is not too challenging. All in all a great time!

Superb activity for a stag weekend, great team bonding experience!. We were a group of 8 on my brother's stag weekend in Prague. I booked this not really knowing how it would go down with our group (none of us have done an escape room before). I think all would agree it was probably one of the best things we could have done. It was fun, challenging, well put together, the guide was very friendly and we all came away grinning from ear to ear having completed 'The Room Occultica' with only 15 seconds to spare. I can't imagine how anyone that hasn't done one of these before could rate any less than 5 stars, for us it was worth every penny and almost every second!

Great alternative activity in Prague. We visited the Occultica Room as a stag group (10 people), it was an activity to fill a few hours on our final day. It was money well spent, the time ticks a lot quicker than you would expect, there seemed to be enough challenges to keep everyone in the group occupied. We got close to finishing but just missed the time window, we did also need to ask for a couple of hints. You really do need to stop and think... maths plays a part too.The staff were brilliant, I booked the original slot for the wrong time so we missed it. Mirek very kindly rescheduled without hesitation.I would definitely recommend this for anyone fancying an alternative to the normal activities in Prague.

First visit. I was first visit in this game. It was gift for my son. He like the game on mobil phone "The room", in real is something special..... Our slow start, we did not know what to do, but then it was quick to finish. We needed only one help. We made it before the time limit... :-)

Great location and exciting game!. With a group of 8 University schooled friends (aged mid 20's) we had a really great time playing this escape room. Definitely not too easy and a great theme throughout the whole game. You will need to work together as a team, otherwise you won't make it out of there in time. We had 12 minutes left. Great value for money for a big group of people.

Highly recommend - we escaped!. Great fun, the lady was very polite as they were running half hour behind schedule. We were 5, 25-30 year old and we we escaped with only 7 minute to spare. I thought the difficulty was spot on! Definitely worth doing while your in Prague, something different!
Amazing team building. We enjoyed it a lot and we can really recommend it even for the foreigners (all important pieces were also in English).

Rather basic escape room.. ...and quite easy, for the experienced players. I really like the rooms with some good story behind, not just the quests to open as many locks as possible without any good justificatin - this one is unfortunately lacking a history (although it wouldn't be difficult to find one). There is one piece of the equipment we liked the most (won't reveal what it is in order not to spoil the fun) and actually we had even time using it for way longer than intended during the game.

Don't miss this place!. We stumbled across The Room purely by accident, booked it for the next day, and had the time of our lives! We spent 66 minutes in the room and another hour grinning. We were, what turned out to be a completely useless group of 2, but the lady organising the room took every sympathy with our cause and fed us some very helpful clues. 50€ well spent!

birthday outing to Occultica. my daughter took 9 friends along for a birthday outing. it was well organised and they enjoyed it although the Occultica Room really was too difficult for 11 & 12 year olds and so they did not finish in time.

Not bad but could be better. Not really worth the money we paid for. Some tasks were good and innovative, but overall we felt disappointed that there was no story behind the Room. SPOILER ALERT: The task with wooden stick and belt was too hard for someone who has not came to contact with such cipher before. No chance to solve it without asking for a help.

If you want to feel trapped, this is the place to go!. This was our third escape room in Europe and we loved it! We had a large group of four couples, staff was friendly and accommodating... It was So fun and pretty difficult but that's why we loved it! The decor was great and it really gave you the feel of being trapped!!!!! If you are ever in Prague it is a must!

Great Fun - Think outside of the box.. Fun Fun Fun for the whole family. Since you could ask for clues you never had to get stuck even though some parts where really challenging. Friendly and English speaking staff.

Lot's of fun even for larger groups - thouroughly enjoyed it. There were 8 of us and there's always multiple puzzles to work on so everybody can chip in. Was loads of fun and would recommend it to any group.
Fun & think. Advanced escape room, sophisticated, but still funny and with skilled and friendly staff. In a historic building in the heart of Prague.

Incredible experience¡¡¡¡. One entertaining and smart game. We were 8 people to find out it but we couldn't resolve it¡¡ Anyway we spent good and fun time, it is worth to go and try to go out from there. Totally recommended¡¡

Absolutely loved it!. I took five kids there between the age of 10-15 and we had a tremendous time as a group. Some of the puzzles were tough to solve and time was tight so we made sure we asked for clues whenever we felt we were a little stuck. We solved the challenge with 4 minutes to spare! Also, none of us speak any czech so it was fantastic to be able to play the game without having to use language and get the clues provided in English. We will definitely go for one of the other challenges next time we visit Prague.
Challenging. Very challenging and good escape room. Requires different skills and is a good game for larger groups.

Very exciting and mindblowing game!!!. It was our first experience playing escape game ever and we are very happy we have chosen TheRoom project! Our game guide was very polite and gave us clear instructions. The design of the room is great, with a lot of details you can interract with. The equipment was very nice, with different technologies and features. Overall, we enjoyed a lot this bright variety of puzzles and tasks! Deffinetly we will go to check thier second room! If you are in Prague, go and check it, its a lot of fun!

Crazy, fun and mindblowing room!. If you visit prague, and feel like challenging yourself , then THE ROOM is recommended. Our experience of the room was awesome! Unfortunately we havent solved the puzzle , but otherwise it was a really great time. Unique and fresh mindblowing puzzles to solve. Take the challenge and visit THE ROOM!
Amazing escape room. TheRoom is one of the great escape rooms in Prague. Got stuck a few times but afterall we made it out just in time. It was really fun.
Fantastic. It was really a great Way to entertain kids n adults..The guide was also very Nice n helpful. But you need to reach on time. We were there 15 mins earlier and it was not open yet.

Great entertainment for a small group. We have visited the Old room with parents of mine and with parents of my fiancée. It was great way how to entartain them and bring them some new shared experience. Some puzzles were quite easy when the others were complicated. The overall impression was very good. If you visit with older people do not forget to remind them to bring their glasses with them!

Great puzzle set up. With friends we played great escape game TheRoom. We found the first lock right ahead, but then get stuck trying to solve the puzzle like a an IQ-test. The adviser was great and when she saw we are stuck she offer kind help. After we decided to ask for a help (after half hour) we start solving the puzzles much faster, getting to know every key information has an item related to solving the problem. I would recommend to ask for a help if you are stuck longer than 5 min. We did not manage to open all locks in time, but plan to come again and finish it.

Occultica room. We went there as a office team bulding activity. It was our second one with the same team of coworker. We succeeded with only 2 minutes to spare!!! It was the hardest I have ever done but OMG was it a lot of fun. The room is big and full of challenges. We did need some hints but it didn't take away the fun we had.We were 6 and that is probaly the perfect number of player for this one.The only thing that could be improved is that usually, escape rooms have a introduction story. a Backgroup story on the room of what happened, or a story plot to follow. This one didn't have one. It could be nice to add one.
We had much fun !!. This place is aswom !It was challenging and fun. The ridels part hard and one need to think.The most good way to solve it fast is by team work. The administrator is helpful.

Fabulous Fun...Fabulous Location!!. This was the 2nd escape room our family played in Prague. Our first was at Questerland (Wizarding Room). We played the older room where you have to acquire 10 locks to escape the room. Our boys are ages 10 and 12 and found this one a little be harder than our other experience. That being said, both of our boys were able to solve some of the riddles and help us escape. The host was very friendly and engaging. She promptly provided hints when we needed them. The hints were also good...they were enough to help you get unstuck, but they didn't give away the entire solution. All in all we had a another great experience playing this game. I think the game room is also in a great location. It's located in the "lesser town" on the Prague Castle side of the river. The streets are a prettier walk. We visited the KGB museum afterward and had a great time. The tower on the hill and castle are also other sights you could include along with this room. Again, we had a great experience....I would recommend!!

Gave us a lot of fun and challenge . It was a lot of fun. I need to admit that it gave us a lot of challenges. We found the first key in 60 seconds but then we got stucked. We used some hints but even then couldn't manage to get it done on time.

New way of entertiment. Nice and helpfull staff. Was for the first time playing this kind of game. We really enjoyed it. Located close to historic part of Prague. Recommend to have a lunch at NOI restaurant on the same street. We will definately come to another room.

Great experience with escape games!. It was great experience to play escape game TheRoom in the Prague center. Quite hard and a lot of puzzles. You really need to cooperate as a team to resolve everything in given time!
Fun and challenging!. Went with 6 friends and had an amazing experience. Very well made rooms and enough puzzles to keep the whole group active. Absolutely recommend this place!

Solved with 47 seconds remaining!. After an initial mix up (we booked - and received confirmation of our booking in the larger site - only to be told upon arrival our party was not big enough to be able to complete that room and we should try their smaller room the other side of Prague), we were impressed with this escape game! A nice way to spend an hour of a cold day - with good puzzles and a welcoming host. Without the initial issue (of them confirming a reservation which detailed a party size not large enough to complete the room - losing us a few hours of our long weekend) this would have been 5* - please bear this in mind when booking.
The room. We really enjoyed it, 5 minutes more and we successfully finished the game, so I think 1hour and 30 minutes will suits more, however, we had lot of fun there and I recommend this game :)
great. was great fun, but difficult! we were 3 people and didn't so well because we went out the day before! but it was great fun and we got lot of tipps from our polite guide.
Good. Difficult game. Maybe some connections are not so evident.+ payment cards- children are charged as adults

Great fun that will definitely make your brain do some work!. I visited The Room at V Kotcich street, together with my 5 friends. The tasks were intelectually demanding, but fun at the same time, and it was interesting to see how our mind sets worked when we were required to work together as a team. It was evident that the organisers spent some decent time on putting the tasks together and although it was quite hard to figure out certain tasks, it was very rewarding when we did. Don't be afraid to ask the administrator for a bit of help; we didn't or not as much as we should have; and that sadly resulted in failure and not completing the whole mission. A great way to spend an afternoon/eve with your work colleagues or friends!

Challenging. This was our first encounter with an escape room. It was super fun and not that easy to figure out. I wish we would have asked for more clues..Some of it was too difficult for us. :) I would totally recommend it.
Challenging and a lot of fun!. This is a great opportunity for teambuilding. We had a lot of fun. It was challenging, intellectually demanding and simply super interesting. Highly recommended!

Challenging and fun. We tried Escape Room Bunkr 13 in Brno, with 8 players. It was our second experience and definitely a better one. Tasks were fun and challenging and every one was unique in a way. We had to take some hints but it didn´t take away fun from it. Staff might have been a little bit more into it. The overall experience would be 4,4/5.

Karmelitska 16. Went there to celebrate my birthday with my friends. It was our first experience with escape games.We had to ask for quite a few hints, but that didn´t ruin our fun anyway! The room was quite challenging for us and we loved it. Good luck figuring out what that piece of wood is good for ;)Skvělá zábava, vážně jsme si to užili.Upozornění: Je třeba ovládat číslovky v angličtině. V moderní době to asi umí v podstatě každý, ale pro jistotu, někoho by to mohlo zamrzet =)
The room v Karmelitské.. Don´t forget to take children with you, they are smart!Nezapomentě vzít děti, přijdou na hodně věcí...:-)

TheRoom Occultica. We visited the room Occultica with our 16 year-old students as it is the only escape room in Prague for a bigger number of players. It was a perfect experience, thrilling, playful, mysterious and brain-teasing. They cooperated, brainstormed, counted, touched things, tried and failed, but they made in the last minute of the time limit and it was a very rewarding feeling for them. :) Here are some of their comments:„I enjoyed the 77 minutes spent there, a good teambuilding activity and hard, but interesting tasks.“„It was really good. It was interesting to see how our class can cooperate.“„It was a great experience. I really loved when the game started to move, but we wouldn’t have solved it without the hints.”„I enjoyed it even more than I thought I would. I especially liked that there were many small riddles to solve and not just a big and impossible one.“

Challenge game!. My 14 year old son and 5 friends just spent an hour in TheRoom! It was his birthday 'event' and they had a blast! Through out dinner afterwards, on the way home and even now 3 hours later, he is still talking about how great it was! Just tough enough to make them struggle, just creepy enough to make the nervy! Fantastic!
Great experience . My wife and I did it 11 minutes before the clock runs out. Very good riddles, enjoyed it very much, would recommend for beginners.

I was there with my team from work and it was really great, we all enjoyed it. I was there with my team from work and it was really great, we all enjoyed it and I recomend it for others as good team building activity, especially now out of summer
Great fun. Well designed escape room. Excellent activity when visiting with friends. More fun than the Mucha Museum.

Great fun - something diffferent. This was a great new experience, we did it as a family of 4 our kids are 10 & 12. We all strugled to the last second , didn't quite make it but that didn't spoil the fun. Great way to break up the day from all the walking & sightseeing.
Great team building fun. It was a very cool experience. We tried TheRoom with my colleagues as part of a team building and we all enjoyed it very much! I can just recommend it to everyone.

Great fun. This was our first ever escape room and it really was great fun that made you use all the logic you can think of. It was our perfect start to escape rooms as the lady was very nice and gave the 2 of us some tips. We did the mind maze the following day and we found that a little more difficult and so in our view, this one is great for beginners.
Great fun. We did this with our 2 kids, ages 8 and 10. Needed some hints to get through but had lots of fun for the 66 minutes that flew by. Thumbs up from all 4 of us.
Entertaining. We had great time there. It is suitable for 5 people max. We were 3 and I think that was ideal. I believe it is also a great team building activity for a small group.

TheRoom. Visited TheRoom smaller venue near the castle (despite staying next to the larger venue) as there were just the two of us. Great fun. Didn't get out due to lack of combination lock skills!If going in group of two best to split up at certain times. Little tip! Think would be easier for a group of 4. Still highly recommended.

Amazing!. The Room Occultica is such a wonderful place to visit and engage in an escape quest at. It is a perfect place for you try to solve a large amount of very difficult puzzles in just 77 minutes and get out. The atmosphere the company had created is at a high level. Appropriate light mysterious music in the background, half–lit rooms, beautiful decorations... It is just an awesome meeting place for you and your family/friends to get together and communicate the best way you possibly can. 10/10.
Great experience. One of the most fun escape room in Prague. Its not hardcore hard which was fine and the receptionist was really amazing and helpful. Highly recommended !!

To escapes to make my day. I visited both of TheRooms escape games in Prague the same day with a group of friends. First we did the smaller room, which was fun and had really cool but simple challenges. Unfortunately, they had a technical difficulty with a part of the game which inhibited us from getting out on time. This was made up with the staff being super nice, not only regarding the game but also about our visit in Prague giving advice on places to got etc and most importantly to a 20% discount on their second room - which we ended up doing the same day.Occultica Room: Their biggest escape room was possibly the coolest room I've seen so far with complex, difficult but rewarding task and a lot of space. Our group had excellent time here and everything worked like dance. We had our hearts racing from excitement when we solved the locks and the feeling after solving the room was just awesome - this particular room made me a permanent fan of the escape games!!!In general their establishments were well designed and located in the centre of Prague, easy to find. The staff was not fun, friendly and professional. Great experience altogether and can recommend this to all groups interested in Room Escapes!

So much fun!. We had amazing time! It was tough but we made it, loved it! Totally worth recommending.Also the website says you shouldn't come early, so don't. There is no waiting space so you'll have to wait outside.

Occultica. Game for 4-10 people. In 77 minutes you have to find the key from this room. We made it in about 70 minutes in 6 people. It was our first escape game, so its difficult to compare, but its almost impossible to make it without hints and everyone will have something to do for whole time. If you like zodiac, you have to visit this room!
Awesome room. Very interactive and challenging escape room. Loved that the rooms and puzzles were linear and we had to do more than look for clues. Awesome challenge with lots of cool props.

The Room - Old World. It was our first experience with this kind of game. We were completely satisfied even we did not complete it:-) The service around was excellent, we had a gift voucher which I had ordered for Christmas.

Very Easy. This was one of the first escape rooms I did and to be honest probably the worst. The room was very easy and could be completed in about half the time allotted. It was fun solving the puzzles that were there but everything was completed so fast that no one in my group ever felt the pressure of the time counting down. If you are just wanting to do puzzles this room is fine but if you are wanting any sort of challenge than I suggest looking for a different live escape game.

Highly recommended - from a fan of escape games. We tried both the Old World and Occultica, solved the first one and failed miserably on the second, but had huge fun in both.Difficulty is well balanced and the progression of puzzles is very well thought. Very good variety of physics / letter / number / logic games. All game material in good conditions (no missing pieces, very little wear-and-tear which so often can ruin the experience)Both rooms are conveniently located: Old World is in Mala Strana in walking distance from the downhill station of the Petrin funicular, Occultica is very close to Narodni, near the Mustek subway exchange.Escape rooms in Czech Republic tend to be rather generous with hints if you ask for them, so make sure you don't abuse this possibility.
one of the best exit rooms in Prague. it is the biggest and the most interesting exict room in Prague, so real challenge! The tricks are verz diverse and need real team play. Great!
Realtime Quest. Do you love riddles?This is the place for you! Sophisticated, complicated, and great fun.very recommended.

Great fun. We (4 of us) played the "Old World" game, and managed to complete it in 62 minutes, thanks to some timely tips and quick thinking from the 2 teenagers in our group. Great way to spend an evening - a roomful of fun!
Occultica . It was a very interesting experience! A game where you have to think and cooperate and where you can really have lots of fun! I definitely recommend it:)

Excellent fun.. We visited The room with the company team - 5 members. Immediately after the arrival we were in the action. Finding all the keys and finally opening the exit doors was really nice. It was well prepared and complex. It provided us a great feedback how we coop in the team. We were talking about our success till the late evening and everybody was full of energy from this experience. Definetely I recommend this attraction for team development and cooperation. Thanks  Jan Pavelka

Man v Room. We are a family group (two couples, elderly parents and 6 month old child) and booked in the Occultica room as a respite from all the 'history and beer' that Prague has to offer.From the welcome/instruction/hints by Thomas, to the way the room was set up, the whole experience was excellent and professionally done.We have completed a similar one in Manchester and this one was much more difficult (although all the clues are there, you just have to find them) but also much more enjoyable. We all jumped in rushing from one puzzle to the next shouting encouragement and clues to each other on the way. We almost made it out too (the last unlock puzzle was fiendishly clever) but in the end the Room won.We had an absolutely great time and if the baby had pulled his weight a bit more we might of made it out in time. Definitely give it a go if you're in Prague.

Excellent game, very well done and great fun.. We were a group of 6 and did the larger room. There were lots of different types of clues, really clever and unexpected. We have done a similar type of game in the UK but this one was far more intricate and professional. Tomas, the host was so helpful and made us very welcome. Would highly recommend.

Great place!. We had a very though time there but at the same time we enjoyed it very much 👍 some of the parts were very hard to guess but others were easier and we were always happy when we got another key.

Great family fun. We had a wonderful time today at TheRoom. It is too hot to be outside in Prague this week, and the kids (ages 8, 11, 14) get tired of touring all the historical buildings. The guide was helpful with clues, but not so helpful that she gave the answers away completely. Though our kids are younger, I think TheRoom would be fun for just adults too. We managed to solve the whole puzzle, and the kids were so proud. This was one of the highlights of our week in Prague.

We Enjoyed the Room. It was worth visiting the Room during our trip to Prague. The staff is very welcoming and the clues to open the Room door were quite tricky and difficult, but very well studied. We really enjoyed our 60 minutes
tons of fun. Really enjoyed our time at The Room!This was our first escape experience. Will definitely try another and recommend to friends!
Cool teambuilding site. It is a great place for teambulding, funny and challenging in same time. However I was missing some story and connection between separate tasks.
amazing experience. First time trying a scape room, we really had a lot of fun. Actually we did not open the 10 locks but still we enjoyed a lot :)Also, the instructor was really friendly.

Great fun!. Our German friends doing exit games all around the Europe recommended The Room to us refering to be the best game they did so far so we tryed it. Although it was our first game we quickly get in it and were absolutely excited. The more locks you open the more thrilling it is. I loved it and will definitely try the Occultica room as well.

Perfect Morning Brain Teaser. Tried this experience with my sister while traveling through Prague. We booked it for around 11:00. Showed up a little early but were lucky that the controller for our appointment was so accommodating and let us start a bit earlier. I won't give away too much about the actual room, but it was a lot of fun though we needed some help on where to begin and throughout needed some help. Left the Room feeling mentally refreshed and ready for the day. Overall, a fun experience especially if you've never done something like that before and are in a new country and even more so if you started the day a bit tired and groggy. The rest of our trip in that city, felt like we should do that every morning.

Very interactive escape room, perfect for large groups. We were group of 7 people and we wanted to try something together, so we selected TheRoom Occultica. Simply, this escape room was amazing. Such a high level of creativity and interactivity we did not expected! Truly best escape room we have ever visited. The puzzles are excelently designed, everything is perfectly logical. Moreover you have to cooperate and communicate in your team. Great respect to designer!

Best of the Best. This was by far the most exciting escape room we visited in Prague. Also I have to add the that biggest and also the trickiest one. The level of thinking was pushed much further that I was expecting - completely a new level. Absolutely great escape room. 100% recommended.
Mindbending fun. We had a great time. The puzzles are excelently designed and test your logical thinking. If you want to have a great time while testing your brain, this is the place to go to!
The room. An amazing experience, where team work is needed. One advice - if you've found something that you can't use immediately, don't forget about it later! :)

great experience. My son (13), daughter (10) and I really enjoyed our first escape game. Unfortunately, my husband had to stay with our baby so he didn't join us. I believe we would be more successful then. We managed to find seven of ten keys with help from the moderator but we are still proud. As we planned to visit Prague we were trying to find something new and interesting for children after sightseeing which is a bit boring for them. So we managed to find it. They loved it as I did.

Awesome experience at The Room. My daughters, ages 10 and 7, my husband and I just spent an excellent 66 minutes in The Room. The puzzles were really challenging, and kept us thinking hard the entire time. We managed to find seven of the ten keys (with quite a bit of help from the moderator -- however, hints were just hints, and not full answer revelations, so we still felt pretty accomplished by the end). It has been the highlight of our European trip so far, and my daughter is begging to look for escape games in the other cities we'll be visiting. I would totally recommend The Room to anyone who likes puzzles!

Fantastic. Incredibly Creative!. We were a group of 8 friends so selected the Occultica room. We were not sure what to expect but wow was this escape room amazing. By far the most creative, innovative and interactive escape game I have done. If you have enough people to do this room try spare 2 hours to do it as you really will enjoy it. The design of the room is especially brilliant and you will understand what I mean if you do it. Really unique escape room this would highly recommend (i've done a few of these places and this one is special). Only thing I would suggest going forward is to invest or improve the signage outside the location. Apart from that good luck in the future! (Kudos to the designer).

STRANGE OLD WORLD. "Strange Old World" was the fourth escape game that me and my friends played in Prague. It was interesting. I really liked one "antique" puzzle. The staff was extremely friendly. However I did not really understand why it is called "Strange Old World". I was not impressed by the interior that much but my male friends liked it a lot. To sum it up, it is worth visiting!

AWESOME. The ROOM is awesome, really fun. You have 66 minutes to find the 6-7 main keys that allows you to leave, following clues and logic puzzles. Really well designed. The level of difficulty is perfectly set, not impossible but not easy. We managed it in 8 minutes to the end. The man who is in charge are watching you from cameras and can give you advise and help if you need it and say it. The game room THE ROOM was very interesting and the welcoming staff were great! We recommend it!
Great experience and lot of fun. My first experience with escape games and it was really great. We had lot of fun during the game. Unfortunately we passed the exam few minutes after the end
Better than our expectations!. If you hesitate to go or not, definitely go! We were expecting that we will open the door in 15 minutes but at the end we almost ran out of time. It was great fun!
66 minutes of great fun. This was our first escape game and we were absolutely thrilled. We can't wait to try another one. We can recommend this game to anybody who likes logic puzzles and good fun.

Great escape room and awesome atmosphere. We've had some escape room experience before this room, And this remain probably the best room we did so far. Everything is very well built and thought of. The design and atmosphere is great and adds a lot to the experience. The general feeling was that TheRoom is very accurate, and that this is how escape rooms should be build.You have 66 minutes to escape, more than in other rooms. We've escaped 8 minutes before the limit.Highly recommended!
Great. Best escape game in Prague ever. Good fun for a group of friends.My team done Escape without help :)

Great escape game with awesome atmosphere. Clever fun!. We were team of 4 people. We've had some room escape games before, this is definitely the best escape room we did so far. The design and atmosphere is great! Really love it.

Great experience and loads of fun!. First experience with the "escape" type of game and it was totally a great one! There were four of us and it made us cooperate, think hard and even though we didn't make it out in time, we had lot of fun. Some of the codes are easier, some harder, but don't worry, the Roomaster will give you some clue if you ask nicely :-)Can't wait for the opening of the second room!

Test your limits. There were 5 of us in the room thinking it would be no problem to get out. Yet, we were surprised to make it just in time, with only a few seconds left. Discovering the codes is a real challenge for your attention - linking objects, colors, shapes, pictures etc. that may be related is refreshing and fun. If you want to spend an exciting hour and get to know yourself and your friends better take the challenge and escape from the room - be a hero! The only thing you need to bring is your brain..

Amazing!. We are planning to visit all the exit rooms in Prague, this has been our second one so far. We made it in 5 people in 60 minutes but it has been really difficult and that's what we appreciate a lot! Me and my friends really enjoyed this experience and can't wait till the other one :) Highly recommended!

Great challenge. This was my second time in escape room (I was in NY), but for my husband and our friends it was first time. It was wonderful! We had fun and the way the puzzles were run was surprising and challenging. We managed to make it out with about 5 minutes to spare, and it was the highlight of our trip! Unique experience to have with friends - and the adrenaline rush of solving the puzzles :-)

Very nice room. So far, this is one of the best exit rooms in Prague I have been to. Very dynamic, many different tasks and if you are stuck, you get tips right on the screen, which is placed in the room, not by walky-talky as in many other e-rooms, and it spares you time. Definitely recommend.
TheRoom. That was really great. Fine way how to train your brain and have some fun with friends! I recommend it, you have to try it :)
!!!!. You have to go there! with your partner or boyfriend or sister... Its perfect feeling!So great!thank you!

Really great experience!!. I can strongly recommend this place for every brain teaser fan :) It was my second experience with an escape room, and I must admit that this one is much better than the "Lostroom" (that is also in Prague)! It is not only about finding the key but also about thinking and having fun. You have 66 min to escape, but it feels like 10 min, time runs fast here! I am looking forward for the opening of the new room :)

Marvelous. I am not a very experienced escape room freak, but after trying this one I guess I'll have to try some more.The atmosphere of TheRoom is superb and the best thing about it is that you get instant thrill from solving the riddles and trying to understand the hints. Well worth the visit.
Amazing experience. IT is one of the best Prague exit games. Inetersting to find the solution of each riddle. All the stuff in the room is used in game, there is nothing redundant.

Great experience. It was first time I have visited such activity and I was really amazed! Great, interesting, amazing experience. We enjoyed the game also with our kids (10, 12) however the tasks are aimed to older kids. Fantastic activity!

Love it! Great game and fun!. We had a great time while playing! We really - really enjoyed it. The game was thrilling and the setting was perfect. Getting everything afterwards explained was fun as well. I would come again for a next game any time...

Super fun for rainy afternoon. Without any similar previous experience we have visited this place with our small kids. The principle is to escape from the 2 rooms within 66 minutes time limit using clues and indices. It is great fun and energizing attraction. (and don't worry you might ask for help on the way ....)

Nice and clean escape room. We are heavy users of escape rooms, this one was very well done, especialy the second part with lasers and drums. The tasks were quite difficult, but we managed to escape:-) And unlike many other rooms, it wasn' t dirty, the black room looked realy nice.Thx for the fun in theroom guys:-)
Best escape game in Prague. Great game and interesting experience. Big challenge for everyone who likes adventure and escape games.

Best experience!. My partner and I did this and we had so much fun. It's such a great experience and we haven't stopped talking about it and how maybe we could've figured it out better etc. Was great and would definitely recommend it!!
Good fun. This was a good way to one of our days in Prague, we completed the Enigma mind maze in a pretty poor time, but it was good fun all the same, even better if a little tipsy!

This is perfect for a brain. I did The Alchemist's Chamber with my 2 children aged 7 and 11. We had so much fun that we went back 2 days later to do The Enigma Machine.Both games were really good. My daughter loved using the walky talky to get hints. The first one, we needed more hints then the second but we knew that made sense cos we had more experience the second time than the first. It is a great attraction and I highly recommend.

Great experience!. We were a group of 4 and tried the alchemists chamber. We ended up completing it in 1hr and 2 minutes. The staff was very helpful and accommodating, the challenges were fun,but also challenging. This was out first escape game ever, and we liked it so much that we tried another escape game the day after, and will continue to do so on our future vacations. There are lockers with keys where you can store your valuables during the challenge.The only thing that could have been better is if they had sold some light refreshments/snacks before/after the challenge. As we were all quite thristy after completion.

Fun activity, makes you think in different ways and directions. We visit the Alchemist escape room, which has a nice legendary story behind it. We enjoyed it so much, we were like little kids in a candy shop.

Very cool!!. We are a family of five people. We had such great fun at this place! We visited here back in April and it was our second escape room experience. We decide to play the Alchemist's Chamber and it was very cool. The hints were a bit challenging, but we managed. A nice experience overall, and the staff were very genial.
Great experience!. We went for the first time to a mindmaze and it was really fun. We managed to get out, the stuff was nice and friendly. We definitely recommend this place.

Absolutely amazing!. The high light of my Prague visit! Definitely worth going to! Few arguments with me and the partner throughout of who was right and wrong. Obviously I was right in the end! From the minute we walked through the doors the service we got was impeccable the finer details were met to the highest standard! It was that amazing we are going back again tomorrow! Massive thanks to the staff it was brilliant!

Great escape experience!. One of the best escape rooms I've seen so far. And I've seen a lot:) In general the room is very appealing and the atmosphere is just great. Every single detail is very cured and even if you are in a big group you will have a very funny time.

Place where the time passes by quickly. We attended Alchemists Chamber with my friend as our first escape game. We were welcomed by nice guy who explained us everything and the game could start. At the end we had mixed feelings. On one hand it was perfect - you totally forget about everything and focus on solving tasks. On the other hand at the end we were disappointed that it passed so quickly. Great place to have fun with friends and there are many cozy places around to continue discussion about solving rebus after you are done.

Fabtoulous . Brilliant would do it again fab experience
Works well as a couple and an group
Thumbs up
Would definitely go and try the other mazes again looks like a lot of fun
Brilliant staff

One of the best rooms we did !. We love escape games and go to rooms whenever we travel (and at home), so far we did more then 20 rooms and "Enigma" room was one of the best we did.
The staff was nice, the place was good and the game was fun :)

Really fun. We had a really good time doing the Alchemist Secret puzzle. The building is a little bit tricky to find but once you find it the staff are really nice. The staff explained how the game worked as we hadn't completed a room escape game like this before. We had a lot of fun but did run out of time before completing the puzzle. The staff member who helped us let us finish and gave us some clues so that we could finish. We do wish we would have been able to do it on our own but we just ran out of time. If you're looking for something fun and a little bit different to do in Prague then give this a go!

A very nice room. We are seasoned "escapers". We came to this room after extensive research to find a good room. We weren't disappointed.The room is somewhat challenging and provides a decent run for your money.Very recommended :)

Fun challenge and well arranged escape room. This was me and my girlfriends first try in an escape room and we were very satisfied with the experience. We challenged the Alchemist's chamber which were hard but manageable. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone that wants to try this kind of activity.
So much fun . As a family it's a great time to spend.. Fun and challenging ,sharing the ideas , you work as a team.. Love that kind of games.. It's suitable for all

Amazing experience in Mind Maze. We did the escape room with the work colleagues. We were 8 divided into 2 teams. We played the Alchymist s chamber. It was very entertaining hour and everyone enjoyed it. We had fun, adventure and at the end we escaped from the room.

Great fun!. Went here with a group of 8 so had the alchemist room for both teams of 4. The room was fun, very clever and got everyone thinking. You'd have to do this with 3 people minimum as some of the puzzles may take you longer to figure out and will make you lose time (assuming you don't want to use hints)After my team finished they even let us watch the team to see how they were getting along which was fun!We got a little magnet for finishing the maze, but only 1 magnet for 8 of us which was a bit of a let down. Overall, great game, great staff.
Awesome!!. The best part of our Prague trip!It was just amazing and mind blowing! Plus friendly and funny staff.
So much fun. This was my first escape game and i loved IT! Really good organized and fun theme! I regimend this for everybody

Very nice . It was really interesting and great. One hour as a minute. Children are allowed. They really liked it.
Recommended.

an amazing challenge. By brilliant to work as a team the staff are great and the challenges are really fun working in competition with your friends to see who gets out first this was the last part of the stag tour on the morning after nobody had a clue and it was excellent really recommend you spend the time if you are a large group and have some spare time great staff . Thank you!

AMAZING time sure to bring anyone closer together!. This was my second time visiting the mind maze. This time I went with three of my friends and we all had an amazing time. It really wakes up your mind and forces you to cooperate with your teammates, which brings you closer to one another. It's an amazing activity and I would reccomend it to everyone.

Loved this experience. I was a bit apprehensive about this and whether I would enjoy it but it ended up being my favourite part of the holiday. The room was just difficult enough to be challenging, without feeling impossibly hard, and we had great fun working out how to get out. Absolutely loved it.

Unique & Refreshing! . Our first visit to Prague included a lot of sightseeing and touristy activities but I'm SO glad we decided to fit this in on our short break. I'd never been to anything like it before and I was so amazed. We completed the alchemist themed room which we struggled with and needed clues all the way through but it was so much fun and I would definitely recommend this for anyone visiting Prague in the future! Refreshing fun for adults!
Super nice place!. I have visit around 5 different countries to play this game and this was a really good one. 100% recommended!Regards

An awesome WW2 adventure!. Myself, my fiance and my Dad chose to do the Enigma room. It was so much fun! A cool layout, lots of clever and intricate puzzles and problems to solve. A good challenge and definitely not easy, a great way to get the brain working :) Nice guide too, who was on hand to offer one or two hints when we needed them, without solving the whole thing for us. A bit of a walk from the centre, but definitely worth it!

Amazing time!. My partner and I did the alchemist's chamber and absolutely loved it. The puzzles were really creative and clever - a great mix of science and magic and fit the theme really well. It was the first escape room we had ever done. It wasn't too hard but it definitely got us thinking! We made it out in just over 57 minutes with one or two hints - and most of the time we were just missing obvious things or misreading something. Can't comment on the enigma room but would have loved to have done it if we had the time. We thought it was verging on a little pricey for two people, but if you went with a slightly larger group then it would be really good value for money.

Terrific experience. Highly inventive escape room with very creative puzzles, all nicely linked to the alchemist theme of the one we picked. Level of technicality is pretty impressive. It's a bit of a walk though from the city centre (a quick and cheap taxi ride), but certainly more than worth it and truly recommended as an original activity while in Prague.
A great escape room . It was simply wonderful, our guide was really nice and the puzzles were hard to solve and the decoration was awesome!

A great way to twist your brain and trim your teamworking skills!. It's a tad out of the way (but still central), but if you're into the whole "Escape Room" thing, then this place is another great one to try out.Me, my fiancé and another couple only intended to try out one room; the Alchemist's Chamber, but once we finished that room just before time ran out, we quickly realized we had to try it again, and booked another appointment for the Enigma-room later the same day! The Enigma-room is supposedly a little harder, but we boys found it to be easier to crack than the first room we tried. Perhaps because we had gotten warmed up by then. The staff is really friendly and forthcoming, and they'll help you decide which room to pick if you ask them.It all really comes down to your thematic preferences; would you rather try to escape a room set in a medieval fantasy world, or a World War 2 PoW scenario? Either way, you won't be disappointed, and you might end up booking another room like we did.Apparently, they're also in the process of making one or more new thematic rooms. If we ever return to Prague, this will be one of the first places we're guaranteed to revisit.

Mindboggling. We were trying to kill time while waiting for night train. However I would do this activity again, it was so much more than a time killer. Truly a fabulous experience, really well done and set up! Great staff and friendly service, we appreciated being able to keep luggage in office while we enjoyed the MindMaze.

Fun activity! . Me and my boyfriend booked this on the recommendation of everyone else on here. It was a really well thought out activity. It was challenging but with some hints, it was clear enough what you had to do. We actually ran over time a bit, but because we started early, they let us carry on 10 mins or so, til we got out. We actually found it fairly difficult, and needed more hints than we were expecting - I think it's because we were over thinking all the clues, when really they're fairly explicit. I would recommend doing this in a group bigger than 2 - to ensure you get through in time. This has inspired us to want to try more escape games - so thanks for that!

Great fun. One of the best escape rooms we have ever visited, the puzzles were diverse, challenging and fun to solve. The employee who took care of us was very nice and spoke great English. Definitely worth its price!

This you gotta try!. This started out in a bad way as there was a mix up with our reservation and we didn't get our game on the planned evening. But this I assume is very very rare and should not impact the rating of what is truly a very very fun thing to do.I will spoil any of the secrets in the secret chamber but just tell you that you get a good instruction (short but precise) and then you are let in the room. There are cameras hidden and if you get stuck you will get a hint via the walkie talkie you get equipped with.I went with my daughter and that was really fun to see how we could supplement each other in the solving of the many puzzles.Time: 59:41 - so we did it (barely)I recommend this highly - and had I had the time I would have done the Enigma game also

Alchymistva komnata. Navštíveno jako teambuilding, v podastatě má druhá úniková hra. Povedené prostředí i úkoly. Hezká zkušenost !!!!Visited during teambuilding. My 2nd exit game in Prague. Nicely done, cool theme and headbreaking puzzles. Thank you for lovely experience with escape games in Prague.

First escape game. Our first experience of an escape game was really good. Was impressed by the theme and lay out of everything as I hadn't really known what to expect. We done the Alchemists chamber and it was set up like something from 1600s. Was fortunate we had a good mixed group of 4 with different approaches so we managed it in 47minutes. It helps to have a few problem solvers on your team as well as lateral thinkers. (Although you get audio prompts if you get really stuck. As the staff watch you on camera) personally I managed to unlock a few of the padlocked cases and find a few items. However as a result of a wild night I was feeling unwell so couldn't enjoy it as much as I'd have liked. You need to go in feeling fresh and prepared for a challenge. I can't wait to do my next escape game. Thanks!

Really good fun. It was a really fun game. We had to try to scape from a jail and into the bad guys office and steal some submarine blue print. All resembling the setting of world war II. We played the escaping game with our 8 month old baby... It wasnt ideal to have her around cause she wanted some attention so some precious time was lost, but it was not a big issue. Overall what i am trying to say is that it was great fun. So if you are in prague do not let anything stop you from enjoying an escaping game. Not even little kids!

We had a great time!. My friends and I really had an amazing time doing the Alchemist Chamber. The level of difficulty was perfect and the challenge bound us together even more :) Would highly recommend it!!

20 seconds till the limit - but we did it!. We tried Enigma Game and it was really well planned and thorough game with many many interesting riddles. We literally got out 20 seconds before the end of the time limit, so we got our adreline running! Totally recommend it :)

Brilliant. We booked the Mindmaze in advance and it was brilliant, it was really well thought out and made you think what to do next, 60 minutes goes very fast, you have to work as a team, i think everyone who has a go leaves with a smile on there face, thoroughly recommend it.

Fantastic. I went there with my partner as this was part of my birthday trip.
I would defenetly recommend it to anyone who likes games with an interesting twist.

Good challenge. The escape room wasn't the most challenging we have ever done (we have done 4 now in a team of 2) but it was really enjoyable. We still needed a few hints so it was well balanced in terms of difficulty. Our guide, George, was excellent. The venue is well located pretty much in the centre of Prague, we had to walk about 20 minutes to get there. Recommended :)

Very Fun & Exciting. We played Enigma and it was very fun. Staff were very friendly and nice. The game itself was challenging and exciting. Definitely recommend for visitors in Prague, you won't regret it.
First time an Loved it!! . Was wicked, never done it before an there was 10 of us split in to two groups. Really well put together! Bit hard to find, but well worth it!!

Fun and Challenging. This was my first experience with an escape room and we had a great time. We did the Alchemist room and it was just the right amount of challenging. Daniel was our guide and did a great job of explaining the beginning of the game to us and gently guiding us when we needed 1 clue. We were able to escape the room in 52 minutes. We had fun and would definitely try the other room at Mind Maze. It was a nice way to spend some of the afternoon.

Challenging and entertaining. We did the Alchemist's Chamber and it was particularly challenging for 2 persons as there is a lot to do but it was a very enjoyable experience. It is important to note that the place is rather hard to find. It is in an old and charming apartment building on a short street full of residential buildings. There is a small sign placed on the pavement that is hard to notice.

Challenging . We visited the mindmaze in Prague on our weekend trip. The chamber looked simple at first, but als time passed it got more complicated and more interesting. We had a great time in de alchemist chamber and even together couldn't finish in time (we made it soon after though). It's very challenging and it really triggers your mind to work at full force. We had a blast and the staff was very friendly and spoke proper English. I certainly want to come back for the other chamber!

Fun activity for all. We tried the alchemist room and this was our first experience in an escape challenge. We didn't complete it in time but it was still fun along the way and we were able to finally figure out the game with some helpful hints from Betty. We're highly recommend it for groups including families with teenage kids to give them a chance to think on their feet and be creative. Not sure what it would normally cost to do this but it was 1400k (about $60USD) which seems like a fair price. Take the A line to Nimaste Miru stop and walk about 7 minutes downhill.

Awesome Experience. The building itself is situated relatively far out from the city centre and doesn't look like much, but don't judge a book by its cover! My group I went with did the Alchemists Chamber and it was great fun. Some pretty complex challenges involved but very varied, and it's always a great feeling when you figure something out! We did it with just under 4 minutes to spare and the last 5 minutes were definitely a rush! Would definitely recommend (though perhaps not when you're too hungover!)
Excellent!!. Had a great experience, i've already been in a couple and this is the best one i have done.. Highly recommended!!!

Pure escapism!. We did the Alchemist room which was quite a challenge. Staff were very helpful and their hints were useful. The atmosphere to include decorations were taken out of the 16th century. We are family of 5 people to include small children and we all had a great time. There is no need to understand the Czech language. We will surly come back to try the second room!
Enigma was great. The four of us really enjoyed the Enigma room. Well themed exit game with nice challenging and varied puzzles to solve. Well worth a visit.
10/10 would escape again. We were with 5 and all had a great time trying to figure out how to solve the puzzles they had set up for us to escape the room. Genuinely nice staff and a decent challenge.

Highly recommended, great fun. My husband and I had a brilliant time at Mind Maze. We completed the Alchemist Chamber In the morning and enjoyed it that much that we decided to do the Enigma room as well. We preferred the Alchemist Chamber because of the clues.Very well thought out, great props. Good fun all round. Friendly staff. Well worth a visit.Thank you!

Very first escape room experience. This was the first time we ever did an escape room and it made us want more! We chose the Alchemist's chamber. Instructions were clear for us newbies and we had a lot of fun solving the various puzzles in the room. You have so much to do and look for that the 60 minutes are over sooner than you expect.

Brilliant!!!. Best Break Out Room yet! Excellent props and well thought out puzzles. The ambience is top notch, I highly recommend this for families with kids or teens or a group of adults. A must see in Prague, staff was very friendly and accommodating.

Came out buzzing. We tried the Alchemist's Chamber as our first ever escape puzzle challenge, with another couple. We managed to escape in under 47 minutes. It certainly helped that we all have different ways of working through problems. We were so pleased with our efforts that we immediately signed up for the Enigma the same day. And we managed to succeed in this mission too. Very good fun and we all managed to contribute to the game. The puzzles are well thought out and brilliantly executed and you only need your brain power (no muscles). Was money well spent and has whet our appetite for more!

Mind blowing!!!. We'd heard of escape rooms and this popped up when we were looking at things to do in Prague. We booked through Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. We did the Alchemist's Room and loved it. Needed a few hints just to start us in the right direction but managed to get out in the nick of time. The team were very helpful and puzzles were great. Had the Enigma room been available straight after we would have done it for sure. Well worth the money.

Great time had by all of the family . I really recommend this. We are a family of four with two teenage girls and for the time that we were in the chamber, we worked together to find the clues. Highlight of Prague; and no crowds!

Amazing!. We visited as a family of four (two adults, two boys aged 13 and 15) in early Aug 2016. Found the place based on Tripadvisor recommendations and it did fully live up to the expectations from the great reviews!The puzzles you have to solve to escape are really well thought out and play to the strengths of both young and older - teamwork is essential and as a family this was outstanding activity! The setup is also really professional - there is video surveillance of all the rooms and the staff provide helpful hints if they see you run stuck and help you finish the game with a feeling of having succeeeded.The staff are superfriendly - we had booked a 1030 start time and showed up a bit early but were allowed to start the game right away. By far the best experience in Prague and well worth the 1400 CZK charge. Compared to most other things you can do in Prague for that amount of money I would consider it a bargain!

Great mystery. An incredibly witty and fun experience. We came here with my English boyfriend (me being Czech) and we had so much fun. Everything was perfectly prepared, the problems were complex but there were enough clues for us to eventually figure it out. Got out in 56 minutes, just in time!

enigma is cool!!. There are many escape rooms about would war 2. However, Enigma is the best one which really bring me the feeling of agent because you will use many tools about the war of information. That's really great!!
Super nice puzzle. This puzzle is truly something extraordinary. Its a must try. For people who love geocaching or puzzle games, this puzzle room is highly recommended
Enigma. It was 1400 CZK (£46) for 6 of us. It was worth it. However if it was 2 of us maybe not. We got it In the end (with hints) Would recommend.

Engaging and exciting!!. A family of 5 (2 teenagers and a 12 yrs) tried this for fun since it was located on the parallel street of our apartment. And that was the best spent one hour ever!! The concept is excellent, the room and equipment are credible and the host was very friendly, good in English and eager to help us when we were stuck. Something we were a lot :-). But we managed to find the Philosopher's stone and get out of the room before the time ran out. Unfortunately we don't have time to do the other room, but next time we visit Praha we definitely will be back.

Great Experience!. Our first visit to an Escape Room and didn't know what to expect but we loved it!!! Family with 2 boys (13 & 17) and we actually stopped arguing for 60 mins, worked as a team and escaped from the Enigma Room with seconds to spare. Good job Betty was there for some clues though! Would recommend and can't wait to do another escape room somewhere... Just wish we had enough time to do The Alchemist's Chamber.

Very creative puzzles, super cool!. It was one of the best rooms I did (I visited 2 in Holland en 3 in Prague already). Very creative puzzles in the Alchemist room. Not very difficult, If we knew beter the time we hadn't asked for hints. You can come out in time without hints. But really awesome go there. And really cheap only €15 per person, we were with 4.

Found the philosopher's stone!. Very enjoyable game.Kept our family of 4 engrossed for the hour.Will be hard to follow for younger kids (under 10) I think. But kids are pretty smart these days, so I don't know :)Satisfying at various steps, and especially when you solve it!Game master Betty was super nice.Thank you, Betty and team.
Alchemist's Chamber. Alchemist's Chamber was very well made. We didn't manage to get out within the time limit, but had a great time anyway.
Fantastic activity in Prague. I did the Alchemist room with 4 friends and LOVED it! The room was a little warm but what an excellent way to kill an hour with friends. Highly recommended!

We loved it!. It was our first escape game and we totally loved it! The Alchemist's chamber was awesome, puzzles weren't easy and it was so much fun. Enigma was a bit easier for us but still fun. Especially the beginning. :D The staff was great too!

Good place to go. We did the alchemists chamber and it was really fun. I went with family and we had a great time. You have to try to find the philosopher's stone. We failed to get out on time but it was still very good. The location is also OK.

Best Escape Room I've Done. Without a doubt the highest quality, wellthought out escape room that I've done. This was my third and all were different companies. Mindmaze pulls it off exceptionally well. All of the props were originals or high quality and everything worked so smoothly (ive been to escape rooms where there were errors). Well done Mind Maze. I will be back!

Family fun. We were Mum, two daughters, god daughter and friend. We really enjoyed the Alchemy room, we laughed, struggled and eventually found the philosopher's stone and a way out of the room, we were, 11 - 49 and all enjoyed it is as much as each other.
absolutely recommendable fun. we had real big fun - we played the Enigma Room (family: 2 adults, 3 kids) - challenging - an awful amount of fun - if you have the time and opportunity: do it!
exciting, fun, endorphins booster !. it was awesome, stressful (in a good way:), great support from staff, super fun we want to do it again!!!

The most fun I had in this city. Playing MindMaze was the single most fun I had, while I were in Prague. We played the Enigma Room with 5 People which was challenging but an awful lot of fun! I wont spoil anything so there is only one thing left to say:
If you have the opportunity, do it!
Great Hour. Great hour of fun. Difficult but not impossible escape - we enjoyed Alchemists Chamber so much, we went back for Enigma!

Loads of fun and problem solving!. We had a blast doing the Alchemist's Chamber. We were 2 adults and 2 kids aged 10 and 12. While it wasn't meant for kids at all, they were super helpful and had so much fun helping out (honestly they were better than the adults). If we lived here we would definitely do the Enigma room, as after you do one maze, you will want to do more! It was challenging but not unsurmountable. The room setting was very impressive, and it was more interactive than I expected. Highly recommend, you won't regret it. The staff was great as well.

Great pastime when tired of sightseeing. If you read this review so you're looking for some exciting experience no matter whether you're a tourist or a Prague resident. You got to the right place. MindMaze's Alchemist's Chamber was created the way you can enjoy yourself solving challenging puzzles in a limited time. There were seven of us so we booked both Alchemist's Chambers for the same hour and split into teams. That's a great opportunity for large groups, you can even compete. Most of us weren't first time players so we were fast, smart and creative =) Despite this we barely made it in an hour -- the level of puzzles makes your brain sweat. And we really love it. The scene is quite authentic. The staff is friendly and helpful. The hints you get from them are always allegorical which makes it more interesting. It's a pity you can't make it one more time but we're looking forward to making Enigma room during our next visit to Prague.

First experience and we are now addicted . This was our first experience with the escape room games and we are now totally addicted. We have told all of our friends and are now looking at all of the other places to play. Now we have been to a few and mindmaze does an excellent job, so whether this is your first or tenth time you will love your time here! It is fun and imaginative.

Mindmaze magic. Absolutely loved visiting my first real life maze game. The staff were extremely friendly and provided assistance where necessary. Would recommend to anybody. Good way to spend a few hours. A++

A fun experience. Small room and amount of puzzles compared to others that i've done, but the puzzles are more involved and you do need to spend extra time on them. We struggled with a couple of puzzles, i'm not sure if that is because a lack of clues or the puzzles trying to be language independent.
FUN. amazing experience and a very friendly and helpful staff!! enigma would be great too thats for sure. must do !!
Amazing!. We did alchemist chamber. It was really challenging. Fun for all of us. Absolutely recommended. 5stars from 5. :-) We really enjoy it. Hope to visit enigma room soon.

Amazingly interesting!. We were four friends, in Alchemist chamber. It was one of the most interesting maze we had ever experienced. Loved all the challenges,pretty hard one. You should pay attention to all the details in the room, try to find clues, connect mysteries.

Challenging and fun!. We did the enigma room. We would definitely recommend it to people who are looking for a challenging but entertaining adventure! The staff was extremely energetic and helpful. Language barriers weren't an issue at all in completing the room as we do not speak Czech. We have done a number of rooms similar to these in the past and this place is one of our favourites. Whether you are with a great and going as a couple, you will have a lot of fun!

Awesome!. We are a couple that love escape rooms. We did many rooms in Israel and somehow got bored because everything started to feel the same. Not in Mindmaze! The room is very interesting, challenging and fun. Also the price is very good for this attraction. Very recommended!

Totally Amazing. Reminded me of the childhood television show crystal maze. This one we tried the 16th century set-up. Me and my wife were locked into an alchemist's chamber and then the next 60 min it was really stories unfolding. We were able to find the philosopher's stone though with an extra 5 minutes and few hints. I will not give any spoilers of what is there in the room, but if you are in Prague and want to try something different on vacation, just go for it.
great team bonding experience. well it was our first time voluntarily walking into a jail cell :) very fun and involved puzzle, hints are provided if needed. would definitely recommend!

AMAZING time!!!!. We have never done an escape room and I have to say we loved it! It was perfect and they were very helpful when we needed it! We did do it in 55 minutes but we had to have help. The staff was very nice and helpful! I wish we had time to do another one. Also, you cannot beat the price!

First timers . This was my first time doing an escape room experience and oh boy was it tough. The number of times we had to ask for a hint and still be confused is quite embarrassing but would I do it all over again? Definitely! It was such a unique adventure and a great way to spend an hour. We didn't have a reservation, however luckily they had an opening for three hour later so we ventured and came back after a while. Next time around I definitely know the mindset needed and hopefully we'll manage to escape !
4 vs 4 - excellent. We had a very good time playing there, we've been warmly welcomed and everything was arranged as we had asked

Beilliant. As a couple booked the philosophers stone room, my boyfriend wasn't too keen on the idea first but once in we both absolutely loved it. We were however pretty rubbish and had to be given a couple of hints. It was so much fun!! It's the first one we have done and I will certainly be looking out to do the other room!

Mindmaze Prague . So much fun . Great activity with us all working together to work out the clues managed to complete the challenge just before the hour was up. Going to be one of those memories to treasure

We really enjoyed, but with some important notes. We had a great experience and enjoyed the game very much. However, we would like to comment that there are some puzzles that are a bit arbitrary and cannot be solved without help from the instructor, so it isn't possible to proceed only on your own. Furthermore a few things that were not supposed to move or fall did exactly that without us barely touching them and after the game we felt kind of blamed for it which was not very nice and embarrassing.So we really enjoyed the game but there was room for improvements in the game and the treatment to the players.

Perfect!. Lovely experience! We played the philosophers stone game, which offered challenging puzzles in an enchanting fantasy setting. Great for beginners and adventure game enthusiasts alike! As an added bonus the game leader in an extremely likable guy!

Exciting and fun! . We've been to at least 3 different escape rooms in the past and this one was the best! All riddles were constructed perfectly and it was challenging and rewarding :) Awesome place!
Amazing experience!. It was my first escape room. It exceeded my expectations. Great staff, interesting rooms, fun for both family, friends and couple.Recommended for all!!

So much fun!. My girlfriend and I thought we would give the philosophers stone game room a go, having never done a break out game before and not knowing what to expect this was amazing, so many little intricate things to fiddle out that eventually allow you to break out of the room. We had such a kind lady that set up the game for us and gave us a walkie talkie incase we needed any tips or hints.I would more than recommend this for most people, we did it just the two of us but it could work well with a small group too.

Highlight of Prague Trip!. This was my first experience with an 'Escape the Room' adventure and it couldn't have been better! My boyfriend and I were a little nervous since it was our first time but within minutes we were absorbed. We did the Alchemy room and all of the clues were super clever; whoever thought this up was genius! It can be done in teams of 2-5 and I think any group would have a great time. We liked it so much we tried to book the Enigma room for the next day but it was full. This was not touristy at all but was my favorite part of my weekend in Prague.

Very Impressive . Dear Mindmaze team. Your Room enigma is outstanding. Your quests have been unique and fascinating and not just a copy of anything else. We have been two players and managed with three hints to do it in time. We had heart beating and enough adrenalin for the rest of the night. Your staff is super friendly and funny, as well. We are looking forward to come back to Prague to play your other room. Can't wait for that.

Take an hour out of walking around Prague to attempt an escape at MindMaze. The two rooms at MindMaze, Alchemist and Enigma, both significantly exceeded my expectations. The rooms are very well done with clues around each turn and sometimes easy to overlook suggestions and hints. The Enigma room is more difficult. We did Alchemist first and then took those learnings into Enigma. If you can, do both rooms.

A fantastic experience. My boyfriend and I had a go at the Enigma room. We were a little worried at first but it was so much fun and we had a laugh. It really shows if you can work together or not! The staff that work there are very friendly and our lady was very understanding and helpful and unfortunately we didn't make it out!! I definitely recommend having a go and see if you can escape!!

A Brilliant Experience!. I booked the Enigma Room for my husband and I to try. At first I thought the hour was going to drag as I'm not really into military things, but boy was I wrong. This was one of the highlights of our trip to Prague!I can't say too much, other than it was a brilliant experience! The set up, challenges and atmosphere not just showed us how well we work together, but it was also amazing fun. We started the game thinking "OMG, how do we get out of here", but surprised ourselves by managing to escape the room. Only wished we had more time to do the other room!
Fun guranty. Unforgettable activity with students!They asked to do it again the following day but was fully booked!

Interesting and Fun. We were 3 people to enjoy the search for the philosopher's stone. Having experienced escape rooms in the past the MindMaze Prague crew uses some techniques in their puzzles that prove to be challenging but fun to solve. The room is decorated to enhance the atmosphere. Overall it was a great experience and we can highly recommend the visit at this location.

Great experience. We (4 guys), never had done a room escape game before. Starting doing so in Prague was a great decision.We did the enigma room escape and it was so much fun. Challenging puzzles that really awakened our curiosity and ambition.

Great Fun!. We went as a group of 5 and have played other escape games, in the UK. This one was excellent, easily the best I've done. The set up of the rooms was really convincing and there was great attention to detail - the décor and the puzzles were themed really well around the time/story of the room (we did the alchemists one and liked it so much we came back a few days later for enigma). The puzzles were really clever and not just working out codes for padlocks - there were magnetically sealed boxes, decoding puzzles and even one involving morse code and an actual telegraph machine. Really, really enjoyed it. Friendly staff and well thought out, even the methods of communicating with your 'handler' felt quite natural and in-keeping with the theme (in enigma). Also - very very cheap considering. About £7 each for the five of us.
Great escape game!. We played the Alchemist's Chamber, it was all nicely set up, well structured and a lot of fun to solve
