The game requires good communication and team work so it's a great activity for a date night or small group of friends. We're both competitive people, who are good at puzzles, so we were surprised about how challenging the scenario was (which made it especially fun). We received the perfect amount of help when we got stuck and definitely recommend this activity. It is well worth the money and time!

Fun and logic. We read about it on tripadvisor and went there without an appointment. We luckily found a spot! The guide was so friendly and spoke very good English. He was helpful before, during and after the game. We were sad we could not finish it but we did not feel the 60 minutes passing. Maybe if we were 3 it could have been easier.

My first attempt at a "puzzle room" was really fun with MindMaze!. We were a two people and we tried the alchemist room.The theme was really good, the puzzles were challenging and it took us nearly the entire hour and a couple of clues to solve it.We were very happy with the nice attitudes of the host and the online booking was smooth and easy.
Extremely Fun Experience. We played the alchemist room and it was really fun and exciting. Tony was our guide and he was really nice and kind. I would really recommend this to others!!!

Extremely exhilarating! . We booked the Alchemists Room! Was a bit hard but had some help and tips from Tony the staff! ^^ So much fun! The 4 of us managed to do it just in time, with just about 30 second to spare! Tony was extremely friendly and helpful! Definitely recommend this!

Exceeded my expectations. I booked two Alchemist Chamber rooms last Saturday so my friends and I could compete against each other. This was by far one of the most unique and fun experiences I've had. It beats any sort of touristy activity here in Prague. We were a large groups of adults in our 20's and it was still challenging enough that it kept us on our toes the whole time. In fact, my team barely made it out in time. If you are looking for something super original to do with friends I highly recommend MindMaze! The staff were also very nice which is a huge bonus.

Best of Prague!. This was so much fun! Our family (with two teenagers) really enjoyed the spy escape game and immediately wanted to do the other one too. This really was one of our favorite activities on our trip to Prague.

Thrilling fun if you like puzzles/mind games!. We did Alchemist's Chamber and it was really fun! We did have to ask for some hints because we were panicky about time running out, but we made it out with 12 minutes remaining. The hour does fly by, and well put together. Highly recommended.

All ages enjoyed this. Our family of 10, ranging from age 4 to 66 all enjoyed the Alchemist's Chamber. We used two rooms and split our group up. The puzzles and clues were great fun and Tony and Rebecca were quite attentive, offering clues if we wanted them. Really fun and a great value

Must do activity!. The room called enigma was so fun, we were a group of Five trying out this escape the room game, for the first time. I really recommend this, it's cheap & central and once you've done it you want to try it out again...
Fun brain-training. Very tricky and fun pastime, if you get stuck, you get hints to keep on and it's ideal for rainy days, as it is indoors.

Mindmaze in Prague. We tried the alchemist's chamber with a group of friends.
It was a very funny activity during our last day in PragHighlue.
Highly recommended!

Absolutely fantastic!. Such a great afternoon. We arrived 15 mins late as we couldn't find it, but they happily welcomed us and let us play. I had never done an Escape the Room before this one and I think this was a great place to start. Definitely a challenge, but not so hard you felt lost at any point (walker talkie was a good idea too). 100% recommend.

So much fun!!!. We (a couple) did the Alchemist's Chamber and we couldn't recommend it more! It was so much fun!! There was definitely enough puzzle-solving to fill the hour. We wish we could have gone back to do the Enigma challenge. Thank you for a great time, MindMaze!!
Enigma is quite challenging .... Great fun, very professional staff, easily accessible location & awesome challenge. We loved it ! ….and escaped :-))))

Very challenging!. Me and my friends visited the "Enigma" game and we had so much fun!!! We managed to escape in 53 minutes. It was really challenging. I have already visited more escape games and this one is one of the most difficult...I would definitely do this one in more people than just 2.

Did both rooms - fantastic fun!. I visited Mindmaze with my husband in April, and we loved the alchemist room so much that we came back before leaving Prague to do the enigma room!Both rooms are challenging and really fun, in different ways. The challenges are really well mixed between logical and physical puzzles, and you really do need to work as a team to get through them!
Amazing fun. We had so much fun we came back later that day to do a different maze. It was a blast that I would recommend to anyone
Team Building Activity. Very nice and enjoyable activity for team bulding event. Well accessible, good facilitaties and service.

Great for two people - a little to easy for more. I'm a bit of a fan of these puzzle games, it's really great fun to do the in a new city and this one was pretty good although a little too easy, we (2 people) completed the alchemist room in a little over half an hour, it might be because we have done a few different ones though. I felt the room was laid out very well, the decorations were nice and there were some pretty cool electronics in the puzzles. The room was well researched as well, I visited the alchemy cave the day after and the history of Prague was well represented in the room. I thought it was very nicely thought out.Rebecca was lovely, a bit shy but explained the rules very clearly. You get a magnet at the end with your time and they send you a photo which I thought was a great touch. I'd recommend doing the room as a couple.

fun & new way to entertain kids. great for a rainy day!. enjoyed this new experience with group of children aged 10-15. well organised, ran on time, plenty of help when needed. english spoken. group of 4 best size to get most of the challenges. it takes a few minutes to get into it, but you come out buzzing. happy to return for the other challenge.

A Lot of Fun! Aboslutely a must do!. I was there with family, 2 adults and 2 teens. It was our first escape Room. We tried the alchemist chamber. It was created very lovely and the puzzles won't be simple as you get closer the finish. But it was a great fun for us and it's possible to arrive the finishline in time. So if you have time and you have fun in solving puzzels in a Team, you should try this.

Absolutely brilliant! A must do!. Fun, challenging, and so annoying haha. Really gets your mind going, we completed the first maze and enjoyed it so much we booked again for the second maze for the following day. I wish we had these in London. Would highly recommend for any groups visiting Prague.
100% Fun. We enjoyed this puzzle game. It was a great way how to spend the evening. You have a choice from two themes. We tried both of them and it was really fun.
Exciting. It was man first Time that I tried something like that! But it was Great.. It is Not to difficult but you have to think!!! It is a must-visit!

Fun and challenging. We enjoyed a team building adventure and really enjoyed the fun and challenge. We picked mindmaze, because they offered to exact rooms which aloud us to create two teams to race against each other. Great fun and a great team building activity.

To be added to your 'to do'-list for Prague!. Near to metro station I.P.Pavlova, this real-life puzzle game is easy accessible and certainly worth a visit (reservation might be required!!). Friendly guy explaining the purpose and rules of the game in proper English. Not going to tell to much about the game itself (so no spoilers here), but the alchemist chamber -which we 'played'- looked very realistic and is well-balanced to finish it within one hour (with or without help through the walky-talky if needed). Whenever I will be visiting Prague again, I WILL take the opportunity to play one of the other puzzles for sure. (Lockers are available)

A refreshing & entertaining break from the tourist crowds. Thoroughly enjoyed our experience although we didn't quite make it out. Would have helped to have had a couple more brains working with the 2 of us, but we weren't traveling with anyone else. Now that we have had some practice with an escape room I know we would be spot on next time but, unfortunately, didn't have time to do the second room. Would encourage anyone with a love of fun and innate curiosity to give it a try.
Mind Maze visit. nice, fun game for reasonable price, we enjoyed it, friendly stuff, rooms are nicely designed, I would recommend it.

Great Escape Room with Awesome Atmosphere. We've had some escape room experience before these two rooms and after, and these remain probably the two best rooms we did so far.Everything is very well built and thought of. The design and atmosphere is great and adds a lot to the experience.The general feeling was that these rooms are very accurate, and that this is how escape rooms should be build.We've started with the Alchemist room, and once done with immediately booked for the WWII room for the next day.Highly recommended!

Clever fun. We loved it! We were a group of 5 friends and it was perfect for us. It's a clever way to have fun and actually use your brain as well. The only thing who made the experience less perfect for us was the way there. Luckily we started walking with a lot of extra time on our hands, which we used to find the way. There is little signs outside, but it has to be said, at the time, there was some digging and roadworks nearby, which made it even harder to find. My advice is to study maps carefully or take a taxi if you are not fimiliar in the area. Other than that, the experience was fantastic, it was a lot of fun and the service was excellent.

The most exciting 60 minutes ever!. It was brilliant! There were four of us in the Enigma room and we were dragged into the game the very first second the bars of the Enigma prison were locked. This has been my first and (so far) only experience in escape games but I believe anyone would enjoy it the same way I did. The puzzles and keys are so thought-out that you really feel like a spy in a war. It is not easy to get out but not impossible. We did it just in time. Go for this experience, you will not regret.

Great "escape room" experience. . Three rooms, two options. Alchemist lab and Enigma. I was in the alchemist lab and it was great fun. Some friends were in the Enigma room and had the same great experience. The staff was very friendly. I recommend Prauge MindMaze.

Just great!. On a trip to Prague we were ten colleagues who thought we should try out an escape game. We had never tried it before, but we had a great time. Five tried to find the Philosopher´s Stone while I and my group had to break out of a jail and find the blue prints of a submarine to get out. We made it with less than two minutes left.All ten of us enjoyed it and this should have been the team building exercise instead of group discussions! If we had had more time left before our flight out that evening we would have tried to switch rooms.

Had a great time against my will. Went to this with Robert C who has also 5 starred this. The klutz decided that after a heavy night on the town the night before he'd book us in for a 10 O'clock slot - so an enforced route march, no breakfast and a hangover was our base on which we built our attempt at the Enigma room.I had no idea what to expect and wasn't really listening to the instructions - so my search for "blue footprints" was never going to happen.However, we did manage to escape from prison - at which point we should have retired with dignity!This was well put together and I hate to say, good fun as I was dragged there.....Meanwhile if you have Robert C in your team and you ask him if he has used the key you just found for him - don't believe him when he says it doesn't open anything!!!!

Best tackled with a clear mind.. Three of us rather unadvisedly took a morning slot after a heavy night. It took about 15 minutes to figure out how to get into the building, but once in, we were greeted by some charming and patient staff who told us what it was all about, and then locked us in the Enigma Room. I'd like to say we aced it, but instead let ourselves down by swarming around the room rather haphazardly and finding - but not using - a really important set of keys. Anyway it's a great concept; It's an immaculately presented collection of props and puzzles, coherently linked together.

Amazing. This was one of our first attraction in Prague. An it was amazing. An hour of action and fun. We were 3: My wife, Kid (8) and myself. Absolutely worth the money, We will definitely return and play another room in our next visit in Prague.

Escaping the Alchemist's chamber!. Amazing! We had so much fun escaping the Alchemists chamber. The rooms are really well done and George was kind enough to hint a couple of things whenever we got a little! Absolutely recommend it

Worth a visit. Great experience, the puzzle was fun to solve, service was excellent and staff really friendly. We had some problems with a broken piece of equipment, but it was fixed promptly. All in all, we had lots of fun.
Loads of fun!. I did not expect much but this was truly awesome! Two rooms with different themes, they lock you there and... help yourself! :) Highly recommended to everyone visiting Prague!

Great Experience. We booked this on last day in Prague after checking out of hotel and before evening flight. Myself and my 2 daughters did the Alchemists Room and just managed to get out before the hour was up. We all loved it and particularly enjoyed finding out we could work together and then much excitement when we managed to solve clues.

Unforgettable experience. We highly recommend this kind of entertainment!!!! It was really great!! Thank you Tomas for helping us with solutions of some riddles which we didn´t know!!! :-)
It is really fun, everybody have to try it!!!!
Clever and fun!. Had a great hour solving the Enigma puzzle room! The staff are friendly and helpful and the whole activity was well organised and very cleverly created. Awesome!

Family fun that even teenagers think is cool. Great concept... actually engages the whole family... great mix of skill and suspense. The facilitators did a great job of giving hints as needed to keep it fun... but leaving the challenge intact. Thanks!
Well put together activity. We had a great time, had done one escape room game previously, but this one we better organized and well thought out.

A very interesting experience. This was our first escape room and we thoroughly enjoyed it ...We had initially wanted to do the Enigma room but it was fully booked and since we had limited time we went to the Alchemist's Chamber ...We had difficulty with figuring things out till the end; we would start out but not be able to figure it out; but then they would make sense. It was just two of us and our first time so I think we would do better next time around. George was very helpful with hints that helped us ultimately solve the puzzle ...Wonderful experience that we will repeat

A FRIGGIN' BLAST. So I had never done of these before, but they exist all over the world in major cities.Mindmaze was FANTASTIC. My traveling buddy and I escaped the Alchemist's Chamber with under a minute left in our hour. We were VERY proud (:We're both in our mid-twenties and had SO MUCH FUN, but could definitely see it being challenging for young children.The location was a bit difficult to find, but when you find it it's truly worth it!

Brilliant - you most go.. We booked to do the Enigma room and enjoyed it so much that we went back the next day to do the Alchemist's Chamber. Both games are really challenging - Enigma perhaps a bit more tricky.The staff are really helpful and give you as much or little help as you need. It is only a 5 minute walk from the IP Pavlova Metro station.It really us a must do if you are visiting Prague.
a lot of fun. we had such a great time doing the alchemist scenario that we wanted to do the second room straight afterwards!

Great experience . We went there with work for a team building and it was a really nice experience ! It was entertaining and too short ! I will definitely recommend it ! It can be with friends or family , nice concept
Great, smart activity. Compared to some other similar games in Europe, here we felt more welcomed and were given very good practical instructions. The maze left us wanting for more!

Something Different. The mind maze is great fun and different to anything I've done before. It wasa definite challenge but not impossible. At times it feels hopeless but it is great fun and we had a great laugh trying to escape the Alchemists chamber. I would recommend it to people of all ages it was fabulous. We did it as a couple which we thought may be tricky but it was a good achievement when we completed it.

Fun and intelligent. My wife and I enjoyed the Alchemist's room, and found it challenging and fun! This was our third escape room, and we now look for them whenever we go on a trip. Highly recommended!

Excellent activity. We did Enigma as a couple and really enjoyed it. We were afraid that it might not be possible to escape with just two people but it just made it a bit more challenging. It's really clever and great fun. Best thing we did in Prague. Thanks MindMaze!

Fantastic fun. Booked this from the UK before travelling to Prague after reading about it on Tripadvisor, and It was immediately confirmed by e-mail. Well, it was brilliant. Think we may still be in the Alchemist chamber but for the clues that we had to have, but it was great fun, so much so that we returned 2 days later to do the Enigma challenge, which we were even worse at. Didn't matter a jot. Absolutely great fun. Everybody should visit.

MindMaze Orague. So fun!!! This was our second experience with an "escape room" and it was a lot of fun for our family. Our kids are 14 and 17 and really enjoyed the theme of the Alchemist room. It was very well put together and professional. We managed to escape in 49:52 minutes with a hint or two along the way. This made us think outside the box and work together. It is a great way to work with everyones strengths!
Simply clever. It was great fun and we were sad when this experience finished, because we wanted more and more!:) Truly amazing game! TY!

Great fun! Different way to spend an hour!. My husband and I did the alchemists chamber today and we loved it! It is challenging but not impossible. Obviously harder with only 2 people as you only have 2 brains on the job. But we eventually got there with some helpful prompts from one of the guys on our walkie talkie. Its refreshing to do something that doesn't require a screen, just good old fashioned brains! Definitely recommend

Truly amazing experience!. We had No idea what to expect when we decided to going to mindmaze, although, the whole experience truly blew us away completely, we returned later the same day to complete the other room. One of the highlights for us during our trip to Prague! Highly Recommended for people with an eye for detail and an interest for solving puzzles! Would give more stars if possible. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful during the whole experience. A must do!!
Just perfect!. We spend almost whole hour to solve all. Such a good game! If you like to play - go for it! My children were really excited about the game!

Great fun. Great value. Intense hour.. We did the Enigma room. What good fun. We did it as a couple and managed to avoid arguing and getting too stressed! We enjoyed every minute of it, and with a few gentle clues from the host via walkie-talkie radio we managed to almost complete the game. I think with 3-4 people it would have been easily achievable in the hour. The bit at the end was a bridge too far for our hungover brains. I blame all the delicious beers in Prague for our failure. Great value, great host, simple concept but executed very well with authentic sounds and props. Also I think they must have taken older reviews on board because the place was so easy to find with a massive sign outside on the street.I would definitely go back to do the other room.

Amazing experience. Great escape game. Difficult but possible to solve, room with great atmosphere and many puzzles to solve, really good fun for the family or friends. Even I read many positive reviews, the game over exceeded my expectation. The stuff was very nice as well, ready to help in case of need. I strongly recommend to try it.

Great family fun on a snowy afternoon!. We were unable to do our planned zoo trip and were looking for entertainment on a cold,wet afternoon to include adults and a 10 and 12 year old. Decided to give this a go and were not disappointed. Great 'team-building' fun for the whole family; we all worked together finding different clues to solve the puzzle. Great sense of accomplishment when we completed it and our ten year old wanted to try another one straight away! Thoroughly recommended as both a family activity or for groups of adults. Good facilities, friendly staff! Perhaps not for very young children though.

Great fun!. Was a lot of fun, we had a great time in the alchemist room. Managed to complete it in the end even though it took more than an hour for us! The game is challenging but doable, and small hints are provided if you're struggling. Would have gone back for the enigma game if we had enough time left during our stay in Prague. Highly recommend it.

Great afternoon activity in Prague. Awesome! My son and I visited this escape room and had an enjoyable experience. The staff were friendly and helpful. The puzzles were challenging to solve, but not too difficult. Great theme in the Alchemist's room. Although we didnt get out in time, a few timely hints helped us as it was a little more difficult with just two persons. Highly recommend a visit here.

Worth it!. We did the Alchemist´s chamber in a group of 4 friends and it was a exciting challenge. This attraction is well done and we had much fun to combine all the clues to escape the room! It´s a pity that you can´t do the same room once more because we were so enthusiastic after we managed to escape :) We can recommend to everybody to check this out, you won´t regret it!!

Fantastic fun, we went twice!. We went on a bit of a whim and thoroughly enjoyed it, so much so that we came back to do the second room. The games are all brilliantly set out and are challenging but not impossible. Each room is very different but completely convincing and a lot of fun. I would massively recommend this for anyone who enjoys a puzzle
Awesome advanture. Yes advanture, we were 8 friends, we divided into two groups and we both did the alchemist chambar.We compited with the other team, and ofcurse we won... :)

Best Exeperience in Prague!. This hidden gem is sure to make your stay more fun! If you have more than one day to ecolors Prague, it would be criminal to not check this out. My family still won't stop talking about how much fun we had, so we're hoping to find something similar in the States. Book now! You won't regret it.

Great fun. Don't think twice, Go and enjoy a very fun and interesting game where you must figure out how to escape from a room using your brain. We split into 2 groups of 4 friends and had a blast figuring out the clues.

Loved it....slightly addicted now!. This was my 2nd exit experience and it sure as hell won't be my last. We did Enigma and loved it. The room had it all from old school ornaments and decorations to the military like sound effects. Managed to complete it in just under 52 mins which we were stoked about. Highly recommended :)
Superb experience. My wife and me went to the Alchemist room today. Really didn't know what to expect but it was great fun, we recommend it to everyone who wants to play braingames.

So much fun :). Mind Maze in Prague is a brilliant way to spend a few hours. There are three different rooms to choose from. As we were a group of 12 we split up into three groups each group tackling a different room. The room I was in was called Enigma and based on what our friends told us about their rooms it sounded like Enigma was the best.We managed to get out just within the hour which made it all even better :)

We got rejected. Our group of six made reservations the night before on location. We turned up the next day and we we're told that another group had reserved at the same time and we would have to leave. We traveled all the way from Canada and had to leave the next morning so we could not rebook. Unfortunate, can not recommend.

Double Booked. We had fun the day before with the Alchemist, so we immediately booked Enigma the following day. Unfortunately, when we arrived the next day, we were advised it was double booked. We explained we travelled from Canada and were leaving Prague the nexy day, but it fell on deaf ears. A wasted afternoon in our last day in Prague. Two subways and a long walk (both ways) for nothing. Needless to say, I'm not impressed.

Searching for Alchemist stone is fun!. There are two rooms of same kind, so if you need to compete in groups, it is great opportunity.The Alchemist room is well equipped and average difficulty.Recommend.
wicked. This was a wicked adrenaline rush. We had a great time! Can't wait to play the Enigma room. Definitely recommended

Enjoyed also second time. We tried Alchymist last year, our first escape room and we were excited. So we went also for Enigma. I found it more difficult, but also very interesting. All the puzzles to solve were fun, I really enjoyed all the stylish properties (furniture, devices, clothes etc.) I was always excited when we resolved one step and moved further, found more indices and keys. We managed it in exactly 60 minutes with one or two hints.

Fun daytime activity in Prague. Really enjoyed our Mindmaze experience playing the Enigma game. we didn't quite manage to escape but that didn't spoil it. Well organised and run, the game has a good mix of problems to solve. Would recommend a visit for anyone looking for a fun daytime activity.

You will not be disappointed! . Played mind maze for the first time in Prague. The host George was very informative and helpful. We had so much fun and it was a very different - and refreshing experience in Prague. I can recommend this to all.
Book a reservation, and get a very exciting experience. The Alchemist Chamber was well worth the money :)

You must try this! So much fun and so well done.. What a great experience. We've never done anything like this and really had little idea what this was about but based on the reviews we knew we had to try it. I promise no spoiler-alerts and won't give away any secrets! My husband and I did Enigma and it was absolutely fantastic, fun, challenging and the time flew by. We did manage to escape but with seconds to spare and with help asking for clues... Even if we didn't escape it would still have been well worth it. We've talked about it so much since and really found it to be so well designed and well thought out. Genius. We can't wait to go back and try the other rooms. I highly, highly recommend this activity.

Enjoyed our Real-Life-Nancy-Drew-gone-miltary-spy Experience. Signed up for this experience on a whim, went in with no idea what we were getting ourselves into...and LOVED it. One of the most different & intriguing things we've done on our trip abroad. Friendly staff (Daniel is the most precious human), fun but perplexing hour. Would definitely recommend it to anyone who enjoys puzzles and team bonding

Alchemist's Chamber. First time doing anything like this and it was really fun!! George was very helpful and gave us a nice background story of the chamber before he sent us in. There were three of us all new and all confused when we entered. Slowly we started figuring our way through the room. We got to the last puzzle and had to finally ask for help. Luckily we finished at 56 minutes. It was a blast and we all highly recommened it!! I will be going back to do the Enigma code in a few weeks.Price is very good depending on how many people you split it between (2-5 people).

Escape the room. It was my first experience with such a game, and I have to say all my expectations have been exceeded. The first 5 minutes were hard, everything was locked up and I was searching for something which I didn`t even know how it looks, but after the first puzzle was done everything just flowed. Managed to solve it in an hour, with the helpful hints of the host, which is very friendly and supportive. If you haven`t played such a game before, go. If you did, you probably don`t need any incentive to try it. Price-wise, it`s way cheaper than I could find in London.

Great team bonding activitiy. This was a very entertaining and enjoyable activitiy. Each member of the team had their own eureka moment. The sense of achievement at the end will keep you on an adrenaline high for the remainder of the day. Lots of laughter. Well worth going. Tricky to find the building but that's just the warm up :)

It was fun!. If you have already been to the Charles Bridge and castle and the clock and want to try something different then this is a good place to go. We went to the Alchemist room and were really amazed by the different puzzles. We did not succeed but it was our first game like that and we were only two people playing the game, distracted from time to time by our 4-month old daughter. I still think we had a fair chance to succeed. Our guide was very friendly and helpful even though we showed up a bit late and it was the last (9 pm) slot.

Simply "Must visit". Although we didn't succeeded, we enjoyed every minute of the game. It was our first escape game ever, so we were not sure, what to expect (next time it will be better :) ). And there is really one surprise after another! Really good idea.

Absolutely Brilliant- Highly recommend. I went at the weekend with a friend so there was just two of us playing but we both had so much fun! We were only in there for about 5 mins before we started telling each other how much fun it was already! I often play apps which have games like this but being in it in real life was so much harder which was a good thing as it was a real challenge rather than a walk in the park. Saying that, If we were stuck, the guide was watching us from outside the room and offered cryptic clues which really helped without spoiling it. I would recommend anyone did this while they were out there. Something so different to anything else I have ever done! Would love to do it again and try the other room! Maybe on my next visit......Enjoy to those who go!

Amazing. We had the pleasure of enjoying the alchymist's chamber experience and had absolutely great time. There was five of us and we were all kept busy the whole time we were solving the mystery. And since we got out in 29 minutes we were also pleased with us :-) we will definitely come back and try to solve the enigma.

A Fantastic Experience. If you love programs such as the Crystal Maze and Fort Boyard then you will love this. Locked in a room for an hour and then your simply need to escape - what more can I say. We pre-booked this for our second day in Prague and had so much fun that we booked for later in the week for the 2nd room. Both rooms were great and we all liked each room for different reasons

mind maze is a mind maze. WHAT A LAUGH...My wife and I went after reading about it on here. some of the reviews said they had trouble finding it. we didn't find it hard once you keep to main streets and have a good map with you, it is off the main street tho so keep an eye out for the street name plaques on the corners of the buildings. On arriving we were met by one of the girls who spoke perfect English, she was very friendly and funny. They explained very clearly what we had to do, although that went out the window once we went in to the game. The game lasts about an hour and is a crystal maze type of puzzle game. Once you solve one puzzle you move onto the next one until you free yourself from the room. it caused rows, and joy est laughter and at the end both my wife and I thought it was one of the best things we've ever done.I can't recommend it enough, if you do nothing else in Prague make sure you escape for an hour and you'll be absolutely entrained.

Brilliant!. It's a great way to have some fun while challenging yourself. A must go place in Prague. Each puzzle brings a small joy to your adventure and a sense of achievement when you're able to finish them.

Great fun!. If you are looking for something a bit out of the ordinary to do when you are visiting Prague, Mindmaze should be on top of the list. You can chose between two different options, The Alchemist's Chamber (our choice) and Enigma. In The Alchemist's Chamber you get locked into a room with different objects. Your teams task is to decipher codes, solve puzzles and riddles to find The Alchemist's Stone and then finally get out - within an hour.Great fun and a good teamwork-challenge! I recommend this to everyone, and would most likely try the Enigma next time.

Awesome !. I went to MindMazewith 9 other friends and we really had a great time ! The staff was friendly and they explained the game in a perfect English, the Puzzle wasn't too complicated nor too easy : we finished the Alchemist rooms in 37 and 45 minutes (two groups)The price for a room is 1200 crowns so if you are a group of 5 people, it costs less than 10 € per person and it really worth it if you like this kind of puzzles.They have 2 identical rooms so you can split in two groups and challenge each other. It was a lot of fun, and we highly recommend this place :)

Great friendly fun. We accidentally came across this and are glad we did. It's a well constructed room of mind puzzles that require no prelearned skills or language ability, so any nationality can try. There were some groups of 6 people, but we were only 2 and it was fine. We needed a few hints, but if you enjoy feeling paralysed with your own lack of understanding, this is for you. Staff are super, and although we hadn't booked, they super-speedily made up the room for us and let us do it anyway. Really great; about £30 for an hour.
Excellent!. We entered both of the rooms. We succeeded in the Alchemist chamber but failed in the Enigma Room ( we were so close....). Lots of fun!
A must go in Prague. If you are visiting Prague, this place is a must go! Suitable for young and old! We had an absolute great time! Would recommend mindmaZe to any couple or group!
So much fun, unique experience!. This was brilliant, we really enjoyed it! We have never come across this kind of activity before. Would highly recommend you take time to try this out.

Gets you using your brain again while travelling. Secrets and puzzles. What more could you want when travelling. Fairly expensive but worth it. Just cracked it with the extra 5 minutes they gave us... So close!!

Brilliant Escape Room Experience!. really exciting and fun escape room! loved it so much the first time we went back to do the second! I've done a couple in different countries and this was the best! Thanks guys! x

Something different. Extremely fun and challenging. Lovely staff and would recommend to everybody!
Really makes you think and work as a team.
Would definitely go back and play the other game.

Cracking. Totally different from anything I've ever done before! It was interesting and fun! A bit like crystal maze and fort boyard - my favourite shows from when I was younger. Very good value for money and the staff were very good at explaining and giving hints. Managed to crack enigma in 61 mins - would return and complete the other room if I ever go back to Prague (highly likely!!)

Very Clever !. It offers something different to your trip.It was just me and my partner and we didn't do too well - sometimes over thought it and sometimes just didn't think at all ! Great fun and a great different experience and glad that we tried it.

A fantastic must do experience. The mind maze was absolutely awesome , well thought out , great props, polite and friendly staff , overall a fantastic game to take part in , my boyfriend and I can't wait to go back and do the enigma room !

Not as it seems here. We went as a couple to both rooms - from reading the reviews and being is such places before we had really high hopes about this one. But even before entering the room we already had bad experiences. The place is very small so you can hear people in other rooms and a lot speak in English so you can hear spoilers. and when we arrived a group was discussing their game and were trying to ruin our game by giving clues and hints - the staff did nothing to shut them.The first room (not the alchemist one) began fun but you can see they don't care about the either room - it was falling apart. my shirt got ripped there because there was something sticking out that was not supposed to be sticking out and some parts of the puzzle were broken and the staff had to enter and help us which ruined the mood.The second room was very nicely decorated but again it was old and not cared for, One of the puzzles solved itself just by being broken,I would not waste my time on this room. Prague has a lot more to offer and other rooms to visit. Just search for them.
Amazing!!!!!. I would recommend this to anyone. Great fun and not very expensive. Such an enjoyable hour. loved every minute of it.

We loved it !. something a little different for us - with an 11 year old boy and my mother of 80 this kept us all entertained, the first challenge is to find the building - once thats done you enter an old apartment building and find your way downstairs.... for the children particularly it was one of their Prague highlights. We did manage to"escape" but only just - and with a bit of help with the clues from our guide who pointed us in the right direction...dont want to give too much away but we loved it as we are not aware of anything like this in the UK, think Crystal Maze meets Harry Potter meets logic games !! about £35 for the hours game , this covers up to 5 people so would be expensive for 2 but great value for 4 or 5 !

Amazing!!!. A few friends and I did one of the mind mazes in May 2014 while visiting Prague. We thought it might be something fun to do before we left. What we didn't realize was that it would be the highlight of our visit! It was fun and I am always encouraging others who visit to be sure and do one of the mind mazes! If we had more time, we would've done another one. The next time I visit Prague, it'll be the first thing on my list.

Best part of our trip. We were six friends who travelled to Prague in desember 2014. Prague is a beautiful city, but Mind Maze was the best part of our trip, no doubt! We tried "The Philosopher's stone" and I highly recomend it. Only con is that the building is hard to find, and is located in a rather creepy and dark basement.

A must do!. We decided to do this activity purely based on trip advisor reviews, and it did not disappoint. Staff are very welcoming and helpful, perfect English! My partner and I escaped from the alchemist chamber, which was challenging enough to keep you engaged, but not overly hard where you loose interest. It is a little in the sticks, so allow a 20-30 minute walk from the centre of old town. Overall a great experience!

FUN!!. We did the "enigma" room, which is set in WWII. The original WWII props and sound effects of planes flying overhead were a nice touch. This is a fun game for everyone, I highly recommend it. Worth every koruna.

Great activity. We tried the Alchymist chamber in a group of friends and it was a great fun. We even managed to escape:). Funny riddles and gadgets involved. Totally recommended. Enigma is on our list at the moment!
So much fun. Excellent fun for something different to do. We did both room and found them very interesting and challenging. Staff were very friendly and welcoming :)

So much fun!. We were a group of six so we split into two teams, guys vs. gals. This was such a great way to spend an hour indoors! Fun, challenging puzzles and great teamwork experience. Something new and different and really well put together. Great fun!

So much fun. We decided to visit and do the alchemist room. Only 2 of us so we were a small team but it was so much fun! After finishing one room we decided to do the second room as it was available. It was just as fun if not better than the first. Would definitely recommend this to anyone who likes mind games and puzzles. A fun twist to Prague's history in alchemy and ww2.

Funtastic Time. We had a funtastic time. The Alchemist room was a ball. We all found different clues an helped solve the puzzles. I would recent it for a group of adults, a family with teens,Or couples. A fun exciting hour.

Very funny. We heard about this game here in tripadvisor and We went there to check it out and it. is everything they promise. The instructor was very nice and helpful and We have a good time and fun playing the game. Recomended for those Who like games and specially for families with teens

Fantastic activity. A friend and I went to the mind maze on our last day in Prague. For just the two of us it was on the pricey side, but as it can also be for bigger groups the price is very reasonable. Bit out in the stick but we walked from the center of Prague in no more than 15 minutes. All the staff were really friendly and the whole experience is very well organised and we were very impressed. The room was very well set up and was at about the right level. We had a great time and left wanting to do the second room they had! Would definitely recommend to everyone!
Original and funny. Do not hesitate, we had a lot of fun in this adventure. And the staff is really kind. Thank you MindMaze

Great fun. We had heard of a place doing the same thing in London, but that has long waiting lists. So we decided to try the Prague one whilst there and were not disappointed. The "instructor" spoke good English and was always watching us, giving clues where we got stuck. Some of the items in the room were a bit tired from use, but overall we had a great experience. It is suitable for all ages and for all members of the family. Kids from 8-16 will particularly enjoy it, but I can't tell you what it is ...... ;-)

Interesting. Well, we should have some more time. Story is very good, but it should be a bit more developed or rearranged. Again it is very positive. It is good when you enter with a bigger team of treasure hunters.

So much fun!. We were in Prague on a field trip and took a group of 12 high school students to the MindMaze. Everyone enjoyed themselves, adults included. We had so much fun trying to solve the puzzles and the students talked about it the rest of the trip! Hopefully we will get to do it again on our trip next year!

We had a great time. We did not know what to expect - but we were open minded. The Alchemist Chamber maze was fun and we had lots of laughs. We only had two on our team and we were unsuccessful - if we had four we would have done much better
Lot of fun. It was an incredible experience! we did both of the chambers and some of the puzzles were quite tricky! the game is good and the staff is kind and helpful!

Great fun!. We visited for a fun activity on our last day in Prague. The staff were helpful and friendly and the game itself was brilliant. I couldn't believe an hour could pass so quickly! We would visit again to try the Enigma game as this time we did the Alchemists Chamber. This is definitely worth a visit if you like puzzles!

Fun and challenging. I went with a group of 4 friends, and as a fan of the Myst series (and a variety of other puzzle games), I thought it would be fun to try out something like this. We did the Alchemist's Room, and it was challenging without being too difficult. I think that it'd be best for teens and older, though older elementary school kids might be able to do it, too.The staff was really nice and friendly, explained everything perfectly well, and we had a great time. I'd be glad to try out their other room with the WWII Enigma experience.

Great family fun!. Once you have found the place, you are made to feel welcome and then the challenge begins.We did the WW II Enigma experience and were immediately taken back in time when we entered the room. Locked in a cell we had to escape and crack the codes to find the secret 'Blue Prints'. It was great fun with plenty to do for all the family. Its not just the theoretical, there are plenty of practical considerations, so fun can be had by all. A great change from the sightseeing and well worth doing.
Funny and adventurous. I gave the MindMaze adventure to my boyfriend as a birthday present. We had the best time there. The room was very hard to solve but in the made it :)

Thrilling fun for all ages. Just completed the Mindmaze with our high school group. We split up into 3 groups so we did all rooms. Each group barely solved each room in time. All of the students and teachers indicated that it was fun and stimulating. We all would definitely go back. Staff was friendly and as helpful as we needed them to be. Location was 5 minutes from tram.

Such a great idea. Went because of the reviews. A nice 30 minute walk from old square. We did the alchemist in a team of two. Great fun and we worked our socks off thru all clues only failing at the last one. Brilliant fun really recommended!!
Was a great experience.... We really liked this game, although it was a little bit hard to solve. It is great for team building activities... We expected it to be different but it was brilliant...
So much fun!. We loved this game! I would recommend at least 3 people...but we had fun playing with just the 2 of us. I highly recommend this group!

Absolutely brilliant!!. My wife booked this with two of our friends for my birthday as a surprise. I didn't know what to expect but it was just brilliant! We all loved it and we couldn't rate it any higherI would seriously recommend you do this

What a great experience!. I told my wife that I'd prefer an experience for my Christmas present this year instead of a physical gift, and she really delivered by finding the MindMaze for our trip to Prague! This was our first escape room experience and we loved it so will definitely be looking for more now. The theme for the alchemist's room and trying to find the philosopher's stone was also perfect for the setting in Prague thanks to the city's history with alchemy, and this really added to the thrill and enjoyment of the experience as well. We completed the room with a family of 5 and it was fun because the group was able to split up and sort of each focus on solving different parts of the puzzles and then come together with our findings. I imagine that the game would be quite different with only 2 people though as there were a few puzzles I didn't really get to play with since they were completed by someone else, so with a smaller group you'd actually get to do everything yourself if that sort of thing is important to you. Highly recommended and definitely a highlight of our trip.

Fun family activity. We have visited several escape rooms in Budapest, London and Melbourne and really enjoyed this one. There was a good range of puzzles but we still needed a few hints to get out in time. Our 11 year old loves these activities, especially as a break from sightseeing. Easy to get to by tram and a short walk (thanks google maps).

Great couple activity. When we first arrived in the building we were hesitating if we did a right choice to book our precious time to try mind made, but after this experience, it's been one of the highligh of our trip in Prague, we still discuss what we could have done and din not do, we tried the escape room, this is our first time to try this activity and surely will not be the last! I highly recommend for couples and group of friends to definitely try them!

An awesome experience!. We did the enigma game and had TONS of fun! It has a brilliant design and it's a really smart and unique game. We had so much fun, I highly recommend it! Next time we're in town we'll definitely try the other games.

Great fun. Excellent mind stretcher, a real life equivalent of the game "The Room". Good for company team building as well... See how other think! Great family fun.Only suggestion is that they put a real clock in the room so you know how much time you have left (they use music tones but it is hard to decipher them) also don't provide clues unless requested. Several clues were provided that were distractions from the current train of thought.
Perfect for the puzzle lover. Was a very interesting maze, we took the alchemist 1 maze. The staff was also very nice. I recommend it to all the puzzle solver of this world.

Main 'attraction' in Prague. A friend of ours booked the game and to be honest I wasn't expecting much but boy I was so wrong! I was part of a group of 5 friends and it was absolute fun! The idea is great, the hosts are very friendly talking perfect English and the games are awesome! A must go for Friends & Families :)

MindMaze with 11 year old. We truly enjoyed this experience. The hour just flew by. Our group consisted of 4 adults and 1 child and I think it worked very well for us. Highly recommended to everyone who likes logical problem solving.

highlight of our trip to prague. This is such a fantastic thing to do , my boyfriend and I went on the first and last morning of our trip, we completed both rooms and it was so much fun. The staff are awesome and they booked taxis for us when we were finished. The detail in these rooms are great. if there had been a third room i would have booked to do it also.  Dont delay book this, it will be a blast :) thank You guys and mindmaze for making our trip to prague fun fun fun

Great fun for the family!!!. This was our second Escape Room game in Prague and I can't say enough about Mind Maze. The hosts were very friendly and knowledgable of the rules. We knew exactly what to expect going in and felt comfortable from the start. The game, while very challenging, was fun and my family had a great time. The clues are very clever and the game flows well. I would recommend Mind Maze to anyone who is looking for a challenge beginners to seasoned veterans. Will definitely play their second room.

Excellent. I spent a bit more than an hour there with my wife. We had such a nice time that is so sad we had to go away after finishing it. It's a must have experience in Prague in my opinion. Staff is really welcoming and well prepared. The game is prepared in really cool way. Looking forward for the next time.

Favorite Part of Vacation!. My husband and I as well as our friend and his daughter visited MindMaze on our vacation to Prague. I have to say, while I loved the Christmas markets, river cruise, and visiting the historical sites, MindMaze was absolutely one of my favorite parts of the entire trip. I felt like Indian Jones or Relic Hunter! It was great fun--I only wish I could have done it over and over again. My suggestion for anyone going: make sure you sign up for the Alchemist's Chamber and Enigma! We only signed up for one of the rooms, and I was so sad that I didn't make reservations for the other room! You won't be disappointed!

What a Blast . This is the best thing to do with those you are traveling with . My daughter and I were in Salzburg then Prague and then off to Vienna for the holidays- a lot of sightseeing and train travel. This hour was a welcome respit to all of the walking and crowds and challenging and fun!!! The idea is to be locked in a room for a hour with all of the clues you need to get out. Of course there are distractions but staying on point is key. What a great way to bond with my daughter and for us to work as a team. Expertly assembled - tons of fun/ a definite adventure to change the pace of sightseeing/travel and a great additional memory together. Fun for all- don't see Prague without czech ing out Mind Maze!!

Definitely worth it. We were a bit skeptical going into this and nervous as we'd never done anything like this before. ..but it was awesome! Did it as a team of 2 and had an amazing time. Money very well spent. Would recommend to anyone.

Mind Maze was great fun. Our family of five (2 adults & 3 teenagers) decided to try the Mind Maze Alchemist's chamber in Prague. Only one of us has had any experience in the locked room mysteries so it was quite a new experience.Booking was easy from their website and communications very clear. We were able to find the place without any problem - just be aware that Tyršova 9, Praha 2 is on the left side of the main street Legerova as you come up from A.P. Pavlova station.The staff was very welcoming and helpful and explained everything. For us beginners we were given relevant hints at the 15 minutes mark to help us get moving. It was lots of fun and challenging. The tricks were quite ingenious. Everyone enjoyed it.

Great Moment for family or friends.. We were a family of 5 with all children aged over 18 and we really enjoy the game. Within the one hour of allocated time you try to solve a series of puzzles to get out of the alchemist chamber and it was very funny and captivating. The puzzles are well thought, neither too easy nor too though. Everybody enjoy this moment that can nicely help to warm up in a inside playful activity.Finally, the rates are not expensive (50 euros for 5). You definitely must not come to Prague without visiting MindMaze.

Great fun and a unique experience. A great experience, if a little challenging with just two of us! We spent a very enjoyable hour in the Alchemist room and came out feeling that our money had been well spent. Make sure you take a map to find the place - it is quite far out of the old town, and involved getting the metro and then a 10 minute walk until we found it nestled inside a building on a side-street.

fun family break from sightseeing. Thi was a really enjoyable hour for my wife and I and our two daughters 18 and 20. Was a great break from sightseeing and was fun for us to be a bit more raucous as we solved the puzzles as compared to the quiet demeanor needed for historic touring. It is a bit hard to find the spot in the basement of what appears to be a residential building but the website instructions are very accurate. The staff were helpful and their English was good. They sent a couple group photos by email to remember the experience by. Good fun and a good break from history.

Super fun. We enjoy solving puzzles and this was just perfect. It is very nicely made, convincing and really fun. We solved the Enigma without any hints and are going to check out the alchemist's chamber next month.
Wow great fun. My wife booked this and it turned out to be one of the most fun things we did on our short break. In Prague 1 hour of stretching our mindsWe would do this again

So much fun!. I bought a visit for my brother for his 20th Birthday. It was five of us and we went to the Alchemist Room. It was great, looked easy at first, but got much harder as we progressed through out the room. The staff is watching you on camera and help you out when you stack. They speak great English, but language is not very important for solving of the clues. Reservation is a must. They website works great and you can be managing your reservation later on. Certainly will come back for the Enigma room!

Awesome!. They are very smart in setting the whole thing up. We are a family of 5, with 14, 12, 9 year old boys, absolutely had a ball! A lot of fun and exciting.Thomas the guide is a very nice man and gave us some good hints.Totally enjoyable and exciting to all my 3 boys!
Mind Maze Enigma Chamber. Was a very fun game! Costs 1200 kc per game for 2-5 persons (about 40 euro).Lasts 1 hour.Very nice decoration and game theme.
Fun and unique experience. We tried the philosophers room and just barely solved it in the time allowed. It was fun, challenging and something I would recommend. Can't wait to try the enigma room!

You have to try it :D. As passionate escape room players we enjoyed every minute spent in the Alchemist chamber. I think is a great way to have fun with your friends.. and specially with your loved one :)

Great experience. We had the Enigma room and figured it just few seconds before the end of time limit. Staff was very friendly and we had a really good time solving all the puzzles.
I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who want to try something nontraditional while visiting Prague.

Awesome experience!. After reading about MindMaze, we thought it sounded like a fun game and decided to try it out. And we didn't regret it for a second! While playing the game we got to a level of excitement that we've never been before. It was so much fun that we decided to book a new game for the day after. And the second game didn't disappoint either! Our host for the game was really nice, and helpful to just the right degree. We really hope that MindMaze develop a third game, so that we can come back to Prague and play it!

Signed up for one game. stayed for both.. Family with two teens. Such fun. Very challenging, but in a really fun way. Game masters kept us on track with clues as needed, but the clues were not give aways. Just enough to keep things rolling along.

Mind maze alchemist. Hard to find and local business couldn't help us. hotel near by googled it and it didn't come up. make sure you have address and look carefully for the little sign outside. my family of four really enjoyed it. This was the first time ever doing it and we were a little confused at first but employee's were very helpful gave us some hints. would recommend trying it

Amazing. Did the Alchemists lair with my boyfriend and neither of us had any idea what to expect but completely loved it! It was really challenging, but so well thought through and the quantity of puzzles and clues they had put in such a small space was really incredible. We felt so happy (ridiculously happy, really!) when we managed to escape from the room in 53 minutes. Was surprisingly one of the best things we did in Prague and would definitely recommend. Only think was I think the guy was a bit too eager to give some clues through the walkeytalkey. We got three hints, and twice we were just about to do what he had told us to and if he had properly looked at the camera feed of the room i think he would have seen that. It spoiled it slightly, but understand why extra hints might be necessary.But, overall it was amazing. Had such a great time, would definitely recommend!

Something a little different from the norm. We had looked at the mindmaze online before we arrived. We decided to book it as it can be busy. Cost is 1200korona. The mindmaze lasts 60minutes where you have to solve puzzles etc. i know it wont be to everyones liking but me and my wife really enjoyed it as it was something different that we wouldnt do back home.The staff were very friendly and explained everything well. Would recommend for all ages.
Fun for the family. We did this with our 2 young daughters (8&9). We weren't able to solve it but the girls had fun trying. It was enjoyed by all.

You must do this - its brilliant!. Arranged for my Boyfriends 30th after reading the reviews on here and we loved it ! It was definately worth the money and time. We talked about it for the rest of the day and wished we had booked both rooms to conplete. So much fun to do I would recommend to everyone! Its a bit of a walk off the tourist area but book in and plan your touring around it!!

Great team building experience with my colleagues!. Visiting of Mindmaze was the beginning of our company christmas party and I have to say that we could not start the evening better! Mindmaze was a really good choice. The good cooperation between us during the game proofed that we are really good team, that´s why Mindmaze is a great way of teambuilding. Even thought some of my colleagues have not been so excited about going to Mindmaze (because they couldn´t really imagine what to expect) after the game they have changed their mind :) and we are planning to visit the second room soon!
Fun!. This was a good event for 5-6 people. It was a fun game to play when we were bored with looking at buildings. :)

This game is awesome!. This game is awesome! We were two and managed to solve the game in the last minute, of course with a little help of the the stuff. We recommend this place to everyone who visits Prague. Next time in Prague we'll do the enigma room.
Amazing. Really fun and great experience! We just managed rto escape the room, but it was very exciting to be there!

So much fun!. If you are in Prague for whatever reason I couldn't recommend higher how much you need to find a spare hour and visit mindmaze! It is a fantastic, fun, creative game which really gets you thinking and brings your group closer together. The staff are fantastic and very welcoming and I would definitely say it is well worth the money.

Brilliant fun!. MindMaze was brilliant! A 2 minute walk from I.P. Pavlova tube station, easy to find. The hosts were brilliant, explained the game and made us feel relaxed and were clear on the instructions of what to do etc and spoke very good english. We really didn't know what to expect when we got there but once you get in the game room and start it's just so fun. Would recommend it to anyone! We completed the 'Alchemists Chamber' but only just! 59 minutes and 24 second!

Great time. Went there for team building.Fantastic moment spent to solve the enigmas.Alchemist chamber is great to do.Was that good that we wanted to do the second world war one but was fully booked.A must to do to have fun!By the way the answer to main enigma is...

A fun time filler. Me and my fiance decided to try this out after another event fell through. It was something I really wanted to do but he wasnt too keen on- he soon changed his mind though! We booked in for the enigma room and managed to escape in 45 minutes.There was just us 2 with a little back story and then we were left with a walky talky and locked away with a ticking clock and puzzles infront of usIt was brilliant, it used logic,skill,physical activities it was just brilliant. I wish I could have done all of the rooms we enjoyed it so much and we would both definetly recommend this to anyone!!It doesnt take long,so have a few hours spare? Do it!

Super!. I was at mindmaze with My boyfriend This saterday, we did the alchemist chamber. We had a lot of Fun together so we decided to do the enigma chamber Monday. The staff were friendly and very helpful.

Mind Maze Experience. This was a lot of fun for me, my husband, and daughter on a cold winter day. We did complete the puzzle in 57 minutes. Whew :)I think it was really good to have 3 of us, as we all had our puzzle solving strengths. We did have to ask for a hint twice. Unfortunately one of the hints was misplaced in the next room so we weren't really able to use it. But I think overall it was a fun short activity to try and we will try one of the other rooms.

Fun & challenging. I was here with my wife, and we really struggled to complete the task. Without hints we wouldn't have finished the task, and even with hints it took us one hour thirteen minutes to finish (we were lucky to have little extra time because there was no reservation in a short while after us). The host said that with a bigger group (2-5 persons allowed) it gets easier. But it was extremely fun to test our smarts, I strongly recommend to anyone willing to test their wits.
A maze ing. We had great fun and were looked after very well from start to finish. Maybe missing a small prize if you solve it before a certain time. We did it in 28 mins !!

Great fun for everyone . A group of 9 of us visited MindMaze and we had an awesome time. We split into two groups (boys vs girls) and played the alchemist chamber game. Naturally the girls won! The staff were very friendly and helpful, and we would all highly recommend the experience. I want to return to play the enigma game! Thanks for a great time MindMaze :)
Great fun. This was very exciting at great teambuilding. The service were great. The people who created this have great minds.
AWESOME GAME. We were a group of 5 people visiting Prague and we stumbled across MindMaze...we had so much fun figuring out the clues and winning the game! Definitely a must try!
Great time. We did the alchemist room in 48 minutes and had a blast. There are other rooms too which look pretty fun

Great fun - uncomparable experience.. The first time I ever heard about exit games was when I did some researches on what to do in Prague. Due to several good reviews and our curiosity, we decided to give it a try. And we were absolutely not disappointed! We experienced one hour of videogame-like entertainment and finally the success in escaping the room. Thumbs up, I can only recommend this one!

Fun group activity. Fun and challenging! There were lots of puzzles and challenges in the room, but if you're really stuck you can ask for hints through a walkie talkie. I did it as a team building activity, but I would recommend it for any group of friends.

Fun to Visit With Friends. Definitely not somewhere I would have visited on my own, but when traveling with friends, it's definitely worth checking out for an hour of fun. Lots of bars on the way there, I'd recommend getting a little drunk beforehand.

Excellent! . We were four people to enter this room with no expectation. And did we enjoy this! It was an awesome time in the room with alot of mind blowing events. Lots of puzzles to solve within 60 min. They have two rooms. We booked the second room directly after we finished the first one. Try this out!

Fantastic! Highly recommended. 2 of us did the secret agent challenge and absolutely loved it! What a great experience. We've never done anything like this before, and were recommended to check out MindMaze while we were in Prague.Luckily enough we got a booking for the last slot on our last night (book ahead if you will be in Prague). The guys were very friendly and explained how it would work, although we still had little idea of what to expect.I will not post any spoilers here, but suffice to say it's a great hour, something completely different and a fantastic experience. Use your brain and logic to try and solve puzzles and complete the challenge within the required time. We were only 2 people and needed a few hints to help us through, but I would highly recommend MindMaze for any groups of 2, 3, or 4. If you have 5 people it may be tricky. Great for all ages from early teens and up. It's not a physical challenge, it's a logic and thinking exercise. Go and enjoy! You'll have a great time!!
Fun experience. Very fun experience for our group, especially with the chilly early December weather outside. We tried out the Secret Agent challange and we loved it.

Great time. My wife, daughter and I had heard about the MindMaze concept in other cities and were excited to try it in Prague.
We didn't know what to expect and it exceeded our expectations.
It was challenging and fun at the same time.
We are hooked and are looking to other escape rooms on other cities.

MUCH MORE THAN EXPECTED!. You're never quite sure about attractions that are not very well known outside the locale...I had my apprehensions prior to going to Mind Maze. We (Me, my wife, 19 year old daughter, 16 year old son) took a chance and were not disappointed. Our Mind Maze was the Alchemist's Maze. Very interesting, many of the puzzles and decoding were pretty tough but doable if you keep at it. We solved the Mind Maze with about 30 seconds to spare!!! Well worth the $54 for our family to spend an hour+ of great fun together. We will be back for the Spy Mind Maze in December. Take time to do this attraction.

Escape from the rush, and fun for the brain. The room looked plain and simple at the be and turned into a wild experience with lots of fun and cool clues that defiantly stimulate your brain. The place is a little bit off the main area but we'll maintained and the host was very nice!Recommended!!!

Great Fun. Quite easy to get to on the 22 tram route. Staff were friendly and helfpful. There was only the two of us but we managed to complete the majority of the puzzles but just struggled at the end. Brilliant game though would recommend it to anyone looking for some fun!

Great family experience. We went based on the reviews I read on this site. It did not disappoint. We did the Philosopher's Stone room and I wish we had done the more challenging one. We all had tremendous fun and worked so well as a group. Very rewarding!
Super!. We had a wonderful time, jet lag and all! We didn't beat the best time but it was definitely a great bonding experience for our family.
Fun!. When i went i had never tried an escape room game expeience. After this i tried a few but i can clearly say mindmaze is cool. Don't miss it.

Fun puzzle in the heart of Prague. It was a bit hard to find, but with a little help from the GPS on our smartphone we managed just fine.The puzzle was fun, not to hard, but also not to easy. The staff gave us a few hints over the radio when the few times we appeared to be stuck. In the end we made it in 54 minutes and we had fun the whole time. Higly reccomended
Great fun even for couples!. Been there a few weeks ago, took the alchemist room, was great fun and really funny! Bare in mind that you need to book a date and an hour ahead.

Brilliant!. My boyfriend took me to Prague for my birthday and this really was the icing on the cake. We were in the alchemists chamber and loved it from the get go. We are quite competitive people and I think as time wore on we were more and more determined to make it out. It was such an adrenaline rush when we finally made it with less than a minute to spare. The puzzles are just the right level of difficulty and we spent the rest of the day feeling pretty chuffed with ourselves. Have recommended it to everyone

Great fun . We really didn't know what to expect when we walked down to the basement of an old building in Prague but we had such good fun. It's like nothing we have ever done before. A great activity for couples or groups of friends for a very reasonable price. I would recommend more that 2 people for this activity as it makes it a little easier. Be warned this activity needs great team work.
Good time. The 6 of us were able to finish with about 5 minutes left. Our friend set it up and I'm happy she did. It was a good experience and we'd do it again.

Really nice. I never tried before such games and i really enjoyed the experience!The people were very nice and explained us everything we asked with a smileWe went with some friends and all of them were enthusiastic.We finished the game in 32 minutes (which make the experience alittle bit expensive :p)Next time we will try the harder room

amazing get-out-of-the-room experience. We played the "alchermist" game and it was really amazing. Solving the riddles was quite fun and your heart starts beating faster, as the time rushes. Don't worry if you're completely stuck, there's still a magical voice which helps you out with some clues. I strongly recommend the game. But make sure to do a reservation in advance since it is heavily booked.

Enigma room. I played such type of game for the first time and I loved it. We played in the Enigma room and there was a lot of adrenalin, especially once we got locked behind bars. Basically you need to look for clues and make your way out of the room within one hour. In case you get stuck you can get tips since you are being watched;)) Pleasant people working there, you could kill one hour and have fun on a gloomy day. I tried the Alchemist Chamber as well but I knew what to expect from the game and didnt find it too exciting.

Great fun. My daughter and I did the mind maze on our visit last week to Prague as it was recommended by trip advisor as one of the things to do. It was great fun but we could have done better if there had been more of us to help with the clues. Would recommend it.
Awesome entertainment. Amazing time to spend in a group. Full of adrenaline trying to find your way out! We were a group of 4 people and all had plenty to do there.

Clever Mind Game!. How long will it take you to uncover the clues and crack the case? We played "The Alchemist" MindMaze as well as a similar attraction in Berlin. A completely unique experience, with a storybook environment created for you to explore and riddles for you to solve. Great for families or groups of friends.

A-maze-ing. Absolutely fantastic time in the Enigma room. There is also the Alchemist's Chamber and we loved Enigma so much we have already booked it to do in a couple of days.Booking in advance is advisable. Particularly on a weekend.If you get stuck, you can be given hints. Definitely recommended.

A nice and funny challenge. We were a team of two people. We didn't have any expectations of the place and didn't make any research. Maybe that's why it took us for a while to figure out what we had to do and there was many minutes lost. Anyway, it was really funny and genius even though we didn't solve the challenge in the 60 minutes. I guess next time we go to a place like this it's much more easy to get started.But if you want to have a good time at least for one hour, I highly recommend mind maze. BUT REMEMBER TO BOOK IT IN ADVANCE!! It might be also more easy if you have a team of 3-5 persons.
Amazing!. The staff was very friendly, and the experience was just great! Felt like a real sense of accomplishment after we cracked it in 45 minutes! Highly recommended!!

Amazing!. What a amazing fun it was. The staff was so nice and helpful. Everything was explained realy well for us before the game and then when we ran into problems solving the mystery. Highly reckomend this for everyone.

Mixed Views. Might have been a bit too hungover to enjoy this but was not what we expected. We were put into a room with a blank piece of paper and that was it. No instruction given whatsoever. Maybe this was the point but took us some time to get going so we didn't get to solve it and when they gave us the answer it seemed very complex but I'm sure this is a challenge some people will love. Staff were really nice and helpful.

Great experience. "You have one hour to figure the way out!" For me and my 3 friends, this is definitely an hour to remember. The puzzles are creative and challenging, while simple enough for everyone to get grasp of (no matter the age or language). The story is very nice and it is quite stunning how many riddles are fitted in such a small space. The staff is very friendly and helpful. A definite must go!

Excellent challenge. We entered the room not knowing what to expect and where to start. It was a real challenge and lots of fun. We managed to get out of the alchemist chamber in 58 minutes so were really pleased with ourselves. Something different and fun.

Well spent hour in Prague. Looking back on our 4 days trip to Prague, this one hour seems one of the 3 highlights.It is the first time we did such a maze/riddle room and we loved it.Not a trivial or simple one, it is something we will remember for a long time.

Fun way to spend an hour (or less). Very interesting and fun thing to do with your friends. The guys working there are really friendly and helpful, you feel like they are really happy to have you there.We did the ENIGMA room, 5 people but I think we might have been better with 4 since we ended up checking the same things several times. Or perhaps our communication was not quite as good as it should have been.

So much fun!. This was a unique and unexpected highlight on our trip to Prague. There were 6 of us enjoying this experience -- though even just two people would have a great time. We mastered the challenge of puzzles, equations, and mysteries in 52 mins. It was unlike any thing we've done in the past and we are still talking about it, days later. Enjoy!

Addicting game.. Very addicting game.I suffered from a bit poskazok by radio - it's hard to make out. But the staff was able to suggest using the the sheets under the door.Was upset that I ordered Alchemist's Chambery and I was provided ENIGMA

Great Idea. We did the Alchemists Room, a great idea well executed. Finished with 20 seconds to spare, needed some hints though. The host was great and gave just enough help to keep us going. A little expensive for only 2 people but I'd definitely recommend splashing out on this. If you have 3 or 4 it would be better value, 5 might be too many though.

Mind-blown @ mindmaze!. After a few days in Prague, we decided to check Tripadvisor for recommendations for other attractions and activities and came across Mindmaze. We decided to book an appointment for Alchemist Chamber and found it a great way to spend an evening. We went as a couple but can imagine in larger groups it would still go down a treat and would be easier. The puzzles are tricky but not impossible. Having got such a buzz from the Alchemist Chamber, we decided to return for the Enigma room and enjoyed that even more! Throw yourself into the puzzle, once you build up some momentum- it's brilliant! The staff are extremely friendly and helpful game masters. I would advise to book in advance to ensure you don't miss out on the experience! Having completed both rooms we are not surprised Mindmaze is no. 1 on Tripadvisor! Well done and thanks for a great time!

Fantastic! Great family time!. While planning our trip to Prague, of course we took notice of this attraction on Trip Advisor! We booked a 10am appt and I believe we dealt with Steven (the week is a blue now with names) and were given the rules. We went to work! Just ingenious and we had a wondrful time. We escaped (with 1 hint) in 50 minutes. My 11 year old son loved it and well worth the cost! Put your thinking caps on and get to work! We would have loved to try the new harder room but time did not permit.

Good value for a large group. My wife and I just finished the alchemist chamber today and had a blast. I knocked off stars for two reasons:1- our guide was less than enthusiastic. I'm not sure if he was really watching because at one point he thought we were behind and gave us a hint for a puzzle we had solved almost 10 minutes prior (we solved it out of order).2- the price was a bit much for two people (the price is fixed per room). I understand that they still need to make money but there should be an option to team up with other small groups.In conclusion, there appear to be multiple companies offering this kind of experience now. This was the first escape maze that I have done but there was nothing in this experience to make me think that it couldn't be replicated by someone else just as well.I wouldn't be afraid to try another company if you can find a better price.

Fantastic adventure.. We have been to prague a couple of times and seen a large number of Prague attractions and sights. This had been suggested to us, so I booked it before our trip.
