We were not sure what to expect, but up for a challenge. The four of us were locked in a very interesting room. We racked our brains, searched and tried to think out the box. The time flew by and we enjoyed every minute. We had a fantastic time and manged to get out in 53 mins which we were very pleased with. If you have a spare hour and want to take part in a very unusual and memorable experience, this is a must. We did the Alcamist's lab. If there was a vacancy we would have done the military mission As well! Enjoy

Awesome! Top attraction in prague. Top attraction in prague in my opinion. Well worth a visit. Very clever clues and games. The hour flies by. Really good fun for all ages and abilities. Can't recommend this highly enough

Mind crazy and pretty intense with a heap of fun!. Awesome experience. Although the 3 in our team failed in the Alchemist room (we were kinda close!) we'll definitely go back and try the other. Really friendly staff. Great location. Completely interesting!
Far better than expected. Highly recommend this to anyone visiting Prague. Only takes about an hour and its a great team and brain game. Staff is super friendly and helpful. Really fun.

Fantastic . We visited MindMaze on our visit to Prague last week and had heard very good things. We weren't disappointed at all, in fact we can't wait to visit again when we return to Prague. If you have a spare hour whilst in Prague you must try this. Don't forget to book beforehand though. Enjoy!!
Different. and fun, went with group of 4 people and we managed to escape within 45 minutes, couldn't find the first clue, but than it was falling together like a puzzle.

Outstanding!. This was lots! of fun and a fantastic way to spend an hour in Prague. Host Paul was great - friendly and a great lifeline when the going got tough. There were only two of us - we made it out (just) with a couple of hints, but it might be easier with an extra person or two as there's quite a lot to think about! Would definitely do this again in a heartbeat - we explored the Alchemy room, but would like to give the Enigma room a try too.

Cool!!. I went to this place with work colleague and it was very cooool!
I thought I would be easy but we didn't manage to solve everything without the support via talky walky :-D
Recommend this to friends, families and work/TB.

Very different and very good. Read the reviews for this place so was really excited to do it. It was just me and my boyfriend, we did the enigma room and it certainly didn't disappoint and I think having just 2 of you is perfect. It was so much fun and I'd like to do the other room. I'd definitely recommend!
Awesome. Lots of fun. We did the Alchemist's room, and it was challenging and clever. Highly recommended if you like escape games.

Mood changer. I was really tired and grumpy because because of all the walking and sight seeing... I wasn't really feel like i was in mood for "escape game"... But it was incrediblely fun... Both me and my girlfriend enjoyed it a lot... When you are in the room time flies like an arrow.. We end up solving the alchemist's chamber puzzle with few tips from our guide on walkie-talkie... Its a great opportunity for team building exercise with family or friends... If you like puzzle solving... I definitely recommend it

Fun for the family. Our family had a great time doing this activity. We weren't sure what to expect, but felt it was done professionally and the staff was very helpful and friendly. Would totally do it again :)

Great Fun. As others have said, could be tricky to find. Staff are very friendly, speak excellent English. The four of us had great fun working through the clues, and all agreed we would do another mind maze. We did 44 minutes (hungover). If you get stuck on one aspect for too long, they can give you a hint.
very cool game. try it! It is a lot of fun. But only in English. friendly staff, not easy to find, use GPS. Would do that, again. There are different types of games available

MindMaze as team building. MindMaze was really great. We went there with my colleagues as part of team building and truly enjoyed the whole thing. As you discover one piece of mistery after another you are being drawn into it. MindMaze crew was good too, they provide you clear and helpful advices if necessary but you have to think about it nonetheless. I would try other room any time. Thank you :)

So much fun :). I was booked to do the Alchemists Chamber with a friend, just the 2 of us. When we got there, there was another couple who had popped in on the off chance they could get in so they joined and thank goodness they did! I think it's definitely best suited for groups of at least 4. Our guide was very helpful with clues when we were looking obviously lost and we managed it within the allotted hour - just! Lots of fun, very 'Crystal Maze' and i'd highly recommend it.
Great fun!. We managed, with a number of hints trough the walkie talkie, to exit from the chamber of the alchemist in 59 mins! Really enjoyed it and worthed the money. Strongly recommended!

An absolute must. What can I say that hasn't been said in earlier reviews, this is pure and simply fantastic fun. It is very well organised and we just thoroughly enjoyed the experience, we were a group of 4 and unfortunately were not quite on the ball enough to complete the challenge in the allocated 60 mins ( 2 minutes over) but it wouldn't be fun if it was easy!Loved it, definitely must do if in Prague
A must do!. So much infuriating fun. Got to use your brain but such a laugh. Would definitely recommend. Well worth the money.

good experience but not No1 destination in Prague!. an innovative way of having fun...a little bit expensive (for Prague level of pricing)...at least 3 or 4 people must play to find easily the solution

Unique experience that keeps you guessing!. Based on the raving reviews I saw on Tripadvisor I thought this might be a fun and unique thing for my partner and I to experience in our short visit to Prague.We booked the Alchemists chamber and we felt like two kids again! I'm pretty sure the guide was having a good laugh at me when I was on the floor with my hand stuck through a wall!All very amusing and some puzzles are quite tricky but with a little help we managed to finish with seconds to spare! Highly recommended.

Really fun activity!!. The location wasn`t very Hard to find at all. We had booked the Alchemist's Chamber and the room was really nicely done. We were only two people and maybe one or two extra pairs of eyes would have helped, because we barely made it in 56 minutes and we did have to use the walky-talky for hints several times. But it was really fun and I can highly recommend it!
So FUN!. This is such a fantastic idea and this maze is very well thought out. We went with a group of 6 and it was the perfect size. Yes...we got out in time. Good luck!

Excellent for teenagers. We're a uk family with two teenage girls 13/15.Booked two sessions after reading about it on trip advisor,and weren't disappointed.35 pounds a game,which is reasonable for an hour for 4..Not the easiest place to find ( recommend the three pound taxi from Prague 1),but once the door opened and we descended down the stairs,the fun started.An excellent way to spend a couple of hours..we had to work as a team,and the girls loved it.I shall not spoil the games ( we did enigma and the Alchemists room: the former in 75 mins,and the latter 50) but they do stretch you,and we needed a few clues over the Wilkie talkie.To enhance the games,I think they need to build the scene setting.Currently you are verbally given instructions,and it would be better on a video to get you 'into character' whilst waiting.We finished one game after 75,and moved straight onto the next.A video would have allowed a breather too.Am told a third game will be opened by the two Hungarian young entrepreneurs in the summer,and I wish them well.A great way to spend quality family time in this stunning,fascinating city.

Exciting and fun!. The staff was friendly; suprisingly good english. The puzzles were interesting, entertaining, fun and just the right difficulty (played in a group of 4). After finishing the Alchemist's chamber we wanted to play another game.***HINT/SPOILER***Don't drink the red potion!

Extremely fun. To keep it nice and sweet, this is some of the best fun I have ever had.Went and played the philosophers room on my first visit, and enjoyed it so much that we booked the next day to play the WW2 room.Highly recommended.I would advise a bigger group for the WW2 room though as it is more challenging.

MIND-aMAZing!!!. Myself and my partner had read about Mind Maze before we came to Prague and loved the sound of it. We managed to make a booking just 2 days in advance for the Alchemist's Chamber and it turned out it was just 2 mins walk from our hotel! Perfect! Of all the great things we have done on our trip to Prague we have found this one to stand out as it is something so different to the norm. The puzzle is so well thought out and enough of a challenge for us twenty-somethings to find it both exhiliarating and frustrating - we made it out with just seconds to spare!! I can imagine families and groups of older children loving this experience as well. The staff are very helpful and friendly and this experience is well worth the money! A must-do if you are in Prague!!!

Great day!!!!. Me my mum dad and sister greatly enjoyed this activity we did the alchemist chamber and found it very fun and challenging we got out in about 56 minuets! The price was very good for the activity.

Good Family Fun. This is a great way to spend time your children or close friends. You will work together to try to escape from a room by finding clues and solving puzzles and riddles. Makes the trip more memorable if your visiting Prague, and if you're a local it's a way to spend some time.

Best thing about our visit. My friends & I were most excited about this when visiting Prague and it didn't disappoint. Easy to find by using a Prague street map I downloaded to my phone and entrance to building is wellSign posted. The guy who worked there was really helpful and friendly and is available to give clues if needed. The game was great, was so much fun. Didn't want it to end! Will be looking for similar things in the UK!

just brilliant. Such a clever idea. We loved this game which requires you to find and solve puzzles to win your exit from the room. It cost 1200 Cz for 3 of us for the one hour game and was money well spent. The staff are lovely and speak excellent English. Take metro to IP Pavlova to get there.
Random and brilliant. An awful lot of fun, even if i did leave with a headache. Very helpful and friendly staff. I wouldn't ruin any more, it is a great way to spend your day!
Fun! . We did the Enigma room today and had so much fun the whole family. We've been to Boda Borg in Sweden and this adventure reminds of that only not as physical. Great adventure!
great. We were as a family of four. Our daughter is 16, son is 13. This was the funnest event of Prague trip.

Challenging but rewarding . Me and my girlfriend visited MindMaze in October 2014, and despite running slightly late, we were made to feel very welcome. The room itself (Alchemists Chamber) is well laid out, and once you solve your first clue you really start to work out the puzzles. I also like the fact that there are some objects that are simply 'red herrings' just to throw you off the scent. We successfully made it out of the room after 52 minutes. A must-do for those visiting this fantastic city.

Brilliant fun!. This was a really fun thing to do with a group of friends in Prague! The staff were very friendly and didn't laugh at us too much when we had to keep asking for clues! Definitely recommend it if you have a spare hour and want to do something different.

Highly recommend for something totally different. Booked Mindmaze after seeing the reviews on Trip Advisor. The experience did not disappoint. We were met by their very friendly staff who welcomed us and off we set for our hour's adventure. The puzzles were great, quite tricky and required some logical and out of the box thinking but the staff are on hand to provide clues (which we needed more than once) This didn't detract from the experience though and we had a great time laughing at how we'd wander down the wrong road of thinking so easily. After all the beautiful sights and history of this wonderful city, I would highly recommend mixing it up with some light relief and puzzling fun
Great!!!. Totally worth it, the staff was really friendly and the activity properly planed. I will do it again, can[t wait to do the second maze that they have.

Really fun. Our group had a great time here, the staff were very friendly and accommodating even though we arrived 30 mins late (the place is hard to find so leave yourself plenty of time to get there!). Great group activity.
brilliant fun for all ages. We thought that maybe being 20 somethings that this may just be for the smaller kids, oh how we where wrong this place is an absolute blast well worth a visit.

So much frustrating fun!. This was so cool! We really enjoyed ourselves. So frustrating but so fun and something I definitely want to do again. If you like the escape the room games, you will love this. Highly recommended :)

Amazing think-out-of-the-box activity. We booked "Enigma" - this was the first time we tried anything of the sort. Some clues required some pretty far out of the box thinking, but all made sense within the setting. We failed to complete the puzzle within the hour after making a couple of mistakes, but had so much fun we decided to come back and try their other room 'Philosophers Stone' a couple of days later. Really good experience, highly recommended for groups of 2-4 people.

Good experience. For someone from the US this was a very different experience. My fiance and I tried this out after seeing reviews on Trip Advisor and it was a lot of fun. A good change of pace from the typical sightseeing. We did the Enigma room which was sort of difficult. I think we made it more difficult because we got a little out of order which made things pretty confusing. We did end up getting out but only with the help of the worker there. He told us the other rooms are a little easier so if it's your first time you might want to try those instead. Overall fun experience though and worth checking out if you're looking for something different to do for a couple hours.

Great way to spend an hour in Prague. I read the reviews of this place but even after reading them I was a bit unsure what to expect. We were staying close to the place so I though I'd give it a try even though it was one of the more expensive things we done in Prague (I speak relatively to other attractions in Prague.)I was even more worried about how my wife would react as when I told her they lock us in a room and we had to get out, her face dropped.I needn't have worried. As soon as we entered the Alchemists Chamber we had a problem to solve and we both set about it despite having arguments along the way! Problems were set easy to difficult, some of the clues were to throw you. Not everything is as it seems and some lateral thinking is required. We missed some obvious clues which set us back but at all times our guide who was watching us, threw us some hints and put us on the correct path. We didn't finish the room but we got pretty close. There were only 2 of us but the room can accommodate 6, I think 4 people is the right amount to get those brains working together (and also make the challenge relatively cheaper).I'll certainly be going to the other room if/ when I go back to this fabulous city.One thing I would suggest to the owners if they are considering expanding is create a challenge for Children. Some of the challenges were difficult enough for adults but something set towards 8-14 year olds would certainly keep parents happy watching from the outside in, maybe giving some hints just as our host did.Overall I really enjoyed this and I'll look up similar type of games when I visit other cities. Overall a rewarding experience.

Loads of fun. Loved this, originally been to Trap in Budapest so gave this a go, locked in a jail cell and have to escape before the time runs out- we did it in just over the hour with a few hints along the way- give it a go if you like escape games.

A-maze-ing !. We went a first time to the MindMaze and played the "Alchemist's chamber"We loved it so much that we booked another session for the second room "Enigma".Both rooms are very amazing. The design of each one is really fantastic! The game was really challenging as we expected.We had a very good experience both with the game and the crew! As if the price seems a little bit expensive for a two-group, we don't regret to have play both rooms! P.S : The room Enigma is harder than the other one! I think it's better to start with the alchemist's one.

One of the best spent hours in Prague. We tried the Enigma room. It was great fun, and I wish we had more than an hour (it ends so quickly!). I can also recommend it for couples.The Alchemist room might be easier though.
Great game!. We had such a good time in the Alchemist Chamber! This is a game you should't miss while in Prague! The staff are friendly and give you hints only if you want and you are stuck.

Ultimate fun. We went to MindMaze last night in a group of 5 people and all of us had a really great fun. The game, particularly the Alchymist chamber, is well set up and really requires you thinking logically. The staff here was very friendly and gave us the clues when we got stuck.Overall, it was a great experience that I could recommend to anyone.
A fantastic moment. We did the Enigma and enjoyed every minute! If I go back to Prague i would certainly visit mindmaze again.

Brilliant!. This was such fun my son (23) and I went back again to try another room. Certainly tests the brain cells. Particularly liked trying to find the submarine blueprints. Shame there were not more rooms to try as we would probably have gone back again. A great way to pass an hour or so and made a nice change from sightseeing. Definitely recommend it.

Fun. This was a lot of fun. Very well set up. The staff were very friendly. They gave extra clues when we got stuck. This was skilfully timed. We were just a couple, but would probably be easier in a group with more brains to work on the clues, but we did enjoy it a lot.

Absorbing. Went as a group of 4 to this,1 of the other guys had booked it as he had done 1 of these escape games before in Budapest. As it turned out I was the only one of the group who hadn't done 1 before so didn't quite know what to expect. We had no trouble finding the venue & once inside received a good briefing.The challange was good, managed to solve most of the clues but failed finally because our maths let us down ! Great way to pass an hour & very good value for money, highly recommended
Don't miss it!. We've just gone to the alchemist chambert, it was so much fun! We were three (I think that it's enough) and enjoyed it a lot. We are thinking already to go to the other room.

Great fun. Tried this with my two daughters 12 and 14, and we had a blast. The puzzles are hard, but makes sense, so you never feel left out, and when the guide asks if you want a hint, and you say yes, you always go "ahhh, but of course..."Guide was really nice. Took our picture afterwards, and send it to us at no extra cost. How is that for great customer service?All in all a superb way to spend an hour in Prague, at a very reasonable price.

Better than expected. We were a group of 4 people and went to the Alchemist room. It was very fun for all of us, and as we were 4 not that pricy. The first clue is rather harder to find, as you just start searching for everything when you get into the room, but as soon as you find it everything flows smoothly. We did it in approximately 45 minutes. We all recommend this !!!

Great if you love puzzles and riddles :D . I was there 18.10 and it was great, the instructions were clear and it was so difficult at half the game. We manage to finish it but will definitely check out the other room. We were in Enigma, I recommend going to Alchemist first, it's a bit easier.

A must-do!. Our instructor was Thomas. He explained everything clearly and was on hand when he noticed us struggling a couple of times, so generally he was enthusiastic and attentive. Overall it was very interesting, fun and different. I can see how this would be the number #1 attraction in Prague, it's like nothing else we've done before. Very exciting!! Worth a visit, easy to get to; just around the corner from I P Pavlova stop :) however, feel free to use the Starbucks next to the stop for free wifi if you are struggling with directions ;)

Much fun!. We had a great time. Was challenging and amusing :) we didn't know what to expect and we were very surprised of how much fun it was. Highly recommend to visit. We'll come back in our next visit to Prague, and wish for more mazes around the world.
Exciting!. Very exciting! Something we havn't tried before! Lots of fun!A fun family activity!You should definitly try it

Great fun. Visited Prague with my 21 year old daughter and we picked this as a diversion from the sightseeing and beers lol. Such great fun solving puzzles and logic problems. Only instruction was the objective of the task and how to use the radio in case we needed help. We managed to complete it in around 50 mins. Very worth while and would recommend it to anybody. Hope they plan to expand and make more games soon. 10/10.
Great fun. Went with a group of 5 tonight and it was great fun! Solved it in 56 minutes! You should defo go if you have the chance, really unusual and challenging

Well worth it- so exciting!. Me and my dad went to this and were locked in the ENIGMA room. AMAZING! It was so much fun and really works your mind. We are very logical people so had bundles of fun! The staff give you hints if you are really confused but it is so much fun! Highly recommend and worth every penny!
Fantastic fun !. Had a great time !!!! Would certainly recommend it to visitors to Prague. The hour passes so quickly and is so much fun..Great fun for all .

So much fun!. We had already done two exit games of TRAP earlier on our trip and decided to try also one of the rooms of Mindmaze (Alchemist chamber), because the first ones were so much fun! I love puzzles and these exit games were highlights of our stay in Prague :) We played all the rooms as a team of two.Alchemist chamber had very nice decorations and setting, but we maybe liked the TRAP puzzles little bit more. Both companies were very nice and all the rooms were different!

A great attraction!. Me anf my wife did the alchemist chamberon 8.10 and LOVED it!The room is great, there are alot of litte clues which you have to add up and if the guide sees that you got stuck he'll give you a small hint to help you going.it's not easy at all!Highly recommended!

Great experience for couples!. We booked the Alchemist's Chamber and were not disappointed even though we had very high expectations. Mindmaze is great fun and probably one of the best attractions in Prague!!

Awesome Nerdgasm Fun! . My boyfriend and I visited Mindmaze one of the first evenings we were in Prague. It was a great experience. A little hard to find at night as the outside building was dark but that was a little warm up for what turned out to be an amazing experience. Once we arrived we were locked in a jail cell and given 1 hour to get out and find the submarine blueprints in order to get out of the room itself. We had a great time working together to solve puzzles and find keys to various locks in order to get out. The background music and room design were superb, making the experience feel even more real. It is not possible to do this maze alone so it made teamwork as a couple so much fun. We would have gone back another day and done the Alchemist's Chamber room but they were booked. Highly recommend you make reservations a week or two early. Very worth it.
Something special!. Really a great choice if you want a change from studying buildings and churches. It really activates you, but dont go there in a hang over! Much, much more difficult ;)

Exciting family activity. This was good fun. You're locked up in a room and within an hour your goal is to unlock a gem by a combination of searching and solving logical puzzles. We were a family of 4 with two children of 10 and 12. Although many of the logic puzzles were too difficult for the children, they enjoyed the MindMaze. Good family activity.

Brilliant fun!. We went to Mindmaze as a group of four and had a brilliant time. We found all the keys without too much trouble but struggled a bit with the rest and had to be given some clues. It didn't stop the fun and with the timer running out the rush was on to complete the task. Would definitely go back to try enigma next time we're in Prague.

Creative thinking on your holiday. If you want a fun and unusual activity to do during your city weekend in Prague. You get locked into a room and you have to solve the mystery of the alchemist. The goal is to find the philosophers stone and get out of the room. This activity really challenges your mind and brings out your creativity. We recommend you to be 2-4 people solving the case to get the best experience.Practical details: - You have to book in advance and the weekends are almost always full.- Kind of hard to find since it is located in an apartment building.- Cash onlyWe highly recommend this to everyone who visits Prague.
#1 on TA for a reason!. Lots of fun. Host was very helpful and kind. Easily best money spent in Prague. Book it now, you'll thank me later

So much fun. Definitely a change to anything we had done before! Think like you were on the Crystal Maze or something of the like. Everyone was friendly and made the experience very fun. we were in a group of two so we did ask for a few clues which were helpful. You don't feel trapped or anything its just fun. One thing I would say is don't be put off by the location, it's nice that it's hidden away as a sort of secret, but it is a bit strange going into a building not in the centre of town. But as soon as we got downstairs it was completely fine :) Have a go at this! It's not expensive and you'll definitely enjoy it!!

SOOOOO much fun!. This was the most fun I've had in a long time. You get locked in a room (with a walkie-talkie if you need help) and have an hour to get out of there. You get to basically tear the room apart, looking for clues for your mission. We were a group of friends, all in our 20's, and we were all having such a good time. Hugely RECOMMENDED!

Fantastic experience!. Visited Prague as the last stop on a two week tour of Eastern Europe. We had seen plenty of churches, museums, castles, etc... and wanted something different. This hit the spot! We had so much fun doing the Alchemist's Chamber that we went back the next day and did Enigma as well. The price is great for the experience you get, and the thematic elements in the puzzles are well done and a lot of fun. Can't wait to get home and tell some friends and family about this!

Excellent!!. we had a blast playing this game!! the team is really nice, the smallest details are thought of and the hour passes sooo fast!!! we even got 10min extra from our nice host to get out of the room... and we did!! :):) you have to try it!!

Brilliant. A must visit attraction when in this amazing city. Staff were friendly and helpful, all organised very well. We did the enigma room which was great fun, bit mind boggling at times but top notch none the less. 5/5 all day long. Don't miss out!! Booking in advance is a must though as there's very limited spaces.

dazzling experience. The best hour spent in Prague (where I had to use my brain). All the HOGs I played finally paid off. ENIGMA is probably the best chamber in the whole place and we are lucky to having solved it in 43 minutes. You might think it's easy, but it's tricky. No worries, they have a camera in the room and the member of the staff who explains to you what to do/don't, will continuously keep an eye on you and maybe help you in case you're feeling a bit lost. Totally worth the money!!

Mindmaze was awesome. I (25) booked mindmaze as a surprise for my mum (54) and my little sister (16), when we were in prague.As we arrived, we were totally anxious and nervous.But the mindmaze staff was very nice and friendly. As soon as we were in the alchemist chamber the challenge started.Absolutly mindblowing. The hints are challenging and loooots of fun.You don't need any special skills as you might think. It's just lots of mindpuzzles and logical thinking.We made it out in 53minutes.Mindmaze made our day. So let's book the mindmaze adventure in advance and experience a a hole new kind of interactive games.

Great fun. We loved it, all of us 4 adults and a 10-year old. At first, we didn't try too hard because we were afraid we'd solve the riddles too quickly (ha, so overconfident!). Then after 30 min we got slightly panicky, making zero headway, we just couldn't find the clue. Turns out one of us had stuck a key into his pocket early in the game and just forgot all about it. What a laugh! Truly, we had a great time and would have liked to go on to the next room straight away....

We escaped!. This was by far one of the highlights of our trip to Prague! It was fun and an incredible adrenaline rush. The staff are professional and approachable and are happy to help you along the way if you get stuck. I would definitely recommend this experience for a unique "off the beaten path" adventure that will leave you smiling and with an incredible rush and sense of accomplishment!

My second time there. Me and my friend went on February to the alchemist room, it was my first ever room escape and was so good that it got me well hooked on these things. So since we got to visit Prague again we found ourselves again in one of their rooms. This one is their second room, a new one that had opened recently. The Enigma room was just as good as the alchemist. The background story was interesting, the sound effects and decoration made it all feel so real. It may be a bit harder than the Alchemist room, but we did it as a couple and made it out with time to spare. So if we can do it (and we're not that smart), anyone can. What a great way to spend your money. I know it's a bit more expensive than the other room escapes in Prague, but it's also the best. Also, I should note that the toilet outside is very clean, the place is very neat and aesthetic and the crew seems very nice and is happy to help. Do not miss it!

Great family activity. We went as a family (2 adults, 2 kids 12 and 10). We had a ball. Solving logical puzzles to escape the gaol and then escape the Enigma room. We got through the first 3/4's of the game without many hints but the end got a bit tricky. The last section was probably a little too cryptic rather than logical or lateral but still a great adventure.
Great way to spend an hour!!. Awesome time. Friendly staff. Mind boggling puzzles. Great way to spend an hour or so when in this great city!!

Awsome! Expensive though.... We had so much fun! Managed to escape after 50 minutes. As it was just the two of us, it was very expensive, so make sure you're a group of 4-6 to make the price less of an issue, and book it in their website.

Awesome. We did first the second world war room, it was really exciting prepared with awesome sounds effects and authentic decoration but unfortunately one of the object was broken so we couldn't finish the game ...nevertheless thanks to our guide we got a free game for the alchemist room as a apologise.we really appreciated the gesture.Both are great rooms but found the alchemist enigma a bit harder to resolve..
Best hour in Prague. We participated with our two young daughters and we loved it. A perfect family outing you won't forget!

Absolutely mind blowing epic nerdgasm awesomeness.. This appealed to the geek in us in every way possible very well thought out puzzles. Friendly staff and a great experience. Can't wait to do the next room.

Made my honeymoon unique . My wife and I visited one afternoon on our honeymoon. The staff was fantastic and made our experience memorable. Thus challenged not only our minds but helped show how well we work together under stress. We loved it so much as soon as we got WiFi we booked a reservation the next day for Enigma! Absolutely loved this place and wish I could take all my friends here. Pros Great staff Well thought outWe arrived early and they still accommodated usAfter we completed the challenge the staff talked to us about our time and answered all of our questions We felt very comfortable thereThey even helped us find directions to our hotel and offered to call a taxi for us! ConsThe front door was broken. Made me feel like that was the first and last puzzle. Not Mindmaze fault, entirely on the building owner. The room was hot. This caused at least a little sweating and at worst me to get a little flustered. I chalk it up to the season and an unusually warm day outside. Bottom line if you have 60 minutes and 1200 czk you'd be an absolute fool to not walk through this beautiful city and experience Mindmaze. Worth our time and money at double!

Amazing experience. First time I have tried anything like this! A completely amazing experience that is well worth the money!We chose alchemists chamber as enigma only opened last Monday and I booked in advance! It was very well thought outWe would have loved to have returned to do enigma if we had had more time in Prague Give it a shot people, the staff are friendly and also helpfulIf you get stuck

Great game. Worth the visit. Really well set up puzzle rooms for you to figure out. We did the alchemist chamber first which we basically finished really quickly. The second room, Enigma, was a real challenge! There were just two of us and we'd probably have finished a lot quicker if we weren't so hungover :) Anyway, it was great fun, can recommend.
Enigma quest. We tried the Enigma challenge and can really recommend this. We where to persons but you could be up to five. Dress in light light clothes!
Enjoy a unique experience. Sleuthed hither and thither with my friends. How often can you do that? Went once and had to go back for the second challenge.
Very entertaining. One hour of entertainment with my friends. We had a lot of fun there. A captivating mind game where your observation and team work is required.

Amazing way to feel Prague . Went as a group of 4. Had a blast !! The game blends in so well with the castle themed city of Prague ! The host were really friendly as well. Do visit if you're in Prague.

So much fun!. As a couple of engineers, we figured we'd take on any mind game that they could throw at us. This was a fun one! The two puzzles that they have set up are challenging and require a lot of lateral thinking to solve. We needed a couple of hints now and then but in general we solved the problems ourselves. Definitely not one for the claustrophobic, though, as the Enigma game starts with you locked in a cell! The place is a little bit out of the way, so if you're following Google Maps, just trust that it is taking you to the right place. It's well worth it. Also note that they only take cash (no credit card) - so make sure you come prepared!

Lots of Fun. My brother and I had an amazing time in the Alchemist's Chamber going through everything possible to look for keys and clues! This was our first time experiencing this type of event where you are locked in a room and have to find your way our by solving problems. It was put together really well and the staff was more than friendly and helpful! I would recommend this to anyone in town and would do this again in a heartbeat!

Fun and unique experience. I went here as a group of 4 & had so much fun! We all loved the experience even though some in my group were skeptical in the beginning. You dont have to know anything about the game to have fun & there are people there to help guide you if u get stuck. Highly recommended!

Totally worth it!. We were 2 couples that visited the location twice, solving both of the chambers in the required time.The rooms are very well equipped and imprint the story in your memory. The puzzles are not hard, but not too easy, you just need to pay attention to details around the room. Staff is very nice and helpful. I would say I like the new room, Enigma, more than the Alchemist Chamber, but they are very close in terms of points.If you are in Prague, just give it a try as you will be hooked on the game :)I really hope the guys will come up with more rooms and locations for addicts like us.
Fun game. We had a lot of fun. We managed to get out just in time...with a little help from the instructor. We recommend it to everyone having fun solving riddles.

Visit mindmaze during your stay in Prague!. I visited Prague with a friend of mine, and we wanted to do something different whilst there. Reading the reviews on tripadvisor, we decided to try Mindmaze, and it was SOOO worth it!! So basically, you're locked-up in a room, and you need to find clues in the room to get out. (there is a panic button if you get claustrophobic no no panic). The staff was super nice and friendly, even if we had some serious difficulties to find our clues. (but finding them The atmosphere in the room is very nice (we were in the alchemist room), with the mysterious music coming to play every now and then. It's a little difficult to find the place, as the sign outside it quite small. I highly recommend this!

Amazing and fun!. We visited Mind Maze our last night in Prague (there were 4 of us) and it was definitely a highlight. It was a little difficult to find, but a good "warm up" for the game itself. We were locked in a room and charged with escaping within the hour, using clues and various items in the room. We had a GREAT time unraveling the puzzles and working together, and (with a few clues from our host, Paul) were able to escape with the prize! Very well thought out, challenging and fun! Since there were four of us, I wasn't involved in every "solve" and would love to go back on my next trip (hopefully in a year or two) and try again. If you like puzzles, mysteries and a challenge, I HIGHLY recommend this for an hour of great entertainment.

Well worth it!. I completed the enigma room with four friends and we really enjoyed it! It's amazing how we could miss some obvious clues, but we completed the challenge inside the hour timeframe. I would defo recommend this, but it's quite hard to locate the place itself so give yourself a little extra time to get there. Staff were absolute gents

Very interesting and puzzling... It was hard to find the place but all tiredness forgotten with the opening of the door. Joyfull curiousity and stress is the best way to adrenalin. Would be better in a better and central place in Prague, also with an air condition room. But still worth for it. Thank you for this great hour mindmaze...

a-MAZE-iiinggggg experience!. Decided to try this because we were tired of sightseeing. This was definitely something else. We were given a scenario and were put into a difficult situation and had to find a way out of it by solving different puzzles. The background music and room design were superb, making the experience feel even more real. Ours was quite an intense one but we got some good tips to help us out along the way. Give this a shot when you need a break from Prague.

A unique & great experience. We visited Mind Maze while in prague and had a fantastic time. It was a little too difficult in my opinion, but with the help of the very cheerful Thomasz, we did solve the puzzle! The location looks a little dogy at first, but the place itself was nicely done. Highly recommended for a different way to spend some hours with friends/family.

Some serious fun!. I went to Prague with my wife for a long weekend. We went to the Alchemist's Chamber which is really well done. The environment, the noises, everything is really detailed, which makes you feel you are really in some other time or realm. The game itself is well planned. It's not too easy, but not too hard, giving the experience one's expect from a good game. I definitely recommend it for everyone!We had the privilege to try out the upcoming ENIGMA game too, which, if possible, is offering even more fun in a totally different setting. It is a bit harder than the Alchemist's Chamber, but for those, who really likes puzzles, it will be absolutely indispensable.
wooow. best prague fun experience. near ankora hotel where we stayed. amazing !!! highly recommended ! so wooooow !!!
Great fun! . The Mind Maze was definitely worth a visit and the price paid! Great fun and not too challenging but we still needed a few hints! Definetly visit if you are In Prague.

A great thing to do in Prague!. We did a couple of escape games during our weekend, we loved Mindmaze so much! It was great fun, a really good thing to do as a couple as kept us both entertained. We escaped in 59 minutes! Definitely recommend!

An excellent experience. My husband and I truly enjoyed it. The staff who welcomed us was very nice, friendly and patient with us. It was a challenging exit game, through which we learn teamwork is so important, even for husband and wife. :) You will not regret playing it. It was fun!

Cool game to play!. A really exciting game for a company! Our team consisted of two couples and I think it's best to play this game in a group of 3 or 4 people. The room is well designed and furnished, the puzzles are pretty complex and intricate but thanks to the attentive staff you always receive some small hints when you are lost and don't know what to do next. Moreover, a new room is going to be opened soon, so we are looking forward to coming back and trying it :)

Room escape. The place is a bit out of the way from old town prague but worth the trip. Better to take a taxi there and walking back is mostly down hill and not to bad. It's a fun hour trying to escape the room using only clues

Makes you think. This place is not only fun, it makes you think! It took us about an hour to get out of that room but we had fun looking for clues, finding keys and searching for locks. This is a great place to spend time and work as a team with your better half, your kids or friends. I would recommend not to judge the outside of the building, because the staff was friendly and the place super clean (like they say, don't judge the book by its cover) great place to have an hour of fun!

Awesome! Very unique. . We had a great time doing the mind maze. It was easy to reserve a time online and once we found our way to the place, had a blast! Im not going to give any hints on here but just know it is very challenging! The location could be better but all in all, awesome time! Good luck!

Great fun. This was a nice way to spend a monday evening after all the walking at prague castle. It was fun and exciting all at the same time. It really makes you work as a team. You get some good laughs whilst trying to get out of the room and the guy was really helpful and friendly. I would recommend this activity. My best friend and i had such an awesome time.

Great. This is simply fun. It's made in a very clever way, and I highly recommend it. It is best to be with a group of 4 to do this, and if you don't know what to do in Prague, then this is a definite highlight!

Amazing game!!!. I can recommend it for everyone. We were four (two couples) and we had a lot of fun there. Nice interrior, great designed game and kind staff. And a tip: They are working on new game-room which looks perfect!
We're looking forward to try it by out next visit in prague.

Great Fun - Loved it!. Had a great time at the MindMaze - A nice change from the usual sights, and was really fun! There were two of us, and we were locked in a room, and had an hour to solve the riddles and puzzles, and find a way out. The atmosphere was great, and got us totally immersed in the situation - would recommend to anyone!

Brainstorming. This is the perfect way to have an hour of fun with family or friends.You have to work together as a group in order to solve the riddle and find your way out of the locked room.Our group (4 friends around the age of 50) loved the game and highly recommend it to everyone.
Just in time. This was our first exit game and we enjoyed it a lot. We finished just in time. It was really a nice thing to do.

super fun. This is a must do if visiting prauge. My husband and I went and had an amazing time, I was giggling and talking about it the whole ride home. I can't wait to come back next year and try the new room.

One of the most enjoyable hours in Praque. We were 2 couples about 50 years old. We had a great time solving this quest. We had a little help when we got stuck, so there was no frustration. Highly recommended.

Sooo really interesting!!!! :). Hey guys! Really nice thing, I'd suggest it to anyone. Were feeling ourselves as in computer game or in a book, very interesting feeling :) Just go and try it by yourselves, you will need only 1 hour :) Now it's a time for small secret: we didn't find the exit :((((( :)))))) But we spent the time soooo coooool! ^_^
Awesome game.. It's like going back to your childhood and playing adveture game on your own. We were so close to beat the record! :-( :-D

A nice "exit game" - been to better and more interesting, though. This could be a very fun and exciting experience for first-timers in such an exit game, however, having been to two games already (in Berlin) we can say that this one is by far easier and not as original. Don't get me wrong, it's well-made and fun to play, but if you're looking for a truly hard challenge - you should probably look elsewhere. For first-timers though, this would be perfect. 4/5, enjoy!

Great fun!!!. My husband and I visited Mind Maze last week (2nd Sept 2014) and had an AMAZING time. We had so much fun and was not expecting too much, especially when you walk up to a very unassuming red door with nothing but a small Mind Maze plaque next to a number of door buzzers! We were greeted by Thomas who explained how things would work. We would have 60 minutes to exit the Alchemist chamber and were given a walkie talkie to communicate with Thomas for help. He was very good at helping us out when he could see we were getting stuck and ensured that he didn't take away from the game. Would highly recommend it on your list of things to do when visiting Prague. p.s we finished the maze :)

So much fun!!. I came here for a city break with my girlfriend and saw mind maze at number 1 on trip advisor so were keen to have a go. It was excellent! There was 2 of us and we managed to complete it in 55 minutes which we were told was a good time for 2 people. There were maybe a couple parts that would have been easier if we had more people but very satisfying when solving the puzzles. The room was very well thought out and the guide was watching you while you complete it. If you were stuck you could ask for clues and the clues given were great only pointing you in the right direction. This is a must do for groups visiting Prague and there is a new room being designed which we are keen to come see if we get the chance.

Awsome. The mindmaze rated number 1 attraction for good reason.I will start from the cons at my experience:1. The price is a little bit expensive-2400 czk2.the place located a bit far from main sites and it is not easy to find.The pros:1.The room the backround music and atmosphere durning the activity makes you feel very connected to the game/quest. Everything is done with lot of thought .2.The assignments are vary interesting enjoyable. The overall feeling is exciting and funny.If you like puzzles and you are competitve get ready to enjoy

Very fun. We came as a group of 9 so booked both rooms and made a game of it 5v4 which made it even more fun and exciting, I didn't think this would be something I would of enjoy. but once stepped into the building the friendly staff made us feel welcome + in the room finding clues and keys gives yours mind a decent workout, would defiantly say give this a go, they even showed us a new room they are working on which looks awesome!so people going in the future are in for a good time

Fun and challenging. I first went to Mindmaze with my family in the summer. It was great, something different and fun for all ages. We had ages 14 to 45 on that occasion. We had to work as a team to complete the puzzles and challenges within an hour to escape the room. We managed to complete 'The Alchemy room in 37 minutes. It was frustrating at times, but the sense of achievement you got when each challenge was completed made up for it.I was lucky enough to visit their new room 'Enigma' yesterday with my team. The staff were amazingly friendly and offered me the chance to visit 'Enigma' 2 weeks before it opens to the public as it was my birthday. This room was challenging and has us stumped a few times, but we managed to complete it and escape just in time.Would definitely recommend Mindmaze for something fun and different for all ages from 12 up!

Great Fun and Challenging. We were two couples traveling with our 5 college-age sons and we all felt this was one of the highlights of our two weeks in Europe. We loved the way you needed to think in different ways and interact with the environment. It was much more challenging than expected and was fun when the team discovered a solution - both the "ah-ha" and the "oh duh" when it became obvious. We would all recommend this experience.
A challenge. This was a great hour spent in Prague, it was so much fun! We had to have a lot of help but I would love to do another one and hopefully be better at it.
So much fun!. Seriously fun, challenging with a cool back story and something different! Super friendly guy working there too :) Would definitely recommend!!!
An unique experience!!!!. An interactive experience, full of fun and enjoyable for the entire group. Definetly for us it was the no. 1 attraction in Prague. Don't miss it if you visit Prague!!!!
nice idea. It is a trend to go there, i was not so excited. Stuff was very nice. Place and reservations worked well. Just did not understad what people see on this kind of exit game adventure.

Super Fun. My wife and I decided to take the MindMaze challenge during a short three-day trip to Prague. This was a super-fun activity and is ideal for couples, families and groups of adults. I'm returning to Prague (on a stag do) in February 2015 and I'm going to recommend they do this activity. Good value for money - enjoy!

Great game for anyone teenager & up. Well worth the entry price, which was great value for money start with! Looks like a lot of effort has been put into this, as a player of these types of games as apps, it was right up my street. As a team of 2, we just about managed to piece it all together in time thanks to just a couple of clues from our guide outside when he saw we were going off-course. Will definitely be visiting again on my next visit to Prague as they mentioned adding a new room soon.
Excellent. Must do!. An absolutely brilliant attraction. Highly recommend you doing this. Staff very friendly and we've got shown the work in progress of the new room, which looks amazing too.

Amazing mind playing game. This is something you definately should do in Prague. You pay 1200 CKZ and the game is for one hour.Me and my boyfriend did not know anything about the game, and how it worked before we came. That was a part of the excitement. This is a really logical thinking game, and you have to be good at cooperating. We used 40 minutes without any hints, and enjoyed the game very much.

MindMaze was a highlight of our European vacation. My family recently completed a three week vacation to Europe. Our first stop was Prague and we found out about MindMaze. This was by far one of the highlights of our trip. Not only did the four members of my family work together but there absolutely no conflicts or arguing. The concept of the game is extremely original and we were all very excited as the game progressed. We spent more time talking about how much we enjoyed MindMaze than we did talking about Disneyland Paris. A must do for any family going to Prague.

Great fun for all ages. This was the kids favourite thing of our holiday. They loved solving the puzzles, searching for clues. The staff are very friendly and will help with hints when needed. A new puzzle room will be open shortly and we will definitely visit next time we are in Prague. Wholeheartedly recommended !
mirror mirror. A good location for a small and fun stop to get out of the hustle and bustle of Prague, cheap fun and lots of laughs,my wife and I enjoyed this very much

Great Fun!. The highlight of a great trip. Great staff and brilliantly clear and easy instructions to get started.Make sure you book up before you go. We could only get a booking for 9pm and we allowed another couple who didn't have a reservation to join us. The late booking meant it was pretty dark when we arrived. The front door just has a small plaque on a non-desript building and that made it quite difficult to find without worrying what we'd signed up for.We would love to see this kind of experience replicated elsewhere.

Video game meets real world. Our guide George did an exceptional job making us feel welcome at MindMaze after our soggy morning arrival (you'll walk less than ten minutes from the train station). Be prepared to experiment, play, and stretch your mind in a truly interactive and engaging environment. My friend and I (a small team of two) had reservations about our ability to "escape" the room in our allotted time. Not only did we do it (with 30 seconds to spare!), but we received the perfect amount of guidance from George, who was watching us remotely. With his help, we were able to overcome a couple of head-scratching moments, but never felt that he took the fun of discovery out of the experience. We also have it on good authority that a second room is in the works, with a WWII theme. Truly a great experience, overall!

Fun and exciting way to spend an hour.. Had been told before hand it was a great way to spend an afternoon and it didn't disappoint. Bit tricky to find on foot but once there, really exciting. We didn't make it out in time but definitely money well spent. Fab.

Absorbing and satisfying, great fun. We followed the map on Google to the address. It's very unassuming, a plain doorway with just a very small square plaque to let you know you've arrived. Once inside (I think her name was Kristina) was very pleasant and fluent in english. She was friendly and helpful and gave us a few hints via a walkie-talkie so we just managed to finish, a couple of minutes over the hour I think. It's a cross between Crystal Maze and a brain-game app you can download. You have an hour. Kristina showed us their new room alongside which looks great too. Based in WW2 with an escape from a prison cell as the theme. Worth the 43 euros we paid and you have to pre-book but I would say a little lacking in publicity and signage to make passers-by curious. It's just a few minutes from IP Pavlova (Metro and Tram) but it's easy to get disorientated after you get off the metro and try to follow a map because the metro has a number of exits.The roads nearby are the busiest in Prague so only cross on the crossings.

Excellent family fun. Had a great time in Prague and this was one of our family favourite experiences. We visited as a family of four with two teenage children. The challenge kept us all engaged and involved. Definitely worth a visit and good value for money.

Great fun. We did this as a family (kids aged 12 and 15) and all really enjoyed it. We all had to work together and all of us were able to contribute different things to crack the code. In our opinion it was a great way to spend an hour laughing and doing something different - and really not that expensive when you compare it to going to the cinema in the UK!
amazing. almost got to the end! it was an amazing experience, the staff was very friendly.one of the best attractions in prague, it's a must!!

A lot of fun, but really expensive!. We went there without really knowing what we would do. But that was definitely worth it! We escaped in 38 minutes, that was really close to the record... and we had never done something like this before! It's in the underground of a big flat, so do not stress if you don't find the door immediately, there is only a small sign. The only default is maybe the price! Go there with four people so you can divide it...

I felt the excitement of playing like a child again!. We were a group of 4 trying the new prototype room with a IIWW atmosphere. We could complete the challenge and I had one of the funnest hours that I've had in a long time. Not only the game was brilliantly designed (a lot of skills that have been rusty for a while will be playing an important role), but also the props were selected carefully and gave you exactly the feel the designers wanted to give you. The staff was superfriendly and were very interested in our feedback. They listened with attention to our evaluations and were happy to hear our ideas. I wish the guys the best, because I think every single person who likes 'playing' can have an amazing time enjoying in one of Mindmaze's rooms. I am a foreigner living in Prague and I would definitely recommend this experience to any friends visiting.
Very beautiful. Old city perfect Prag one number.. Peoples and metro system super. Of course beers and istanbul kebabı.

If you have an hour to spare you have to do MindMaze.. My mum thought I was mad when I told her we were being 'locked in a room solving puzzles to get out' after we'd booked a few days in Prague as a family. Although a little difficult to locate (small sign on door!) MindMaze is great fun, and definitely worth an hour of your day. The room is inventive and really gets you thinking, and we were all laughing and working together pretty soon after the time started. Unfortunately we cracked the code just as our time was up so didn't quite complete the room! I would highly recommend MindMaze to groups looking for team-building or just something a bit different in Prague with an hour to spare. For such a simple idea and set up, it is great value and hugely entertaining.

Something different good value for money. Great time here, 53 minutes and we got out ..... PhewHighly recommend, really well organised, good value, good funEngages ones brain .....Bit hard to find small sign but we rang and got directions, Kate was really helpful and met us outside

Highly recommended. Highly recommended if you are up for a challenge and an hour of fun. The time just flew. Definitely one of the highlights during our four days in Prague. Easy to book online, easy to locate the house/apartment, sweet and helpfull staff. This game has become very popular, so remember to book online in advance. We are sure you too will enjoy it.

Great activity in free time. We had a couple of days in Prague, which we could spend to our choice, after visiting main sites, and we decided to try MindMaze after reading all this great reviews here.Shortly, we were not disappointed. The game and setting were engaging and fun. We were 3 people and I think it is perfect number to be most efficient.We solved the puzzle, although not without the hints from the guide. If you have a free hour among all the sightseeing, this is definitely the way to spend it.

Great Challenge. Booked Mind Maze for something different to try while in Prague whilst with friends, and this was a great activity to get the brain cells working after a few drinks the night before! We managed to crack the puzzle with 15 seconds to spare. We would definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Prague city who loves to solve puzzles and work as a team.

Fantastic activity for a family with kids. We just finished the Mind Maze with our 5.5 and 7.5 year old girls. They both had a great time. They found many of the clues, and loved it overall. No language skills needed. The cute couple who built this place did a great job.

Excellent challenge. This was a great activity ( even though we didn't succeed!). We were a mixed age family group and all enjoyed it. It is well thought out and provided a change from all the sightseeing we had done. Easy to book your time slot on the website. Very pleasant staff too! An enjoyable hour spent!
Great experience. We are two couples visiting Prague. We visited Mindmaze and spent there an extremely enjoyable one hour. Very much recommended for everyone who loves puzzles and team challange!

Enjoyable experience!!. We are two 60 year old grandparents on a trip with our 19 year old granddaughter who loves puzzles and challenges. A little challenging to get to their location, but well worth it. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful. We had a nice time and our granddaughter thought it was amazing- wishing they had more in the United States!!

An hour very well spent. We chose this site to its high placing on TripAdvisor, the booking was simple and the pace was unhurried. While it's a bit of a hassle to get there (not exactly walking distance from the usual city centre attractions especially with younger children), the experience was an unusual and very enjoyable one. At the same time it was a 'team building' experience and when we got stuck the support was discreet and helpful without being intrusive or patronising. The concept and experience were great and we all had lots of fun. Truly an unusual and enjoyable experience!!!

Nice & wonderful experience. Great job guys!!!Me, my wife and my son all together got out in time but with a small help from the admin.Absolutely to be tested if you have one hour of free time in Prague (in my personal opinion, to be tried anyway!!).On going the preparation of one additional tematich room; guys, I dare anyone Who would like to get out in time from this room.

MindMaze is awesome, said my 10 year old son.. We parents have to agree. It was an interesting team building exercise, I strongly recommend it. We had a slight problem with the audio coming into the room but that did not stop the fun. We would come again to the new rooms, still undergoing construction, if we come back to Prague. Our host, Cate, was very welcoming and timely with her interventions. In summary, don't miss it.
Awesome. Wonderful and challenging. Great family experience. Definitely recommended if you like solving puzzles and mysteries.

excellent experience with young kids - to be recommended. first experience of exit room for us - this has been a great moment! Our kids (7,5 and 5) just loved it as well, looking after any objects they could see and trying to solve puzzle, find keys and interact with our new findings. If kids are interested in puzzles and enigmas, they will be involved from first minute.Staff is great, they gave us 2 hints durign the hour in orde to let us evolve when they understood we were stuck (in fact, busy on wrong directions..). we managed to exit the room in less than 1 hour - safely :-)be sure to check availability prior to your trip, do not miss this amazing game!

Great fun!. We found out MindMaze here on Tripadvisor, where it's the 1° thing to do in Prague.When we got there a super-friendly guy explained us the rules, joked and offered us water (a minor detail that we really appreciated, REALLY HOT AUGUST).Then, the room. We'll not spoil anything, but the focus on alchemy is really nice, since we're in Prague and stuff.Fun, enjoyable experience (safe too, thanks to the walkie talkie and the emergency button to exit the room).We had lots of fun!

Family fun. Visited 13/08/2014, family of four, children 14 & 16. Never experienced this sort of attraction before. Warm welcome on arrival. Thoroughly enjoyable hour spent trying to solve the clues.Would definitely recommend this attraction to others.

MindMaze. A colleague recommended this. This was a great activity. It takes about an hour. You are led into a room. There are hidden clues to unlick a mystery. Nothing dangerous, just very clever. I wish there were more like this in the US. I highly recommend this.

Unique experience!. A friend recommended us to do an exit game, because he was so enthusiastic about one in Budapest. Right away we checked if there was one in Prague. And there was, so we booked immediately and our expectations were high!But this game made sure all our expectations came true. As a couple you have to work together to solve the puzzles and find the right clues. It was absolutely fun and we were a bit disappointed we couldn't do a second one right away. However, we promised each other to visit the one in Amsterdam as well! If you are visiting Prague and you want something different in between all the sightseeing; the exit-game is a perfect option and so much fun to do. As a couple we would really recommend this!

A must if you come in Prague. My siblings and I were planning our trip in Prague and we decided to give it a try because we read great reviews about this game. We weren't disappointed, the game it's really amazing!! It's well thought out and very exciting!! If you come to Prague it's a must to try!! :)
fun game - recommended. played Mindmaze with a friend - its the 5th escape game i've played and the best so far. very challenging and clever, interesting puzzles and great fun all around

The perfect team building activity. The funniest hour I've spent in Prague! Did this with a couple of friends back in July and it was totally worth every Czech crown. It's just perfect for team building because you need to cooperate with all your team members to retrieve the Philosopher's Stone within one hour. There's a possibility to receive hints from the kind supervisor(s).I would recommend this Mindmaze to everybody!
Puzzle attraction. Spend an hour with grown ups or with older children (+17 yrs) in a totally unique environment with puzzles, traps and finally the solution.

Been there, done that!. Three of us- two young adults and one teenager visited Mind Maze, and we had GREAT fun!You can check, how quickly are you able to think, and how good can you cooperate in team. If you have time during visit Prague- you must visit MM, for sure!

Googled MindMaze - was not disappointed.. If you know whats good for you you'll go and give mindmaze a shot.
Its fun, its interesting, its working with your mind in a magical environment and, most of all, its a unique, once-in-a-lifetime experience.

Best thing we did in Prague.. We did the whole sightseeing thing, we did the resturants, we did the nightlife, but honestly, nothing compared to this. This was the best £35 I think I have ever spent on a city break and I can't understand how all the reviews for this aren't excellent. We went as a pair which was great but can imagine it would be a lot easier as 3/4 people. The person on the walkie talkie was very helpful as we did get stuck at a couple of points. I enjoyed it so much I was booked to do the one in London, and I just hope it lives up to this!
Not bad. The problem set is inclined more to math, pattern solving and color recognition. While the action part is weak and the atmosphere and environment both poor.

superb fun. Four of us visited. A little planning and research made finding the place quite easy, get of the metro at I P Pavlova and a couple of blocks down is the property housing mindmaze at no 9 Tyrsova, no big sign to announce you have found the correct place.The following hour is great fun. Very simple concept yet so challenging when up against the clock, the hour seems to fly by, we actually exited with 30 seconds to go. My 2 teenage sons who have played locked room games electronically said it was a different experience to face the challenge for real. A great team building exercise. Would highly recommend.

Fun for adults and teens - and humbling!. With all the buzz here on TripAdvisor, we had to check this out. Our son is 9 and loves math, codes, and puzzles. We thought this would be a fun diversion from the history tours and operas. Our family are not 'gamers,' but we like a good mental challenge. Honestly, I thought we would solve this. But we did TERRIBLY! I think if you play escape challenges on the computer, you will do well with this, because you'll know the kinds of things to look for. But the woman who was our guide said that only about 40% of people solve the puzzle within the hour. That said, we had a TON of fun! If it were easy, it wouldn't be as good. And it was fun to meet the young Czech entrepreneurs running this small but booming business. Our guide was charming and showed us the solution when we were done, which we enjoyed. If you're wondering how to engage your teen during a family trip to Prague, definitely consider the Mindmaze. Great family bonding time!

Great for families with older children.. We really enjoyed this game and completed it as a family of four. It was a welcome break from the usual tourist things to do and our son particularly found it engaging. You definitely need to book ahead. Great fun.

Put your mind at work. I went to this attraction with three friends, two of them did not know the concept at all (they had never played any escape room on the internet). At first it was a little bit weird, the street where this is located was in heavy work and the doorphone just had a little sticker that said "Mindmaze", it was intimidating. But when we entered the location, the staff was extremely nice and helpful and put us at ease. And it was sooo fun!!!!! We were thrilled, we really enjoyed each second of it. Each one of us found a clue, so we felt we were a very functional team and we were so proud when we managed to escape the room in 45 minutes! A great experience all the way.

Great from start to finish.. Absolutely loved this, from concept, through to execution, through to the staff and owner who made us feel extremely welcome. It's absolutely all that it's said to be in the rave reviews on here, and more. We went as a couple, and unfortunately didn't make it out in time - spent far too long on a couple of incidental steps and got fooled by one red herring in particular. Some things aren't quite what they seem (but that's the beauty of the game). A great mix of logic puzzles, some physical (not too physical) lateral thinking, and a bit of codebreaking. As others have said, the time absolutely flies by, and there's aspects of the puzzles that will appeal to all ages.A nice touch was the unhurried guiding through the parts we didn't get to complete (with encouragement to solve them ourselves as much as possible) so that we didn't leave frustrated - well, apart from the fact that I'm still really annoyed with myself for taking one particular thing at face value, which lost us a good 15 minutes or so.So much care and attention to detail has gone into the rooms themselves and the puzzles. We are really looking forward to trying the next room (currently in the final stages of being built) when we next come to Prague. Ideally, we'd want to do it right now.

So much fun :). A little bit hard to find, but it is worth it. At first it felt a bit awkward, but when you get involved more into the game it becomes very exciting and a lot of fun :) A big thank you to the helpful and friendly staff.

Fantastic experience :). This is the 4th escape game that we have tried and was definitely one of the most engaging. Really enjoyed the set up of the room and the puzzles that you had to solve. They were quite logical and kept you interested in the "game". We did this as a couple so would have been better value if we had a bigger group. Would definitely recommend!

Great concept. There was a group of 4 of us that went in August and it was great fun. The difficulty level i feel was just right as i think if it was any harder, people would potentially give up and any easier, it wouldn't be worth it. We did it in 53mins, but we were still talking about it the next day! Definitely worth a visit. Thanks to our guide (I'm sorry, i forgot your name) who was so polite and helpful and even offered to help us with our onward journey.

A MUST DO challenge with family or friends. Based on the IOS/Android game "The Room", this game is worth every penny. Together with your small group you are locked up in a room for an hour. (No worries, you can leave at any minute) By solving puzzles you have to try to find the key to unlock the main door. When you can't find a clue there is a friendly staffmember who guides you in the right direction. We completed the maze in 52 minutes (due to lack of concentration at the end).
A must on Prague trip!. A nice break from ususal sight seeing and do some cool activity. We thoroughly enjoyed it. Excellent staff. Reservatio is must in advance.

First trial. It was a good refreshment from the regular historical visits in any city. We could not finish the puzzle in time but it was for sure engaging and mind consuming. Not sure of the high participation charges though (better with a 4-5 member group), mind maze does keep you thinking !

Tough puzzle!. I joined my family for this one. I'll admit this is usually not my cup of tea, I get frustrated by puzzles. You have an hour to escape a room by figuring out clues to find keys for a progressive set of locks. Staff was nice. Good entertainment value for the money. Nice break from the usual sightseeing and beer drinking.

Very Cool!. We have a teenage daughter and while visiting Prague, we were looking for something "different" to do (you can get "castle fatigue" traveling through Europe for 12 days) and Mind Maze came up as #1 in activities. After reading the reviews, we decided to book. What a great time! The concept is awesome and the thought that went into planning this room (we did the Alchemist) is spectacular. I don't want to give too much away but, you are put into a room (they have another room and will have a third room in the next few months with a different theme) that is designed to give clues to find the Alchemist's stone and use it to get out of the room. You are watched by cameras and the guide will offer clues (in English or Czech) if you're having difficulty moving forward. It's the perfect group activity (only 4 people max allowed) and it's great fun for everyone. Our daughter loved it as did we and we actually made it out just a bit over the 60 min, (with some clues!) Highly recommend.
Amazing. such a test of skill a perfect, brain game that is fun for everyone and massievely enjoyable i would love to beon the other side watching people try and do this i really would lol

Now I see why its number one!. I didn't know what to expect. and the host didn't even give us a clue where to start. But once you get in the room you just have to do your thing, 60 min. goes by so fast on this. your mind is just going crazy with thought and emotion. Me and Mitch were so close to solving the puzzle to get out of the room but I think we jumped a couple steps and that hurt our chances. We just go lucky. but never the less didn't make it out in time. very fun and highly recommended, book well in advance at least 3 or 4 days or you will not get a slot.

Incredible. Went in a group of three and managed it in just over half an hour. An incredible bit of fun throughout and we were absolutely buzzing when we finished. By far the highlight of our visit and definitely would recommend to everyone visiting Prague.

Really fun and original. We went to MindMaze not really knowing what to expect, and we were actually amazed at how detailed and well thought this place is. You'll come out either proud or a little ashamed of how long it's taken you to get out, but in the meantime you'll have had a lot of fun trying to solve the enigmas presented to you :)
Good fun. Fun to do - kept chldren amused for hours - interesting and a welcome escape from the sun and the heat of the city centre

Loved it!. Went is as a team of two and managed to work out the clues (with a couple of hints) just in time to gain our release. Really loved the experience and we were buzzing about it for hours afterwards. Well worth a visit and I'll be returning to attempt the new room which they have planned upon my next visit..

Playing Those Mind Games Together. Mind Maze is an hour long enjoyable and intellectually stimulating activity. I recommend that you play it in a group of four. It has nothing to do with Prague, and the place housing the activity is not in a fashionable part of the city. However, it served as a fun break from all the other fun but more "touristy" things we did on our trip, and it gave us insight as how we friends and couples collaborate when given a mission to complete.

Really fun thing to do!. This was my first exit game I have played and I enjoyed every minute of it. It is a really fun thing to do. If you have some time left in Prague you should definitely do this game! But the price is a bit high for just 2 people, but worth it anyway.

Great Fun. Never done anything like this before but what fun we had and will return when the new themed room is open. We didn't solve the clues within the hour but had great fun and a lot of laughs. We wish Mindmaze continued success, they deserve it. If visiting Prague give it a try, you won't be disappointed.

AMAZING. All I can say, is just do it, we nearly completed the room-were literally about 1 minute off or so. There were 2 of us so I was fairly happy with our effort! A completely different but thoroughly enjoyable experience...with a lovely staff base :).

Simply fantastic. This is a must experience when visiting Prague. The full hour (or less) of fantastic puzzle solving with great memories guaranteed. The setup was Excellent and the clues and hits quite challenging. As stated in the other reviews, solving this mystery requires teamwork. For our family, there were clues to solve for all of us, despite the age. We simply loved this experience.Aftrer this MindMaze, we will be looking forwards for similar mysteries in the future, for sure. I'd say MindMaze was definitely one of them best memories from our visit to Prague.

Amazing experience. This was different and fun!We booked this before our trip to Prague (thanks TripAdvisor). We had'nt tried games like this. It was supercool!Host was nice guy and it was easy to talk with him. He also was helpful and good host. We got out of the room with my girlfriend. Amazing experience!Little bit far from the centre and could be maybe easier to find. Thats why 4 stars.

Loved it!. We visited the mindmaze during our short vacation to Pragua and absolutely loved it! The staff was really friendly and supportive.The puzzles were well designed since they were not obvious and required some thought but everyone solved something and it required teamwork to complete the room.Definitely worth the visit!

Get Lost in the Mystery and Find your way Out. Our very first experience with Escape Rooms, and not to be our last. This was a ton of fun for two adults, two teens to solve the puzzles and find the keys required to Escape the room before the sand ran out on the hourglass. If you enjoy investigation take the hour and accept the challenge. But reserve in advance!

A GREAT TEAM ADVENTURE. In short, this was a blast! We really enjoyed the challenge and the creativity used to create this adventure.
