We worked together well as a team but we made one big mistake, and turned out to not share an important clue right near the beginning of our challenge. So instead of setting the record we came in just under the wire; nonetheless it was a lot of fun.The puzzles and the clues are great but don't fall in to our trap and over-think some of the solutions. We were shown the new 'room' under construction and if we are fortunate enough to be in Prague again, we will definitely give it a go.Highly recommended for something different than clocks, crystal or churches!As an aside, the category below is lacking. We were are team of 3, joined by our adult son.

Great attraction!. Amazing place, interesting game, nice and mysterious interior, we enjoyed every minute! We have solved all the puzzles (with some help ;) I will recommend this attraction to my friends.

Fun!. Great game, 4 of us went which made it good value for money as you pay the same for 2-4 people, if you like logic puzzles this is a great unusual activity to do. We were only able to get a slot at 9pm at night, so if you want more of a choice of the time to go at I would book ahead of time! The host of the game was very friendly and all of us enjoyed the game :) costs 1200 czk, they are bringing out a different puzzle room sometime soon and if I am back in prague I will definitely be giving that a try!

A MUST DO with family or friends. Amazing MindMaze! Based on the iOS/Android game 'The Room', a puzzle game but this time in real life. With a team of 4 people you have 60min to solve the puzzles and get out of the room; an amazing experience, especially with family or friends. It is a welcome distraction after you have visited the well-known and popular places in Prague. If you enjoy a challenge, fun and team-building add this to your trip, you won’t regret this. We managed to get out of the room in 52min, worth every penny. Thanks to the MindMaze staff for an excellent challenge.

Amazing Game. I order the site before I arrived to Prague.I went with my girlfriend, and I like that kind of mind game, puzzles, secrets and adventure, and my girlfriend doesn't love things like that.but when we enter the room first we was very excited, and we enjoy very much, even my girlfriend enjoy in this game, she helped me alot (even success more than me) and it's doesn't necessery good english or strengh, just thinking outside the box, be careful to the clues, and look for keys.

Great fun for friends and family. There is nothing to complain about except maybe the location being a little difficult to find - the sign isn't too flashy so we spent a couple minutes looking for the entrance. Still, it is a Mind Maze, it shouldn't be easy to find in the first place! Once we got inside, everything was great, the maze host was extremely friendly and helpful and the quest itself was delightful. Will definitely check out any new rooms they set up.

If you love problem solving, you'll love this.. We visited based on the awesome reviews here on Tripadvisor and were not disappointed! We'd never done one of these games before but it was exactly what we'd hoped - a clever and charming way to spend an hour, escaping into another world as well as attempting to escape the room!A little on the pricey side when doing as a pair as it's a flat price whether you're a group of two or four, but such a unique and well-crafted activity we thought it was worth it. Really friendly and helpful service too. You are even offered a photo of the team at the end as a free memento to be emailed to you.Would whole-heartedly recommend to anyone who enjoys problem solving. We will definitely return to play the new room if we're ever back in Prague (the owner gave us a sneak peek into its preparation and it looks great!).
Fun for the family. We took our two boys (11 and 14) and for a whole hour they did not fight. Excellent experience for the whole family. Glad we did it BEFORE the brewery tour.

lots of fun. Visited on a rainy day. The game is interesting and well thought through. The staffs are pretty cool. Setting of the game room can be a little more stylised.In general, love the place!Worth a visit if you are considering indoor activities.

Perfect experience. It was the first escape game i had played and it was awesome. The fiction is well done and the staff is really smiling. She was giving hints just on time when it is really needed.After i played another game in prague but honestly mindmaze is far better than the other one. everybody must try!

My best memory of Prague. I have booked the MindMaze event for me and my girlfriend. Please note that you need at least two persons to solve one of the puzzles in the room.
MindMaze was so much fun and I strongly recommend to check it out when you are in Prague.

Nice room!. The room is really nice, we could be just there looking for everything... but the time flies!
The game is fantastic. As we solve a mystery, we want to solve other and other...
After the game we talked about what we had done and thought.
We are already looking for the next room!

Very fun and different experience!. My husband and I booked a MindMaze experience while visiting Prague and we really enjoyed ourselves! It was just the two of us but we liked the critical thinking and team-working. The location of the game is a bit random but totally worth the find. We would both recommend this to anyone who is vaguely interested. You won't be disappointed!

A new experience we all enjoyed. This was such a unique experience. We all enjoyed it and although we found it frustrating at times it was such a great challange enjoyed by ourselves and our two daughters aged 14 years and 16 years I would highly recommend it as a must do in Prague. It is a little difficult to find at least by us which might explain why we found the quest so hard to complete.

First exit game but not last!!. I bought this game for my friend as a birthday present as we visited Prague only few weeks after her birthday. We never done anything like this so I can't compare this to any other exit game there is. But we had fun. We got stuck few times, I was eager to ask for a glue right away but my friend wanted to find all the clues without any help. We did get some help as we got really stuck. :) we got out of the room in 50 minutes so we pretty good if I my say so :DThis really got us into this and will look for other games in other cities. And will try the new room when ever we come back to beautiful Prague!

Great fun!. We had seen some great reviews of the Mind Maze before our visit and we were not disappointed! I am so glad we did this, it really was a high point of our trip to Prague. I would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting the city.
AWESOME. Never seen anything like this before but me and my friends absolutely loved it and will be looking for more of this!!
First escape room game. My wife was skeptical but we both loved it. We can't wait to try the new room when they open it and other escape room locations.

Must do. We had done a few of these throughout Europe but I have to say that this was by far the best one. The red herrings and never ending twists and turns leave you wanting more. It is of course challenging and you have to think outside the box but it was such a great experience! I would recommend it to 10+- I am sure they could join in at this age, some of the clues do require more mature knowledge but either way a fun hour! Try it out!

Really fun game. My husband and I went with our 12-year-old son, and had a great time. Really fun thing to do, especially with older kids. It's tough to solve, but you can get hints readily. Great concept.

a-MAZE-ing. If you're in Prague for more than one day, you gotta do this. You need two to five people. Together, you need to follow clues and hints to figure out how to unlock the Philosopher's Stone that will let you out of the dungeon. What a fun time! (Hint: The walls have ears. Also, the crystal ball is key.)

Entertaining and exciting. We did the mind maze as a couple. The welcoming was very lovely and everything necessary to know was explained. Nevertheless we recommend you have some experience with exit games, or at least look into the concept. The price is fair for such a rare activity. Would certainly do it again.

A great and fun experience! Highly recommend!. I am so glad we did this! I was initially weirded out by the concept of going to a foreign country and being locked in a room lol. After deciding to do it I can say it was a great experience! The puzzles arent terrifying, the staff was great and the atmosphere was casual and fun. The time seemed to fly by. As for my brainpower, clearly my wife does the heavy lifting for us! I hope they create other rooms, because we will absolutely return to Mind Maze when we come back to Prague!

Would highly recommend. Both myself and my boyfriend previously heard amazing reviews of the place before we went to Prague and it is safe to say we were not disappointed. Not only was the game so much fun, the staff were so helpful and friendly. It was definitely one of the highlights of our trip and I would love to come back and try the new room when it is completed. I would highly recommend it to anyone who is thinking of visiting Prague, young or old. It's not too hard to get too as there is a tram only a few minutes away.

Fantastic brain game!. This was an amazing experience the staff was very friendly, helpful and their English skills were also great(which is not common in Prague). If you visit Prague we really recommend booking an hour in the MindMaze which can easily be done on their website(even on a smartphone, which we did). Exceptional experience! =)

Pleasantly surprised!. We just went today as a group of 4 and it was absolutely awesome! We were a bit skeptical and confused as to what it would be but it basically feels like you're trapped in one of those game show puzzle rooms without having to be on TV! We all added different information to the game and it was lots of fun, very unique and we highly recommend it to anyone who loves mind puzzles and team work :)

Highlight of Prague!. We had so much fun at MindMaze! My partner and I booked this activity after seeing it as the number one of things to do in Prague on Trip Advisor.A little out of the city but understandably for the space required for the game. Can't tell you much about the game without spoiling it but it's a lot of fun if you love puzzles and logic games. The people were great and helpful and we even got to meet the brains behind the operation who was lovely and welcoming. I think we were lucky to be just the two of us as I would think it would be harder under pressure with people you dont know and a larger group meaning more opinions and suggestions to go through. We had a great time and will definitely come back and do the new room if we come back.

Great Fun!. My husband, 7 year old daughter and I had a blast doing the Mind Maze on our last day in Prague. My daughter loved it and was actually a huge help. I don't think I would do it with a younger child, but at 7 she was able to engage with the challenges and made a few critical connections that we had missed. We were able to do it in just under an hour with just a few hints. There's so much to cram into that hour that it's great to be able to get some help when absolutely necessary. Practical info - there's a WC available and it's just a few minutes walking from the I P Pavlova metro stop. You need to make a reservation online - it fills up quickly.

amazingly fun!. we just did a group of 2 (25 and 28 years old). was able to escape the room with a few hints from organizers. would love to do this again in a different kind of room. was so amazing. so challenging but yet felt so good when you figured something out. would highly recommend this to anyone of any age. hard to start off as you have no idea what to look for, but you would be surprised on how your brain just starts ticking. just try it! so good!

Really great fun!. I could not really imagine when we arrived what to expect. But we got introduction and as the game went along we got more and more into it! Great fun, creative tasks, helpful hints from the staff when needed! Fully recommended!

For every age group!. For every age group!
Me and my wife are already close to 60 but this game is really for every age group! Challenging tasks, logical twists - the one hour passed by really fast! We will come back to try the new room!

Brain teaser you must visit. I went with my friends and surprisingly we found the way out. It was fantastic! Very pleasant staff.
I cant say anything else than just recommend this place.

Fun and unique experience!. I took my Dad as a belated Father's Day gift and it was fantastic! The hardest part was figuring out how to get started, but once we did then we were able to continue at a good pace. I don't normally enjoy brain teasers, but this was a different kind of puzzle--challenging but very interesting. One hour was just right--we finished in 58 minutes with only a couple of hints. Can't wait to try their new room once it is finished!!
awesome. Was so much fun. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The game was set up brilliantly. Must visit

A great escape from your everyday tourism. My only wish is that they had these in every city. I've played a bunch of those escape games online and was really curious to try a real-life one. The game is probably better suited for 3-4 people--I was there with one other friend and we were definitely struggling. (To be fair, we are both terrible at thinking outside the box--more creative people would have a much easier time!) The instructor was helpful in giving us hints that didn't give away too much, so we were able to complete the game in time while still having tons of fun. For just 1200czk it was a great value.
Great fun and good training for the brains :). I really recommend to go and see how this works. Really great fun, need some thinking and imagination, work together and find a solution!

Fun and challenging!. My husband and I really enjoyed this-- it was fun yet challenging, and we were excited to complete the puzzles with time to spare. We couldn't stop talking about the experience after we left, and wanted to immediately do another puzzle room!
Time well spent! :). Friendly staff, exciting room, difficult tasks, music that increase the adrenalin level = one hell of a time. It's good to be more than 2 people.

Great service. We arrived at the wrong time but Simi still squeezed us in. Gave helpful clues when needed.Not recommended when suffering from jet lag as you may not solve the puzzles! You do need to work together and think clearly
Best fun and good price :). We have very good ecperience with Prague mindmaze,excellent fun and interisting place . Symphaticaly surveillance, I recomended this real game for everybody :)

Unexpected Highlight of Prague!. Based on reviews online, my friends and I booked a reservation with no idea what to expect. In the end, the game was terrific and definitely one of the highlights of our trip! We were impressed by how creative and challenging the puzzles ended up being. The website suggests bringing between 2-4 people and I would agree with that, since too many people would get crowded and less efficient. The building is a bit hard to find, so I would give yourself some extra time to arrive and be sure to book well in advance since the slots fill up quickly. Overall the whole process was an incredibly fun, unique and rewarding experience - be sure to check it out!

only for the brave and smart...so just try it!:-) great start to the new day. Finally someone came up with something entirely new. Absolutely fantastic! we had a lot of fun! It´s worth it!:) I can just recommend to everyone.

Amazing attraction in the heart of Prague. We were 3 people enjoying during an hour trying to solve all the puzzles in this amazing adventure. You will have to free your mind and touch everything in the room... The clues are hidden in the most unbelievable places! We had a really nice time and the staff was really kind!

If you have time, do it. I went along not knowing what to expect especially as we got dropped off in the middle of the estate and thought we were submitting ourselves for our own version of 'Hostel' but fear not. This is an interesting and great way to spend an hour in Prague, especially if the weather is not too good. Me and 2 friends did the alchemist chamber and was brilliant with all the clue finding and problem solving.

Well worth doing!. Myself and my fiance visited MindMaze on a recent trip to Prague, although it was just the two of us taking part we managed to get to the end with our relationship intact and not to many clues!A whole lot of fun and well worth the price, just wish the new room they were working on was up and running as well, we'd have happily done a back-to-back visit!

Fantastic game! Don't leave Prague without doing it!. We were in Prague for just two nights and we went to MindMaze on one of those nights. Absolutely worth it! What a great game! We spent an hour looking for very cleverly hidden rules and had so much fun! The host is also super super nice and gave us some tips when we needed them!Don't leave Prague before checking out this game! It's great for couples or groups of friends of all ages! Have fun!

Mystery!. So, they told me not to give it away, so I won't, but this is WONDERFUL! I, from Anchorage Alaska, was looking for a place to spend on my birthday! And mindmaze was #1 out of 282 places or something. My family and I had a great time searching for clues. But there were a few problems. First of all, it's a little hard to find. the road that it's on is closed and it is in an apartment so you have to look close at the names. secondly, there was one clue, that us as a short family couldn't get to. and finally, there was one confusing clue that doesn't seem like you should get it at the moment, but you should! and (as a small family we could get it) but for some, they couldn't get it. But overall, it was WONDERFUL and the new one coming out looks even better! I highly recommend mindmaze!

Cannot recommend this enough!. Reviews on tripadvisor encouraged us to give this a try and we were NOT disappointed! Just two of us signed up (booking beforehand) and we did not have too much trouble finding the place. It's a little out of the way but definitely walkable if you don't mind that. When we got there the woman was very friendly, asking if we had found the place easily enough and whether we were excited (we were!) She set the room up for us while we waited and gave us some instructions before letting us loose. It was SO MUCH FUN. The trick is to work together! Plus tips/hints are offered if you get a bit stuck so don't be afraid to ask! My friend and I completed it in 46 mins with only a few hints and we had an absolute laugh while doing it. As somebody who has always loved puzzles, mysteries and alchemy/magic/etc this was wonderful.Once again I asolutely cannot recommend this enough. For the price it was great hour-long entertainment and unlike anything I've ever done before. Plus, the woman offered us some information on other interesting things to do. Fabulous!
Fantastic!!!. Great puzzle solving experience, alchymist chambre is very well designed and to find a solution is not easy at all. Funn, funn, funn!!! :-)
Really good fun!. Very enjoyable experience, a nice change from sight seeing! The game itself was interesting and the staff were really friendly and helpful.

A-mazing. We werevery skeptical to what we had booked ourselves to. But upon arrival we were greeted by a very friendly staffmember (who fbtw was excellent at english!) the room itself was very creative and felt like beeing inside a escape room game. Both fun and irritating at the same time. We got a small preview of the next room they are creating, and will definitely make another trip on our next prague visit. This is best thing you can do in prague!

Worth trying!. It was great to play "Escape the room" live! Actually it was one of the best impressions of Prague :) The room design creates the needed atmosphere, hospitable room creator provides you with hints if needed and at the end it's such a happy feeling to find the escape :)

Awesome Escape Game!. Staff was excellent! We didn't know what to expect going in, but the room was well staged and we were able to make it out of the room in time! We enjoyed ourselves and would recommend this to anyone who wanted a challenge. My husband and I managed it together, but we would recommend going in a group of 3+ people so there are more minds working on solving the puzzles. We left feeling accomplished!
Brilliant day out. This places is brilliant, the rooms were well designed and it was fun to solve all the puzzles. Would recommend this to anyone visiting Prague wanting a fun day out.

This place is absolutely astonishing. Just go for it!!!. Great adventure and thrill. The room is extremely well designed with a variety of contraptions and puzzles to really provoke the discoverer within you. The guys running this are also extremely friendly and polite. This is a must do attraction in Prague.

Niklas. Tried this with my girlfriend after seeing the high reviews on tripadvisor. My expectations were high and I think they were more or less fulfilled. Made it just in time after some hints from our operator. We thought it was fun to solve all the puzzles, some were easy and some required the right mindset to figure out. Our operator was very friendly, easy to talk to and explained everything nicely. This was definitely one of the funniest things we did in Prague, but then we like games and puzzles.

If you liked the DaVinci Code, you'll love this!. My mother, cousin and I took the MindMaze challenge and we loved it! I booked it simply from the great TA reviews and told them nothing except that I had a "surprise" activity in store for them while in Prague. Actually, it was a surprise for me too, as the reviews don't (and shouldn't!) go into detail. An aura of mystery added to the fun. My mom (72 yrs) can't stop talking about how much fun it was. My cousin got onboard after it was about halfway through (I think she thought we'd be having some kind of strange seance ha ha ha -- which it was not of course ha ha)
Puzzling!. Had a great time. Challenging game, and friendly staff who gave us lots of tips along the way :) Cant wait to try the new WWII room when ready. Recommended

Great Fun!. We visited MindMaze & loved it! I decided to book it after reading other reviews on Trip Advisor and we weren't disappointed. The puzzles really get you thinking & the set up of the room was great. The lovely staff explained everything to us before they locked us in the room & provided us with a clue when we were a little off-track. Although we didn't get out (we were very close!) we had a great time & would highly recommend that you pre-book. The new WWII room looks great & will come back if I'm ever in Prague again.

It was simply awesome!. We were a team of eight people and had great fun! The quests were amazing - challenging but doable. I especially liked the authentic design of the room which let you dive into the adventure.As we were eight people we had to split the group which ended up to be even more fun as they have two identical rooms so we could compete against each other.
A MUST visit!. Very friendly and competent staff! Entertaining activity! Perfect activity for groups! (4 - 8 people)
great!. very challenging, yet fair and fun. we've enjoyed every minute of it. the time was a little bit too short, but only because the game was so good.
Great fun!. Had a great time at Mind Maze. Some of the puzzles really put your brain to work. Its such a good feeling when you suddenly solve something!!

Our 2nd Escape Room. Having previously tried an escape room in Dublin, we thought we knew what to expect but this was on another level. Much more difficult than Dublin but the challenge was completely different and definitely enjoyable!We were allowed an extra 3 minutes, luckily as we needed them to complete the task! We were only a couple and I think 4 people would be ideal to work together and complete the task!Enjoyed it. Would go back to try the second room if I were in Prague again... Very professional operation..

Amazing and original. If you like riddles and puzzles, then this hour long game if perfect for you. This amazing experience, based on a very original idea, would be worth building in every city! Definitely worth the trip.
Such a fun addition to a trip to Prague!. Prague is amazing as a city, but this is such a unique and fun thing to do while you're there. The game was a blast and like nothing I've ever done before!!

Great. Had a lot of fun, managed to get out in just under 1h :) really worth a visit, will be especially appealing if you've ever tried hidden object or puzzle computer games. In this kind of setting you get to nose around for real! Our guide was very helpful. Will definitely try this sort of thing again :) a bit expensive if there are only two people like we were, nevertheless I think it was worth it

Great Fun. I read about Mindmaze on the TripAdvisor site and was so glad I did, as I really didn't see it mentioned anywhere else, even within Prague. It was so much fun, even though we didn't make it out. They are working on a second room with a WWII theme, so that will definitely be on our agenda the next time we visit Prague. This would be a perfect activity for a group of 2-4 people where one of them thinks he knows it all! Highly recommended.

A wonderful experience. If you like adventure games or just want to train/test your mind, this is the place for you.We were 2 couples and had a lot of fun trying to solve the puzzles. We recommend anyone who stops in Prague to book in advance, cause they have a very busy schedule, even with 2 rooms.I liked the fact that the room had a real look and file of an alchemist chamber.I will for sure return when the new room will open.

Brilliant fun. We booked this on a whim and was one of the highlights of our visit. We were a group of 5 so it was very reasonable and the staff were very enthusiastic and fun. Would definitely look for something like this in other cities!

Family friendly and a highlight for all!. We had little idea what to expect, which made this all the more delightful for our family. Our almost 3-year-old boy played with the props while our 9 and 11-year old girls helped us escape. Everyone was fully engaged and contributed to our success. It was the perfect break from the historical sightseeing and perfect for the rainy afternoon. The girls wanted to go for another hour straight away. We're looking forward to our next visit!
Brilliant exit game. Even though we didn't finish, it was a brilliant way to spend an hour. Can't wait for the new room to open in July!

Challenging but fun. I had read a lot of people didn't finish in time so I was determined to. My friends and I managed to finish and it was great! I really enjoyed the visit. The alchemist theme was co but she showed us the WWII theme they will be opening soon... If I was going to be in Prague in June I would totally go again. Worth the money, great, unusual, fun experience.

Amazing and unique experience. We had heard talk of the mind maze in our hostel, but no one seemed to be able to tell us any details. We had no idea what to expect but we decided to check it out for ourselves and we're so glad we did! The staff was so friendly and helpful, and the experience itself is one of a kind. Highly recommended!!!

Great Attraction. We did this after reading the reviews on here. The building was a little hard to find but treat that as a warm up for the game. The host was great, very helpful. We didn't complete it in time but had a good time and after never doing anything like this before were very happy we did.

The highlight of our trip to Prague!!!. My husband and I unsuccessfully tried to complete the mind maze, not finishing didn't matter in the slightest because we had such a great time.A must for all, both young and old.

mind maze fun!. Mind maze is definitely worth a visit, but perhaps not after a heavy night, as there's a bit of thinking to be done! ;) Great group activity, original concept and basically a lot of fun. Recommend it.

Highly recommend!!. Wasn't sure what to expect but this was fantastic. It's says groups of up to 4 but there were 5 of us in our trip and it was still ok to go in together. I won't spoil it with the details so just go and find out for yourself!!

Great fun!!. The mind maze was absolutely brilliant and so much fun!! Getting to search around the room for clues and having to solve problems against the clock was a real buzz! It was like being a kid again!! Would highly recommend this. We got a sneaky peek at a new room opening in June and it looked amazing! I would definitely go back!

Excellent fun!. I went here with 4 of my friends. We had a great time trying to solve the puzzles and win the game, and even though we were unsuccessful we all really enjoyed the game. It was great fun, and we laughed a lot at some of the things we tried. The staff were really nice and I would recommend a visit here.

Different kind of activity.. We weren't sure what to expect beforehand. I went with my wife and her parents. My in-laws weren't too excited to go, but since I wanted to go they were happy. We all had a lot of fun and left with smiles on our faces! Highly recommended!

Great fun and value, well worth it. Had a fantastic time with a group of friends. Have never tried this type of attraction before, and it was an excellent experience. The puzzles were not too difficult, but still challenging. Lots of things to touch, interact with in the rooms. Hardest part for us was what to do at first, but after that it was one challenge solved after another. Highly recommended!

How can we get out of there?. A mysterious atmosphere for this mind-bending game... we thought we were good at riddles but time flies when you're there and you can feel being really disrupted by all objects, symbols and messages...Just try it :)

Challenging but not too difficult . This room was a lot of fun. I've done both harder an easier rooms. This one was challenging in that there were a lot of plausible distractions, but in the end we could find the right clues and escape the room.I always love doing activities in cities rather than just walking around seeing sights, this is definitely a great option.
Excellent experience. Amazing game! We had so much fun, our instructor Simmy was a great help, wouldn't make witout her :)

This was an excellent escape the room game!. This was an excellent escape the room game! The rooms were themed and dressed really well, the puzzles were at the perfect difficulty level, and the clues were subtle enough to help us along without giving it away. We barely escaped in time so that made the entire experience that much better. We have attended other escape the room games in other cities that were just stationary logic puzzles at a table, with no real room to explore/escape and no decorations or theming. MindMaze was totally different, you touch and manipulate your environment to figure out how to escape. There were logic puzzles which used appropriately themed, tangible objects to create a very well rounded experience that felt highly immersive. I play a lot of “escape the room” video games and this really felt like I was inside one of my video games! The alchemy theme was perfect too, we could not be happier with our adventure and we thank you so much for creating this. Now come make one in San Francisco!

Awesome. What an incredible experience! It was very easy to find the place, just a couple of blocks south of IP Pavlov. The host was very nice and explained everything very well. Now the game... The decoration was fantastic, and the challenges were very smart and very well thought. We made it out in 52 minutes and we were absolutly thrilled! Its absolutly a 'must do' experience in Prague. And remember, if the object doesn't move don't force it cause probably it is not suposed to.

Loved it!. Absolutely loved it! The puzzles were awesome and challanging. It was our first time in an exit room so we were not sure what to expect. Our instructor told us the engaging story of an alchymist who's chamber we had to escape and explained us how the game works. Solving puzzles, finding keys and with a little help from 'outside' we managed to get out in about 45mins. It was so much fun, just can't wait for a new room to open. We'd definitely be back for a new escape :)

must go!. We received a recommendation to go there and were very pleased we decided to visit. really enjoyable, charming place, employees was kind and gave us lots of tips on other things that can be done in Prague. We were worried at first that it would not be challenging enough, but it was great.
good hour to test your skills. the first part was very interesting finding the clues, but then we get frustrated because we couldn`t see the remaining the clues, even with help. But great fun

So much fun!. My husband and I are spending a few days in Prague. And after noticing this was ranked so highly on Trip Advisor, I decided to make a reservation even though I had never done anything like this before. Well, it is ranked highly for a reason! My husband and I couldn't believe how much fun we had! Engaging puzzles and an activity that doesn't take too much time, just an hour. Although we barely made it out of thw room in time and that was with hints! I highly recommend anyone visiting Prague to visit Mind Maze!

Brilliant!. Myself and husband managed to escape in 58 mins with a bit of help here and there. We did the Trap game 2 days before but enjoyed this one more as puzzles more varied, so we found Mindmaze much more fun - and a bit easier as well. Having said that - we did have a better idea of what were we doing as we had done the other one before. Spooky music added to atmosphere. I think a small group is better so the group does not get confused as to who has done what. A must-do for an hour as part of a Prague trip.

Outstanding. The game was just outstanding. Me and my friends booked the game this week and it was just amazing. The guy who was there gave us instructions and locked us in alchymist chamber. He gave us transmitter to communicate with him if something was wrong. Although some riddles weren´t so easy to solve we deciphered them just in time :-) It was such fun. I recommend it to all who love puzzles. Team cooperation will help you solve the mystery. Book it now!
Fantastic fun.. Mindmaze was excellent. Love it. It's a must in Prague. Well worth it. Very friendly. Didn't get out in time but we were so close.

Brilliant!. Hadn't heard of this concept before, but decided to have a go! Thought we had wandered into the wrong street at first, but managed to locate a 'MindMaze' placard alongside a buzzer. As previously mentioned, the entrance is a touch unusual, but once inside, we were met by a lovely female guide who gave us a brief before putting us inside the room. Didn't know where to start, but eventually got into the swing of it. Managed to escape the room, and had an absolute blast! There was only two of us, so don't think you need a full group. Would love to try another game of a similar nature.

Excellent fun!. Me & my friend arrived on a Sunday night, just before hitting the bars!We got there not knowing what to expect, the puzzles in the room were at just the right level, help was always there if needed.Just when we thought we had failed the challenge, the last two clues were solved within a minute and the escape door opened on 57 mins!I would definitely do something similar to this again!Would recommend this to any groups, we went as a two, and managed it. It doesn't need to be large groups! But a larger group may mean you escape early as there's more of you to check the room for clues.Shaz

Very good and exciting experience !!. We were a group of four and we really enjoyed this part of our trip. It was challenging and very well designed. The price is pretty cheap for such a great experience and we were greeted with a warm welcome and hospitality. It is time to wake up the sleeping cells of your brain ;-)Highly recommended.

Excellent and challenging. As we were fairly experienced adventure gamers I thought we'd get through this with relative ease, but actually we only escaped by the skin of our teeth, which was a lot more satisfying. The puzzles were excellent, very well-constructed and with a good amount of variation. The time-constraint makes the whole thing fairly intense. Well worth the money and walk. The owner was lovely as well.
Had fun, really great game. A really fun one-hour game, I recommend it to everyone :)Book your ticket online, or you might not be able to play.

Absolutely brilliant!. Although we didn't manage to escape this was one of the funnest and most exhilerating experiences of my life! It was so much fun from beginning to end. It was a bit expensive (around £30+) but it was worth it and they took a photo of us at the end, which was nice.

Great experience!. Me and my girlfriend went there last Saturday. It was a blast from beginning to the end! Andras, the owner, was a very cool guy and the whole game is brilliantly designed! A must if You want a break from the hordes of tourists concentrating in standard tourustic places in Prague!
/Pietro and Anett

had lots of fun. Gave it 4 stars just because we were at another game called trap that was much more challenging. We weren't able to solve the room probably because our frinds came late and we had to go through everything again. So make sure everyone's on time. You should definitely check it out! Cost 1200czk

Great fun, must do and convenient location!. Me and my hubby visited Mind Maze last week 23 Apr. Booked via website few days in advance.Location is convenient, only 2 streets away from I.P. Pavlova subway stop (red C line), also lots of trams stop there, so really easy to get to.You don't need to speak English or Czech to do the game, all is just logic :-)We had really great time, never did anything like this before and were blown away! Loved it! Host was friendly chap, only needed to give us couple of cryptic hits to move us along in right direction. It was very challenging, made it out in 59 minutes feeling very proud and excited!I will recommend this place to all my friends going to Prague!Got sneak peak in their new room, which opens in May, will definitely come back to conquer that one too :-) Just reminder, they don't take card payment, so make sure you get cash before you visit. They state it on their website, despite of that, couple that was in front of us did not know and only just put their cash together.Many thanks for great time!!

Great. 4 of us visited, bit wary on arrival as the location is a seemingly derelict sidestreet but once inside you are made very welcome, the game is explained clearly and you are left to it. The game itself was challenging, some parts more than others but in the main an hour of good fun. Definitely recommend and suggest to book in advance to avoid missing out.

Worthy of laudation!. I have nothing but praise for this singular experience. Imagine 'The Crystal Maze' crossed with an adventure game like 'Myst' (or better yet 'Zork Nemesis') and you might be picturing something like 'Mind Maze'. The puzzles are ingenious and complex, though always fair and solvable. The location is atmospheric and convincing. Object puzzles are much more satisfying than in a videogame since the sheer 'objecthood' of the things that you're using to progress through the locked room, gives the experience a sense of reality and tactility impossible to achieve on a computer screen.I'd personally recommend combining your visit to 'Mind Maze' with a trip to the 'Museum of Alchemy', since a little background information, while in no way essential, can enrich the experience. You also don't need to be Czech to solve the puzzles. My group's time at 'Mind Maze' was just wonderful and utterly worth the price (especially if split between three or four people).

Must do in Prague :). It was great activity while in Prague and something really different! Recommend it to anyone, It's a bit out of the way but you get so see more of Prague and well worth the walk!

Great for adventure gamers.. Can't recommend mind maze highly enough, we had a brilliant experience. If you enjoy playing adventure games this will blow you away. We got stuck a couple of times and had a couple of cryptic hints to help us along the way but got out with about a minute to spare. Our host was very friendly and gave us a sneaky peek at the next room that will be opening soon. We will definitely make a return trip to try that.

Fantastic!. Myself and three other friends discovered this through trip advisor and it was one of the highlights of our time in Prague! I highly recommend you make some time for this fantastic hidden gem, you will not be disappointed! It lasts just over an hour (including briefing, etc) and costs approx $13 AUD per person (a bargain for the experience, and won't take too much time away from other sightseeing). Unlike TRAP, it doesn't require requisite knowledge (everything you need to know to escape is in the room with you), so it's suitable for anyone!

Hidden gem. It is quite hidden but well worth finding. Anyone with any worries about going here you have nothing to worry about.My husband and I went today at 10:30 and had a fantastic time. We needed a few hints which were given but still cryptically and we did eventually get out the room. We enjoyed it so much and highly recommend it as a change to sight seeing.We are planning on returning to Prague to try the new room :-)

Great Fun Must Try. We cheated and got out (not saying how) but no way would we have solved it in time otherwise. You can get hints if you are slow and it's very interactive and great for bigger kids to test their wits. Try it !!

Fantastic experience. I was there with a good friend of mine and we thoroughly enjoyed the escape game. If in Prague, it is a must as you won't regret it. The staff member who was our guide helped us occasionally by giving us hints via a walkie-talkie whenever observing that we were slowing down in solving the puzzle (webcams). I am looking forward to trying out the new room that is being set up whenever I return to Prague.

A great way to spend an hour. We had a great time and really enjoyed the challenge. We would recommend this to anyone who enjoys puzzles and likes thinking outside the box. The staff was very friendly and the whole set-up was very well done. I look forward to returning when they have the next room set up.
Good experience, great fun. We had a great time at Mindmaze. Creative game that requires great creativity. I would recommend anyone who`d like to try something special.

A great experience!. A great experience but a really difficult challenge! It's much harder than it seems, we maneged to escape thought.I would recommend this excellent experience to everyone who want to have a great time!We look forward to try the new room that they are building.
Good fun. Really great fun. we solved it and managed to get out which was even better. Worth the visit and it was nice to do something different!

Very Challenging. My husband and two girls (14 & 11) tried out MindMaze. It was a little challenging for them to figure out. But they had a great time doing it. My youngest child was really getting into the search. We look forward to trying this again when they have their next room available. The hostess was very kind and friendly. She spoke beautiful English.

Fun Experience. My girlfriend and I managed to book a late 9pm slot because the game was so popular, even on weekdays. The building was a little hard to find but once there we had a fantastic experience trying to solve the philosopher's puzzle and escape the room. The lady who guided us was very helpful and we managed to work it out after 45 minutes of good fun and brain-teasing. Would definitely try a similar event again and they said they were soon to open a second 'war' themed room.
A fun experience. A great experience but a really difficult challenge!It's much harder than it seems and somehow you miss what's right in front of you.

Good start for the evening. Very challenging, without advises via walkie talkie almoust impossible. The guides are very polite, nice guys. To start the evening it is a good event and definitely something different.

Very recommended!. My wife and I had a blast going through the alchemist chamber.The game is very interesting and is a real challenge.Our guide was very nice and helpful when we struck a wall and we had a lot of fun.Highly recommended!

Puzzles, but in real life!. If you like logic, numerical and problem solving puzzles then this is for you.
Great fun. It's hard to describe any further without giving too much away, so my advice is do it :-)
We were in Prague for 5 days and this was as good as anything else we did...

Challenging!. We went to MindMaze and we loved it, even though we couldn't complete the game and exit the room. The time ended when we were solving the last puzzle. The reception is very friendly and helpful before, during and after the game. We definitely recommend the experience!

Good fun. We did the Maze with some newly acquired, like minded mates after a river cruise.The place is a little difficult to find and not too attractive but once you're there. You get a warm welcome told what's what and let into the Alchemists Chamber with 1 hour to get yourselves out.Without giving too much away you have to solve puzzles using logic and common sense.We failed to escape but we did come close but more importantly all four of us enjoyed the experience and if in Prague again would make sure we returned to do the second room they are preparing.All in all a great way to spend time in Prague if your a bit "cultured" out.

Well worth it!. Our family of 4 had an awesome time! We've never participated in an activity such as this before, but from now on we're going to look for things like this!The employee that assisted us was awesome! Very friendly and helpful the whole time. Can't rave enough about the employee, facilities, and the game!

Excellent attraction. I usually love these kinds of game - doing it in real life with keys and books and stones as hints is really awesome. Completely worth your time, don't be afraid that there's no real sign on the front door - that's a real thing and not a trap :))Awesome day doing that and also started geocaching in Prague ... really really cool day of solving enigmas :) Congratulations to the inventors of that place !! Great idea !!

WE WON!. What a fun time! So glad we did this. Very challenging, definitely worth a visit. The details were awesome. And we got to meet the game designer! Ok I know this review is so vague, but I can't give any more away. ;)

Absolutely five star!. Family of four including two teens had an amazing time here! The lady who explained the game was so nice and very pleasant. Once the game started we almost forgot ourselves and totally focused on one thing together. When was the last time we worked so hard for something together as family? Probably never! We still talk about the wonderful experience and without doubt and any hesitation we totally recommend this place for fun that you would be talking for a long long time!!!

Mind maze. A brilliant game for all individuals. Good attraction for groups or couples. Challenging yet enjoyable. Working against the clock to exit the room. Friendly staff and worth the fee. Recommend to all.

We didn't feel welcome. We have tried another exit game in Prague before that we really loved, so maybe our expectations were a bit high.But here were several things that disappointed us.Our guide seemed not to observe us well because the hints we were given, were often not helpful because we were already some steps ahead.And also near the end of the game, our guide was not answering our questions, which felt like he was busy with something else.After the game finished they made is hurry to leave, which in our opinion was a bit rude.
Great experience. The puzzles are challenging and fun to solve. Highly recommend it to everyone. We would really like to try a different room next time we are in town.

Fun fun fun . It was very fun...the time passed very easily and we had a great time!!!!we did't manage to get out on time 😔
We recommend it!!!!!!

A "must-try" in Prague. It was a great experience! For us, it was the first experience of this kind, so we did not know exactly what to expect. When we read the description, we had to try it, because we just love brain puzzles and boardgames. It was hard to connect all the dots - in time - perhaps woth an extra 30min we would have made it out :P, but we were pretty close :) It was one of the highlights of our small Euro-trip stop in Prague. We will definetly try similar games when we find any!

One of the best experiences of the whole trip. It was an amazing experience! The puzzles are challenging and so much fun! The staff was very friendly and spoke excellent English. He gave us a few tips when necessary but overall didn't bother us.We managed to get out of the room just in the nick of time, lol.They only had one room available at the time we went, but if they had others we would certainly go again! It was easy to find too, next to a metro station so there weren't any troubles finding the building.

A Fun Hour. We did this on our first evening in Prague, which was a nice way to start off the trip. This is a fun event for groups of friends or family to solve the clues and exit the locked room. The staff was friendly and spoke good english as well. The only downside was the location was terribly hard to find, especially at night. A small side street with no lighting and only a small square sign next to the entry door, which is locked.

Highlight of the trip. Great set up and well paced adventure. The lady who hosts the game is very friendly, speaks excellent english and provides tips if requested or to help keep things moving. She gave us 3 tips in total and an extra 30 seconds so we made it out. They are going to open another room in as few weeks and we'd be straight back to do it if ever in Prague again.Definitely recommended!
Mind Melt. We really enjoyed this, it was hard and only 2 of us. But we would do it again in a flash. Not going to give nothing away. Except DO IT :-)

really clever - a lot of fun. This was a lot of fun - an exciting rush against the clock to solve the clues and puzzles. We didn't quite make it out in time, but each step forward was a small triumph in itself. I would love to go back and try the next room once it is open, which should be in the next few weeks, apparently. The 1-hour experience is very cleverly constructed and thought out. The initial panic as the door closed with no instructions soon subsided as we explored the room and soon found a starting point. the imagination and complexity of some of the ideas is impressive in itself - i take my hat off to the people who designed it. I'd love to be able to do this sort of thing more often and will have to struggle to not share details with friends who may want to try it for themselves! My only small problem was that the 2-way radio distorted the sound a little, so it was difficult to hear what was being said if there were hints being offered, so sometimes that took up precious time. For anyone who loves a challenge and puzzles I would thoroughly recommend this as a 'must do' experience.

Must Do. Lots of Fun!. We saw it on Trip Advisor and realized it was a must do, during our 4 day stay in Prague. Didn't go to the other one, Trap, but I assume they are similar. It takes one hour. The building is tricky to find. Keep the house number , 9 , in mind. You see s small sign and then ring the bell to get let into the building. The two of us were able to finish just in time with a few clues being radioed in. It was like being on a puzzle on survivor at times. It makes you want to open one up in NY! Be aware, they only take cash for now.
just go. =)) it was awesome!!!!!! just awesome. I didn't expect a lot of things in there. It's pretty difficult too which is good.
Amazing. It was super cool! We get out of the room in 50 minutes and each one of these minutes was a great fun. They are gonna open another ´World War II' room in April and we are defenetly going!

Great idea, a must if you have an hour to spare. The idea of this place seemed attractive to my fiancé and I so we booked in advance over the net via their website. It took a little while to find but once we got there it was worth the search. The hour flew by. Both of us found ourselves completely immersed in the game and with out giving too much away, you really do have to think about what's going on and how all of the objects interact with each other. We didn't make it out in time but that really didn't matter as we both had loads of fun. We both highly recommend you visit mind maze as it only takes an hour and is well worth it.

WOW.....Just feel like crazy excited!!!!. My friends and I were deaf which I thought it is impossible helpful because of the sound. So, I emailed them and they can help us easily. When we went there and they gave some papers to read instructions. Then we played it and we made it! We love it! Staffs are very nice and helpful!!! I love this game and I want to come back to play again!!! Give me a harder!!!! Oh Yeah!!!!
Exciting. The game was well-built, full of interesting details. The staff was friendly and helpful. Great way to try something completely different.

Excellent! Excellent! Excellent! Excellent! Excellent!. Seriously it`s just super excellent. Your brain will be completely twisted during this game.That`s what I exactly need after hard working days/ weeks/ months/ years....I could highly recommend!!!
Great FUN. Me and my Fiance went and loved it. Just make sure you tell them that you cannot speak Czech so you dont hear any Clues.

A must do while in Prague. We had an amazing 1 hour adrenaline experience, full of joy, concentration and magic. We definitely recommend it. We are already looking to visit other cities that have the similar experience to offer. Thank you Mindmaze for this great time.

Mind games in Prague. I visited this attraction with my wife on the last day of a 4 day stay in Prague as there are only so many castles, churches and towers you can look at. We are both old enough to remember the Crystal Maze but never tried this kind of game before. What a wonderful experience. We quickly became engrossed in the game and whilst we stumbled in parts, Marketta (lovely friendly girl) was available with the odd tip to ensure we reached our goal. I would guess three is the ideal number of players but even with two it's an engrossing concept. Would highly recommend this to anyone visiting Prague with an hour to kill. Easily found by tram and foot.

Even fun for oldies!. We are a not so young couple who recall on Crystal Maze on UK television. This is a great fun hour where we worked hard to solve the clues, some easier than others. Well recommended after a day out and before dinner...a great talking point afterwards. We almost succeeded!

So much fun!. Whether with your family, friends, or co-workers this is an awesome bonding experience. We were a group of 4 (2 adults/ 2 teens) and would love to go and do it again! Something a little different than the normal touristic type activities. Our family is still talking about it!

Absolutely brilliant!. We came here as a group of 10 girls for a hen party. We completed this in 2 groups of 5 and competed against each other which was brilliant. It takes about an hour and you have to look for clues to get out of the chamber... so much fun. It got our brains working after a few days of partying! The lady working there was great, really helpful and friendly. This is definitely something to do with a group of friends, worth every penny! Was even better that our group won... 51 minutes :)

Amazing experience. This is a really great way to spent 1 hour , and everyone who comes to Prague must visit this. My recommendation is to come in larger group , because extra par of eyes can be crucial in solving puzzles. Lady who works there is very helpful and giving hints when you ask for it. She told us that they planning to put one extra mind game with theme WW2 and I really thinking about coming back to Prague just to take a shoot at it.

Most Amazing Experience in Prague. Usually I would take care not to seem too enthusiastic so as not to oversell, but in this case I can't oversell this even if I try. This was definitely the best experience I had in Prague and was the highlight of our trip. I would advise not to get discouraged finding the place, especially when the shops in the main street next to it don't even know it exists, which was quite unsettling. Just put a little effort into finding the place and getting in, and you won't regret it from there.We were two people and we were confident and conceited enough to think that were going to set a new high score. Despite being close, we couldn't even get out in time, even with the hints and the few extra minutes. Regardless of us not making it out, it was still a pretty amazing experience and when we finished we met the genius behind the maze and it was just incredible meeting the guy whose puzzle we couldn't overcome. I also have to give props to the girl who introduced us to the rules and was our connection to the outside during the game, she was very friendly and was helpful throughout the experience.

Amazing maze. Delightful experience, went there as a group of 3 and we actually made it out (with a few hints and a few minutes overtime)! The atmosphere is safe but at the same time very exciting and eerie. I normally sweat a lot, but the complexity and stress made me wet to the bone! Truly amazing experience. Also, the girl that met us and was our contact "outside" did an excellent job. Thank you! Try this!

Grand adventure in the heart of Prague!. After booking online (without paying) and taking the time to go there on time, my girlfriend and I hesitated for around 5 minutes to actually buzz ourselves in. After all, how "safe" was it to just book something on Internet in a foreign country and show up there not knowing what's going to happen to you (except that they are going to lock you in a room for sure!). However, the moment we met the young lady who let us in and explained the game to us -which by the way was very professionally arranged-, we both knew that we are in for massive fun. IT WAS AMAZING! I couldn't believe my girlfriend taking such a game that seriously. We worked together and as it turned out that was the key to win the game -by working together I mean that we were communicating and explaining to each other what we found and how we thought the next courses of actions should look like. You'd be amazed how much stuff came up and was solved during these exchanges (a lesson for life). The merely one-hour experience was full of ups and downs and of course serendipity. With a bit of luck - a wild guess instead of solving the last puzzle - we escaped the room in 55 minutes.We spend quite some money in Prague but this one was definitely one of those that we wont regret (and believe me there were some!).

MINDblowing. If you are in Prague you really should give this a go! It was so much fun! Very atmospheric and great pretending to be Sherlock. The lady that helped us was fantastic. We used the walkie talkie a few times - sadly we didn't solve the problem before the hour but were really close and had a lot of fun trying. It was great to work as a team and the lady was in hysterics at our very unconventional ways of trying to solve the mystery! We couldn't recommend this place highly enough! The customer service was excellent and it was great to do something different! BOOK IT - you won't be disappointed!

Fab and fun!. Me and my husband paid a visit to mind maze during our 4 night stay in Prague, located in what appears to be a shady part of town and only a small sign on the wall of an apartment block we thought we were in the wrong place! It was dark and very eerie, once we located the buzzer the door opened and we walked into a pitch black corridor, suddenly a light came on and we saw a sign with mind maze on it and an arrow pointing into the basement, it was nice to see a very friendly lady greet us once down there as I felt the scene set was a perfect opening to a horror film! She explained our task and we had 1 hour to achieve it, we both had great fun and enjoyed every minute of it, it's definitely a must do if your near Prague!!

Seriously engaging and fun. It might be a bit hard to find the place, but don't be weirded out that it is in a little side-street in an apartment. This was a great experience. You get to be in the room of an alchemist who supposedly found the philosopher's stone. Your goal is to find the stone and get out. We were two people and managed most of it on our own. It was really fun to see how our skills completed each other (one of us more code-theory oriented and the other more skilled with devices and handy work). The cool thing is that you get a radio station and can ask for hints if you get stuck. That way you can be sure you make full use of your time. The girl who was our guide was nice and helpful. The atmosphere was great too. At times I felt like in a real life point and click game, while my boyfriend felt like some kind of Sherlock Holmes. I recommend this 100%.

Booze Cruise. We were looking for some pre partying activities and come acorss this. Great evening, gave us something to talk about for the whole night, how we could perform better as a team in the future. A real group experience. Definite value for money, and a great and unique experience.

Best attraction in Praha. Me and my wife were on our honeymoon and after four days of hiking Prague we felt like we pretty much exhausted all the touristy things to do and seek a new adventure - we got lucky cause we found this place on tripadvisor. The good experience started with the service - they were really understanding about our questions and time changes during the email correspondence regarding booking a time.It was a bit difficult finding the place since they had no sign on the building.When we got there the owner welcomed us with a brief and concise explanation about the attraction: you are locked in a room with a theme and need to find your way out by riddles and puzzles. although we didn't succeed with all the puzzles - it was AWESOME!Whenever you get stuck you can use a walkie talkie to ask for hints.The mood they created is excellent and effective.We recommended people to go to Prague for this. Really.Thank you for a great experience!

Excellent, try it😊. Went to MindMaze because it looked like something different & interesting to do. We were not disappointed, an excellent experience. Gets you thinking & working together as a team. It's also really good fun. Can't recommend it enough

Unique and lots of fun!. I visited mind maze on Feb 18th with some friends who had come to visit us in Prague! None of us really knew what to expect, the website was vague on the details but we were really intrigued and hoped it wouldn't be too easy! Well, no worries there! It was a really challenging experience and loads of fun working together as a team to figure out how to leave the room! The girl who worked there and told us all about what we would do etc. was wonderful, we all felt she made the experience even more enjoyable by being so kind and accommodating! Needless to say we can't wait to go back once the next room is ready to go in March!

Great experience. We were on short family trip to Prague and our 20 year old son decided this looked a better bet than wandering round the castle and cathedrals. Don't want to give too much away but was the right mix of having to use brain power and common sense. If you only have a short time in Prague make sure you do this

Perfect family experience. Wit 3 teenage boys who have been to Prague before, we were looking for something different to do-this was it! A little way off the beaten track, we eventually found the entrance (helped by taking a taxi there!) and were given an excellent introduction to the mystery game with a walkie talkie to use inside the "room" in case we needed help or to escape! We were determined not to ask for help but alas even our 5 brains combined were not enough to solve the complex puzzles and clues to escape the door in an hour. So half a dozen calls to our helpful girl at the end of the walkie talkie meant we escaped the room with 1 minute to spare! Do have a go and try it-a fun hour to spend as a group of friends or family together and something a little different to talk about when home.Thanks for the experience and can't wait to try the second mind maze of world war 2.

aMAZEing. Mind Maze is the ultimate puzzle! The concept, the setup, and the execution are all so well done and provide you with a game that is the perfect balance between challenging and fun. Definitely get a group of friends together and try to find your way out of the Alchemist's Chamber. Trust me, you do not want to miss out on this awesome experience!

Highly original. Was looking for something different to do whilst on a trip to Prague with my 2 teenage sons. This really fit the bill. It was really unusual and great fun working out the clues to escape the room. We didnt quite make it but had great fun trying. Would thoroughly recommend if travelling with teenagers

Fantastic!. Visited it with 2 friends recently. Great experience, it was so much fun. We didn't make it but the lady who hosted it graciously gave us 2 more minutes to escape. It is like a real life point and click game. Great fun.

MindMaze Prague. Absolutely a "Must" during your visit to Prague! Even though not successful in the end, really enjoyed it with my wife and son (age 11)! Now looking for similar experience in other cities!

Amazing experience totaly worth it!. One of the best attraction in Prague! I hope that second room will be done ASAP :) Marketa was very friendly and helpful. I would reccomend it to everyone who wants to experienced reall live adventure :)

Challenging and fun!. Great experience for people that like challenges. Great for team building.We managed to get out only 2 seconds before the deadline :)3 people team is optimal in my opinion.Located near I.P. Pavlova station. The explanation is in English, very simple.

even better than expected. Visited the escape room with three of my friends and everyone enjoyed enjoyed it a lot. I was already very curious about the whole thing but it was even better than expected. Quite challenging but huge fun and something to talk about for a long time!

A most excellent and exhilarating experience!. Being somewhat skeptical at the concept of an 'escape room' I wasn't expecting much. After all how fun could it be locked into a room and solve puzzles for an hour? Well, it turns out it is ridiculously fun!After some pleasantly brief and clear instructions we were immediately led to the room. Coming into the puzzle room itself the we were instantly immersed in the atmospheric theme of the room. The combination of antique furniture and weird artifacts engendered a sense of arcane mystery which really added to the experience. As instructed we quickly started interacting with and scrutinizing every object in the room which yielded a bounty of clues and puzzles that needed solving. And even though we were with four people everybody always had something to do as there was always still a missing piece to be found or problem to be solved.The challenging puzzles are beautifully integrated into the room and it is extremely satisfying to solve them. On the rare occasion that we were completely stuck we got subtle hints that nudged us in the right direction without ruining the fun of discovery or those lovely "EUREKA!" moments. The puzzles are varied so they don't get repetitive and time simply flew by as we solved them in a focused euphoric state culminating in the final climatic discovery. Without spoiling too much I can tell you there is a nice surprise twist awaiting visitors towards the end.All-in-all I can't recommend it enough! Especially if you are a first time visitor and am as skeptical as I was. We visited another escape room in Prague (from TRAP) after this wonderful experience. And while it was enjoyable as well I definitely recommend MindMaze over the other one as it is just better executed and thought-out. Next time I visit Prague I won't hesitate to visit their second room!

you must experience this.... very very cool.. My wife and I did this on our first night in Prague. It's like a real life adventure game. One of the coolest experiences. We failed to 'escape' but loved it none the less.hope they add variations of the game in other cities.

do this now. really fun experience and one we will never forget, hugely recommend this to anyone who is visiting prague, little difficult to find as it was in the basement of apartment building but that really added to the tension of the experience

Fantastic!. My family (parents with 3 children aged 15, 15, 10) entered the maze with some hesitance as this concept is brand new and we booked our time slot based solely on the wonderful reviews on TripAdvisor. It was beyond our expectations: for an hour we were all absorbed in the task at hand, having a great time together. Surprisingly(?) the kids' open minds often led us to the right answers. The staff was very friendly and they told us they are working on a new maze, to be opened in March.Since the less said about the experience the better so as not to ruin it, let me just say: BOOK IT! It will do wonders to family bonding. Definitely the highlight of our trip.One comment though: The venue is located in a residential area inside a regular apartment, so it is easy to miss the entrance. Look for the house numbers (Tyrsova 9). The attraction is on -1F
Really fun. I went with a friend and the experience was a lot of fun. Teams are from 2 to 4 persons, and you do not see time pass. It´s not too expensive (around 40 euro per team)

A must try . If you have ever watched the crystal maze, or any show like that and thought I could do that. Give this a go, it's a surreal experience, very different and I can honestly say you do forgot about everything outside the room as you stay focused on the job in hand. It's harder than we thought, but great fun. I have not stopped talking about it since we returned to the UK.

Fun and exciting adventure!. We were 2 people visiting the Alchemist's chamber and we really loved it! Very well designed game with lots of challenging but rewarding clues to solve. You really travel in time and have lots of fun. Staff was also very friendly! Highly recommend this fun experience to anyone visiting Prague!

Bloody brilliant !!!!!!!. It was one of the highlights of our stay in Prague, and a diamond of a find... If you fancy yourself as a bit of a super sluth or budding Sherlock this is a must for you... It was an hour of intrigue and frustration but, me and the fella are still speaking so it can't have been that bad... The staff were so friendly and it's all in English as well.. It keeps you guessing from start to finish and we can't stop talking about it... Even now. So I strongly recommend a visit to the MIND MAZE and was excellent value for money...(they are building a new room now and can't wait to return to Prague as we will DEFINATELY be doing that one as well) ...

Fun with friends. Went there with my friends to have some fun and do something challenging. The overall experience exceeded our expectations, this was the highlight of our trip! Close to downtown, friendly staff!

Amazing adventure, definitely must see in Prague!. We were two groups (first was two couples and the second was a couple with two kids 12 and 14) who went in separately. Both groups, we really loved the game, each group played its own way, but both had fun. When we came inside, it was like world outside the room doesnt even exist.If you are in Prague for holidays you should definitelly try this, you won't regret your 60 minutes in there.

Challenging and Rewarding. To those familiar with the 'escape the room' format, this is a very well thought out 'real world' version which places you in an Alchemist's chamber. The instructions from staff are fairly simple, which I liked, just play with everything in the room - their suggestion was spot on as pretty much all of the fixtures and fittings are somehow involved in your quest to escape (with a few red herrings). They employ a two-way walkie-talkie system which allows the participants to ask questions and for the staff to give you hints as you go along. This is a very useful system and allows the staff to calibrate the difficulty of the game to the players' progress (they watch you via hidden cameras). The staff leave you alone at first but when hints are given they are circuitous enough to keep the game satisfying but not frustrating. There are lots of different types of puzzles which succeeds in keeping the game fresh for the entire hour.Completing the game is impossible without at least two people but I would be reluctant to recommend more than this as it may get a little crowded with more than this.My only issue was that at a couple of points there was ambiguity as to whether we had successfully completed a task - I don't think that the game benefits from trying to fiddle a lock open or attempting to press a button harder, perhaps some of the components susceptible to wear should be made of slightly more hard-wearing materials. There were also a few bits and pieces that detracted slightly from the illusion of being in an Alchemist's chamber - e.g., power extensions hidden under mats etc. Overall, though, a thoroughly rewarding evening, I just wish that their second room was already open (coming March apparently).
Awesome experience!. If you like puzzles you will love this game as well. Great atmosphere, close to the down town, nice operator. I really enjoyed it! :)
Family Fun. The entire family enjoyed MindMaze; challenging and rewarding at the same time. I would highly recommend this activity!

Just awesome. We came to play today with my GF and I must say this was just awesome, it's really an amazing game and we had such an experience solving these puzzles. The aim was to exit from the room by interacting with different stuff (like in National Treasure movie, you know). So if you, like me, fond of solving "mysterious puzzles" or simply like fun and new kind of entertainment you must visit this.

Good fun, kind of expensive. I'd never heard about this type of thing before but came here with a couple friends not knowing what to expect. It's really good fun! Quite challenging (we got out but it took us just over the 60 minute mark) and it's really important for everyone to work together instead of doing your own thing (that was part of our problem). It's a bit expensive but overall worth it split between four people and considering the time and setup the owner has to do every time. Definitely recommended!

Amazing experience. This real escape room was "a must do" for me as I am a great fan of all kinds of escape room on my smart phone. The way it is prepared is very impressive, time was running quickly and I really did enjoyed it with my team mates. The staff is very kind and helpful:) This room is definitely worth the visit while staying in Prague.

Exiting game experience. We really recommend MindMaze, this is a one hour adventure - easy to find in Prague. Exciting, mind challenging and fun to do! Much better than a museum! More like a game - you really have to use your brain.We have been concentrating for one hour to solve several well hidden challenges in order to find the secret stone of the alchemists chamber - and to get out of the room. Actually we didn´t make it in time, nevertheless it was well worth the time and the money.When we will be next time in Prague and the second room will be open we will come back!!

my MIND and my wife were aMAZEd. Longer weekend with my wife in Prague, of course in romantic way :) So I planned everything and I wanted to do something extraordinery. You know - not only the monuments, history and theatre. I founded there a tip for MindMaze. It looked quite good but no more referrences in google, or reviews. Doesnt matter, lets try it! We came there (dark street not long from the centre) and my wife was afraid "I dont want to go there, locked room and puzzles - it will be someting like SAW..." It wasnt of course :) No puzzle-killing or horror things. Pure secrect adventure, which we really enjoy it - great for cooperation, your fantasy, your wondering... We are 33y old and we are not good in guessing symbols and we are not playing videogames (it was long time ago) - but it was still good level for us (without helping the guy from mindmaze through walkie-talkie we would not found the final key, thank you! :) So we are exited, and looking forward to the next chamber! 100%recommendation. Great idea, hungary friends!! :)

Skvely novy druh zabavy!!! / Excellent new kind of fun!!!. I nam se podarilo uniknout z uzasneho "Exit roomu". Pokud mate radi escape hry na zpusob 100 doors, 100 crypts, 100 rooms, atd. tak tohle je presne na ten zpusob s tim rozdilem, ze je to realne!!! Vrele doporucujeme vyzkouset Alchymistovu komnatu od Mindmaze! Krasne kulisy, provedeni i celkova myslenka!We managed to escape from the wonderful "Exit Room" as well. If you like escape games like 100 doors, 100 crypts, 100 rooms, etc. this is exactly like that with the main difference that this is real!! I highly recommend to try alchemist's chamber of MindMaze! Beautiful coulisses, whole interior and overall idea!

Great fun!. We played "Basterds" and "Monaco" and I must say that these were one of the best escape games we´ve experienced, good story, amazing environment/rooms, catchy puzzles. The Game-master was giving hints gently so we were still able to solve the problems ourselves and did not feel like a child. Great job here, worth experience.
Spring of 45. Great game. We had so much fun! Very interesting codes! Great atmosphere of 2nd WW. Thank you very much
Monaco Room. It was a great experience. It was the first time foremost of us, but Martin was a great guide. We are looking forward to come back :)

Something different. We played Monaco Heist and it was really interesting. There were no visible padlocks so we had to think a bit differently. It wasn't exactly difficult but it was indeed challenging. The room is nicely decorated. The staff was great too.
Great game, had so much fun!. The Monaco room was my 2nd escape game, it was amazing! Karolína was very friendly and helpful, great for foreigners also. Thank you!

One of the best escape games I have played. This was my 6th Escape Game and this was for sure one of the best ones. I really like that this game works with Magnets and there is no lock with numbers at all. Karolína did such a great job to explain all the details.
