I can´t compare to other similar games as this was my first one, but certainly not the last one! Should you be visiting Prague with your friend and have spare time do not miss the opportunity to visit Trap.

Very interesting. We have been 2nd time in TRAP and it was very good again. This time we tried beat bomb room. It took us little bit longer due to problems in first room. We used couple hints. Girl who who was watching us and giving hints was very pleasant. We enjoy it.

Escape the Soviet agent.. This was our first time playing an escape game. We've chosen a theme with a flat of a Soviet secret agent. The escape was reasonably difficult for us and we had a great fun. Teamwork is needed for some tasks. We were four and I think this works the best. We escaped in 53 minutes without clue :-)

Good bit of fun!. Went to the Secret Agent Game with a friend and it was great fun! Both of us had been to another escape room previously and for us the level of difficulty was just right. They also had a good system in which they would call and give you hints if you got stuck, which worked well. It helped just enough to get you unstuck but not too much to make you feel like you didn't get to solve it on your own.You don't need to know any czech to play the game and the lady who received us was very friendly and spoke good English.At the end they even took a photo of us and sent it by email, which I considered a rather thoughtful extra service!

Failed but great fun!!!. This was a great experience! Group of 4 girls for a weekend break! We booked theBomb room and the lady who showed us in was lovely. She also went through at the end how to solve the last few clues that we didn't have time to do. This wasn't because there was a specified time limit but because the 'bomb' went off in the room so it ended the game! We were in there for over an hour and 20 minutes. This is highly recommended and such a good price!

Solved!. Went with a friend, and we solved it! It was our first time playing an escape game, and this was a great experience. The person working there was just incredibly friendly and helpful during the game - we caved and asked for (only 3) clues. She even gave us suggestions for other sites to see around Prague!

Awesome one of a kind experience. If you like solving puzzles and think you are smart then you must try TRAP!
It was such an awesome and experience that 1 hour passed in a flash.
A truly unique experience if you love solving puzzles.

Secret agent. Thanks god there was an operator on the phone who could help us when be got stuck. This was really helpful because not every task was easy in this game... Anyway we enjoyed to solve puzzles and unlock the locks to get more and more deep in the game. The operator was a very sympathetic girl. We have been the last group of the day and because nobody was there after us and we were a bit slower than we expected, she gave us ten minutes more to finish the game which was very kind from her. We haven't had any problem with the reservation or the staff or anything in game. I can recommend it also for english speaking people. It was a really fun hour an we would love to try also other games like Tomb room to have something to compare. Who likes escape game, this is something what you shouldn't miss.
Amazing Fun!!. It was so much fun to go through all the puzzles and we made it out which felt awesome :). We were in Prague for 3 days and we loved the Secret Agent's game

An unusual experience! Highly recommended!. My brother and I did the "secret agent" game. We didn't stand a chance finishing all of the puzzles in time, mainly because it was just the two of us, but also because it was our first escape room attempt, so if you're inexperienced with the genre, make a group of three or more.The staff give hints through a telephone according to the team's progress and they also give extra time if they can. They prefer you succeeded than stopping you in the middle of the game. At least that was our experience. Ofcourse, you don't have to answer the telephone and hear the hints.Although I hate getting hints in puzzles, the hints seemed to be necessary to make up for our disadvantages, so it was still very enjoyable.
Fun. Excellent riddles and very nicely organised. It was a blast. I have eben to other escape the room games. But this is definetely one of the best.

Unbelievably good fun. I loved every minute of this, it was exciting, fun, thrilling and tough in parts but eventually made our way out. We played the 'Secret Agent' game and it was definitely money well spent. Could not recommend this highly enough especially if you are competitive and up for a challenge.

Youli. It was a fun experience, the puzzles were good, not too difficult nor too easy. The time was just about right, it would be fun though if there were more rooms (and more time, of course). A whole trap-house, maybe :) Despite that, I would recommend it if you like puzzles, of course!

Secret agent. Best for families or small groups. There were only 2 of us and felt stupid as the kind guide phoned us with hints and attention directions every time we got stuck. And we were stuck a lot. It does not have the glamor of 007, but it's good + clean, 1 hour fun. I was (naively) hoping for more harassment or sense of pending doom, to feel the real pressure. It's reasonably priced.

Trapped in fun. An excellent way to familiarize yourself with the city! Walking to TRAP adds to the event. We were thrilled with the staff! Klara is great. Be sure to book your trap experience while in Prague!

SO much fun!. My husband and I did 2 rooms over Easter weekend in Prague. The bomb room was awesome, so much fun, fast moving, difficult, but not too difficult clues. The second, the dungeon room was more challenging for us. I don't think our brains (or maybe our American schooling) let us think that way, but the "helper" that you call is super nice and gives you hints so you can see the solution, he didn't just give us answers. We had so much fun and would love to do something similar again! Highly recommend. I can see how more brains would help in solving the riddles.

Secret Agent. My husband and I had a fantastic time with this puzzle! We found it to be both challenging and fun. I especially liked how the staff payed attention to how we were doing (they have a camera that they can track your progress in the room) and helped us when we were really stuck. This helped it to be fun and not exasperating. Thank you for the great time, TRAP Prague!!!
Great fun. went with three other friends and once we got going was a lot of fun. Starting was a little fustrating mainly our own fault I think but from then on it was a lot of fun
Secret agent. It was a great experience, I loved it! We needed some help, but I enjoyed it anyway. Will definitely try more rooms next time!

So much fun!. Had originally booked in to play secret agengent but by the end of the day had played all 3!! They are very addictive! The bomb room was a bit too difficult but managed to do the other 2 in decent times. Highly recommended!
Great 15 minutes which take an hour :). You know it: When experiencing an adventure that utilize your brain to its max, time flies a different way...
Amazing place. Amazing place for your brains. Take friends and just go there. A lot of fun for such short period of time. After I felt like I was there whole day but not 1 hour. Highly recommend.

Bomb room. We played the Bomb room in here and it was quite difficult but still loads of fun. The staff help you out when you're totally stuck (as we were quite a few times!!) If you're in Prague and have an hour or so to kill I would give this a go.

An exhilarating experience from start to finish! . My husband and I booked our TRAP experience having scoured things to do in Prague on trip advisor and I'm so glad we did! When we arrived we were unsure as the entrance is shared with a number of other different businesses but once we were in, the staff welcomed us instantly and talked us through the game.We are both very competitive and love games such as 'The Room' so this was right up our street. It was really cleverly done and brilliantly executed. We did the Secret Agent room and managed to escape with just 2 minutes to go. It is definitely solvable with just 2 people but would still be fun with 3 or 4.If highly recommend this to anyone visiting Prague - just bring your thinking cap and a partner in crime!

Excellent Activity. Trap Prague is a great place to visit for doing something different on a City break. Myself and my partner had a brilliant time trying to find our way out of the Tomb room! It is very exciting and a great way to spend 60 minutes... I would recommend any couple or group of friends to try it out.The place is quite tricky to find as there isn't a large sign on the door, just a small plaque... so look out for the plaque on a building!

Eventful hour. We entered the game with 2 friends not knowing what to expect but after completing the secret agents room (all be it after the hour time limit ) we came out having thoroughly enjoyed the experience and would do another game without hesitation. The girl was every helpful with the clues when we got stuck and was every chatty after we had finished. A must do if you want a challenge but advise a minimum of 4 people

Fun 60 minutes!. My husband and I love games and this was a highlight of our trip. We went through several rooms in the Russian Spy game and were pushed to the limit but bonded over it! Take your friends and be tested on your ability to think out of the box!

Amazing!. We went here as a couple and did 2 rooms - the bomb room and the tomb room.First we did the bomb room - which is so very hard for a pair... we did not make it but the nice lady showed us how the story continues so we did not feel left out. The room was well kept - everything in top condition.The tomb room - it's just made for couples - it was so much fun!!!We did it in 40 minutes but it was not easy - a lot of team work and thinking.The decorations are amazing.if I could wipe my memory and go there again I would. By far my most favorite room ever. If you have only time for one place - do yourself a favor and go to this one.Hope you will enjoy it as much as I did. - and don't forget to sign the walls.

Mr. We did the secret agent room. We were 3 and we didn't manage to do it on time. But the girl was nice and she let us 20 minutes more. The price is worth it, and it was a lot of fun ! It is really not that easy, but it is still possible !

Absolutely BRILLIANT fun. We first did the Spy Room. It was superb, challenging but not so much that we found it frustrating. We did it in 57 mins - not bad we're advised for a team of 2 - you can do it with up to 5 people. The reception host was friendly, helpful and we enjoyed it so much we booked to do the Tomb room two days later - that was harder. We got a voucher for 150 koruna off the second booking which was a bonus. Be aware that the Tomb Room and Bomb Room are in a basement with steep stairs but once you're in the room it's pretty much on one level. I cannot emphasise how much fun this is if you're at all into logical puzzles/crystal maze/the Adventure Game type things.

Good brain tester! . Just got back from prague and was at TRAP and did the tomb room! It's was good fun, slightly difficult at some times but the trap team were there to help us through! Definitely recommend it was a good way to spend an hour
Cheeky stag. Really good. Hangover didn't help but very amusing and the girl was very helpful. Booked both rooms for 2 teams over 2 hours. Definitely recommend this for any kind of weekend!

Fantastic!!. Cannot write a more positive review about TRAP Prague, as a young couple we didn't know what to expect, it was fantastic from start to finish, well worth the money and would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Prague!

Different and brilliant. As mentioned in another review, the entrance is sketchy a.f. It's a shared premise with other businesses operating on it and the sign isn't particularly obvious so if you're coming from the Powder Tower, it's on the left of the street about half way down and you just ring the buzzer for TRAP. That aside it was amazing and it's an experience you'll struggle to fully describe. Essentially you have to escape from the flat of a secret agent from the 70's but I'll leave it at that. Did it with a minute to spare, look out for us on the wall! (Harry + Olivia)

A Different kind of quality Attraction. . Excellent time trying to solve This, the staff are lovely and welcoming and make sure you make the best of it. Brilliant concept, brilliantly Done! 67 minutes :( make sure your wits are about you when you take it on!

Great Fun!. Having read reviews on tripadvisor about this attraction, we were really looking forward to trying it out. Don't be put off by the initial impression of the venue.....the entrance isn't what you would expect. We were greeted by a really nice guy and he explained the object of the game to us. We were then 'trapped' in the room and had to solve various puzzles, within 1 hour, in order to get out of the room again. The puzzles were well thought out, with a good level of difficulty. If you became stuck throughout the game, someone would phone you with a hint, in order for you to make the most of the experience. We had great fun at TRAP Prague and completed the puzzles in 55 minutes as a couple.

Sketchy entrance, but worth it. Really really fun. Definitely something that I havent done before, and way harder than I expected. I would advise not enjoying that fine alcoholic beverages prior to doing it though. You might end up failing the city and watching it explode.

Good but kind of too difficult. When I can't solve something or have to rely on someone else, I get mad. And before going in they tell you 99% of people need help or additional clues to get to the next step in the game. We took about 7 clues Haha. It's fun but stumped us. We took 1.5hours and especially near the end it was getting easier but also more and more disheartening when you needed clues but still a good time. It's obvious that people love this. Good idea
Very good escape game. I really enjoyed the game. I love this kind of puzzles and this one was great. One hour for me was like 15 minutes because game absorbs you all.

What fun!. We had a wonderful time trying to find our way out of the spy's apartment! It took a little longer than an hour, but we were assured that was normal for only two people. Made us feel a teeny bit better... But so exciting to try and figure out all the clues. We wished that we'd had time to try one of the other rooms before leaving Prague. Definitely our top attraction in Prague!
Great time!. The other reviews are not wrong, this was a very unique experience and tons of fun. We did the tomb game and it was just awesome. Highly recommended!

Brilliant. We, family including 2 teenage boys , described it to someone afterwards and it sounded like a real life version of a PlayStation game ! Not sure what to expect but found it realy enjoyable,challenging, different and great fun, definitely worth doing when you are in Prague.

Awesome family experience. We tried the "Tomb" version one afternoon as a family of four. We manged to finish in 59 minutes and it was the most fun we had had as a family in a very long time! We liked it so much that we scheduled to do the "Bomb" the next day. Came back and did the second in two days and it was a blast as well. This is great activity for families or couples. You will have to work a little for your entertainment, but it is so worth it!

Awesome time!!. We had so much fun solving all the different pieces of the puzzle!! Nice change of pace after sightseeing all day! Definitely recommend this to anyone in Prague looking for something different to do!!

Really fun, and harder than Mindmaze. We had such a good time at MindMaze the day before, our daughters wanted more and found Trap. We played the cold war spy game, and enjoyed it quite a bit. It was definitely harder than the MindMaze alchemy puzzle. Location for this game is very close to the heart of Old Town, and thus easy to get to from hotels there. On line reservations worked out fine, and

Loved the Trap. Spent a fun hour yesterday, four of us, playing this game. We did the spy game. First test is finding the location as only clue once you have address is to look for the apartment call button in building for The Trap to be buzzed in the door. Staff were really friendly and helpful. Giving clues on the phone when we needed a bit of help. Never. Done anything like this before, but all agreed it was well worth the money and an unusual activity for our Christmas week in Prague! Hghly recommend, would def consider trying one of the other games on offer if we had time.

Brilliant!. My friends and I had read about TRAP Prague on trip advisor and decided to give it a go. We turned up without a booking hoping that we could get in to play the game. We made a reservation easily and returned in two hours time ready to attempt to escape the room.The hosts explained the game to us and then locked us in the room with 60 minutes on the clock.It was such a great experience. There were 3 of us that took part and we had a blast! The staff were helpful and provided us with hints and clues along the way when they thought we were stuck and we managed to escape with 1 minute 11 seconds to spare! It is a brilliant puzzle and I would definitely recommend it to anyone who has a spare hour or so in Prague. It's something different but provides you with a lot of fun!

Great way to spend an hour. Treat yourself to a celebratory drink when you've escaped, not before!!. We managed to escape from the tomb room with minutes to spare, in what we found to be a challenging maths orientated escape game. We thoroughly (four members to our team) enjoyed the experience and look forward to doing something similar when we are next in town.

Really cool! . Such fun! As two teenagers, we really enjoyed the whole experience. We visited the tomb scenario, basically you get locked in a room and have to problem solve your way out. The lady at the reception was really comforting and welcoming, as it did feel a bit weird getting locked in a room in a city you don't know. The problems were hard, but help was given when needed - probably easier with a family or group of 3 or 4 people, rather than a pair. The price was pretty good for what you got, as you're given about an hour and a half to finish the game. Would definitely revist, or maybe play a different scenario! Would definitely recommend for families travelling with grumpy teenagers tired of walking!
Must do in Prague!. This was lots of fun and challenging. Definitely worth doing. Is located centrally in Prague and staff are really friendly.
Its a TRAP!!. This was so much fun to do - you won't regret doing this for sure. It's as surprising as it is fun, like one of those game shows on TV but then nice!
trap. Excellent, we all had extremly good team building hour. It,s not only about IQ, it s about ideas, team cooperation and a bit of adrenalin. And a great fun, of course!

Classic Escape Game full of Surprises.... Played the secret agent game, there is a slightly reduced rate of 1000CK for couples which is a nice touch. The hosts were fantastic and helpful when they needed to be, but allowed us to be engaged in the game.We managed to escape! The game has a variety of clues and puzzles and is constructed brilliantly. There are a number of great little touches and surprises along the way too :) Best escape game I've played.

Amazing. Great fun, takes the hour as the puzzles are challenging but not to difficult that you can't complete them. The staff are really friendly and the place well worth a visit. I wish i'd done more of the games there.

trap bomb room. We are a family of four youngest was thirteen. We had a little trouble finding it there isn't much of a sign outside. We did the bomb room it took us 73 minutes to do we had some hints and we were blown up. We really enjoyed it was a lot of fun. Would recommend

A must try!. We went to the "secret agent" room after reading about it on tripadviser and enjoyed ourselves so much that we had to do another. after doing the "tomb" room we couldnt resist and also did the "bomb" room! after doing 3/3 rooms it is safe to say that TRAP IS A MUST! its clever, fun, challenging and a great bonding experience for couples. an attraction worth the time and money, one you wont regret.special thanks to ANDREW who welcomed us to our first two rooms and helped us have so much fun!
Brilliant Fun. Was looking for something different and saw Trap rated highly on trip advisor. Lots of fun and really makes you think. Would definitely recommend! We escaped (just)
You will. be hooked:-) No matter if you get out or get stuck, you will be having fun! Do not sit in a pub, come!

Must do if your visiting prague!. Played trap with my boyfriend in Prague and found the overall experience fantastic! Staff was very helpful and polite. The game itself was so well designed and organised very challenging but easily accessible help by calling up the staff for hints. We really enjoyed ourselves and had such a thrilling time even if it did take us 1 hour 17 minutes to complete!! Highly recommend if you have time to fit this in on your visit to this wonderful city!
Try it. Try it - you will like it! Much better than shifting mouse on the mouse pad! No live spiders, do not worry.

Worth the money! Fun for all groups!. Definitely worth the money to check this out! I went with just my boyfriend since we were traveling just the two of us. But I would recommend this for up to 5 people as well. We completed the Tomb Room because it was "medium difficulty". It was perfect! It was challenging enough where we weren't thinking "this is lame and easy", but not insanely difficult or impossible. We left feeling like Sherlock and Watson (I was obviously Sherlock). They offer hints when needed through a phone, which was awesome and allowed us to finish in the time limit. We chose Trap Prague because they have been running these rooms for years (experience) and started in Budapest (well traveled ;)). However, if they're booked up, try one of the others in Prague- the experience is worth it!TIP: Use the hint phone! It doesn't pay to be stubborn and try to complete all of the clues yourself, because you might not finish in the time limit resulting in "feeling like a failure".

We died and still had fun.. This was our first experience of an escape room. Brilliantly thought out, we did need a few clues, we didn't defuse the bomb within the hour but they gave us a few minutes extra and we escaped. Considering returning before the end of our trip if we can.
Awesome. That was the best attraction that I had in Prague.You really need to think there to exit the room:)

I guess that's what you call a "no-show". We've booked the tomb room in advance of about one week. We got to the confirmed adress perfectly on time, where we rang the door. Once, twice...again and again for about 20 minutes. Nobody answered, showed up, called me on the phone or even sent me an e-mail. That was very frustrating because it was a huge waste of time (transfer + waiting time) which we could have spent better. What a pity!

Awesome awesome fun and good value. . Such a great fun way to spend an hour or so. Easy to find and our anticipation grew as we waited briefly in the main reception reading the walls which were adorned with past challengers notes. We loved the mental challenge of the game and were super driven to solve the room and keep our pride intact!!! Luckily we diffused the bomb in 53 mins and solved the remaining clues to get out of the room. Debriefing with the super friendly and approachable staff before and after was an added bonus. You must fit this in to your Prague experience!!! We will be doing it again in other cities for sure.
Intererestin experience. We tried the Ghost challange but didn't get to enjoy it in the fullest because of a prop malfunction. Cheating was also possible.

The Best real escape game in Prague. I've already tried lot of exitgames in Budapest. ANd now this weekend we went to the Prague, because we love the Czech beers very much. WE drunk a couple of beers and tested some (exactly) 3 different places from the real escape games. The winner was the TRAP game. I hotly recommend it for everybody.

Great fun, very entertaining. My wife and I, together with a couple of our friends tried the game on our last day in Prague, just before heading back home. It was a great way to end a great trip in a wonderful city
The best. That was the best attraction that I had in Prague. I had soooo much fun with my friends that now I'm glad that they are running 2 more rooms with great adventure!

AMAZING. We went there for something different and definitely we found it.The all thing was so clever and so brilliant but unfortunately we couldnt escape even thought we had the help of the stuff(very friendly).It should be at your holidays plan!!

Greateat fun in a long time. We were invited by a friend to go there. Decided on the spot to repeat the experience and do the other two rooms as well.Bomb is the most straightforward and we even tied for the record (yay team WhiteRabbit)! Secret agent confuses the hell out of you, and the Tomb has the coolest riddles of them all.Would definitely recommend and will look out for TRAPs in other cities!
Nice experience. This is thing you should do in Prague! Something new and nice to have fun! You really need to think there to exit the room:)
Great fun. We did the bombgame. Very nicely made and very friendly guy the reception. Unfortunately we did just did not make it within the hour. But great concept great fun. Tim and sofie
Perfect!. We went first time for this type of game and we loved it! Great way to spend spare hour and have FUN! Great for couples to work as a team! :)

Absolutely Amazing!!. Couldn't be happier with having discovered this type of entertainment! Very much worth the price! And cheapest you'll come across when comparing it to others in Prague and around Europe!
Amazing. This is quite simply the best thing to do in Prague and probably the world. I loved it so much I went to 2 of their rooms 2 days in a row. I cannot recommend Trap enough.

Great teambuilding activity, perfect for couples!. My boyfriend and I went to TRAP- Secret Agent game on our anniversary not knowing what to expect and left absolutely excited and charged with adrenalin. We are definitely going to visit other locations in Prague. The armosphere, decor and the staff (we had a pleasure of meeting Silvia) were truly great. We definitely recommend it!

Spy Room. Was a little hard to find from Wenceslas Sq. so recommend you get the address off the email confirmation they send you and google map it from your location.Me and my girlfriend did it and it was so much fun, best thing we did in Prague, joint top with the shooting tour. Exercises your lateral-thinking and logic. Recommended group size 3 or 4.The team there are really helpful and have perfect English, really great atmosphere and if you look lost like we did once or twice they will ring a phone in the room you're locked in and talk you through some clues.Don't want to give too much away and spoil it - Just do it.

Being trapped is fun!. Secret Agent Game was fun. I recommend it to groups or families to try teamwork, focus and patience.What is it about? You need to find a connection in secret files at agents office...check out the web page.

Lots of fun !. I have tried Trap twice already. Once with my friends and once with my family when they visited Prague.Its a really great experience when you want to do something that isnt sightseeing or walking around.At first its a bit tricky but once you get the hang of it its great fun and something really different.The staff was also really nice and helpful, since they gave us some hints while we were in the room.Highly recommended !!

Fun!!. This was a fun thing to do with 3 people. We were able to complete the mission with only a few hints, but it was a little challenging too! The staff was super friendly and helpful. We were very pleased with the experience.

Great Fun!. Well worth doing if you fancy doing something a bit off the beaten tourist track. I think most of the reviews cover it. It's much easier than others suggest to find on a slightly unassuming side street. Just search the road name in Google maps and it'll show you exactly. We didn't do so well but boy did we have fun trying and an hour is just long enough. There's a lot of decoys in the room so you have to get moving fairly swiftly!

Tomb room. First time for us doing this experience. It was only myself and my husband so we didn't crack the time, we were 17 minutes over. Very entertaining and makes you think. Very enjoyable and we will do it again, either there or elsewhere

Fun and couple-friendly. Good ambience, challenging difficulty but the staff is friendly and helpful. I went with my girlfriend and we both enjoyed the experience, since the coop aspect of the game lead us to know and trust each other better! We strongly recommend it for all those who seek something original and fun to do in Prague!

We love TRAP. Having already completed Trap in Budapest,( I say completed, we didn't get out) we had to have an attempt at the one in Prague,We had such a good time, there was only two of us and we managed to escape with seconds to spare, yay!!Such a good way to spend an hour, just remember, think outside the box and most things are there for a reason!!

Amazing for escape game lovers. We planned it 1,5 month before our trip in Praque and it was amazing. If you like escape games, time pressure, competitions, want to have break for your brain, be more curious , solve some clues and puzzles this place will be perfect for you! We love it and I was struggling to not book more of games:)

Off the Beaten Path. As a tourist, this was a great, non-typical attraction. My husband and I played their tomb game and had a great time! The staff is very friendly and seems genuinely interested in the success of the game. We stayed at the Joseph and this game was only a 15 minute walk.

ADDICTED. Never played escape games in real life outside of the iPhone apps. Now I'm ADDICTED! My husband and I are 4 for 4 and want to keep going. We've come back to NY to see if they have some and it seems they do. We fell in LOVE with your escape room and if we're ever back in the area, we will DEFINITELY revisit! I don't know what it feels like to lose the game, but I can tell ya that beating it is faaaaantastic!

Very fun! Great idea! . My fiancée and I visited this trap escape game on the first night we arrived in Prague. We played escape games multiple times in Canada as well as Hong Kong but never in Europe. The atmosphere was really nice as it coincided with the Czech culture and made use of the historic buildings. They give you an hour to escape the room. there is a telephone inside the room that you can use to call for clues or help. I don't want to spoil it but the game was really fun we got out in 50 minutes with two people and we both really enjoyed it. we paid 1000 CZK which is the equivalent of $50 CAD. it's a bit expensive but I would say that it was worth it, they also have other rooms around Prague that you can play. we didn't have the chance to but I'm sure they would have been fun as well.

Such an ingenious idea - lots of fun....harder than competitors!. We were in Praue for a week and had book a competitors attraction - it was so much fun we scoured for another chance to escape and found TRAP within 3 minutes of our hotel! (Marriott Old Town)...We were able to get a 9am appt for the next day (at 10pm at night!) and were greeted promptly. What a great time! Escape from the agents apartment before he gets back! This was defintely MUCH harder than the competitors room but just as fun. We must admit, needed a few clues but our family of 3 escaped in 59 minutes...Well worth an hour of your time while in Prague!

Almost. Very fun experience, if you don't think this is for you, try being out of your comfort zone, it's very fun and once you get into it, its very enjoyable. We were just a few seconds away from being blown up.

Amazing time in the game!. There is nothing better to do in your life than to travel!And play escape room games all over the world! This one is one of my favourites so far!If you want to have fun and play a real mind game in Prague, this is the place for you :)

So good we did both games in 24hours!. Without giving too much away, it is an amazing concept with twists, head scratchers and suspense throughout. The game is very cleverly thought out and the games clues and tasks are regularly changed to keep the mystery. We did the Russian spy and the 'bomb' game and completed both! Really hope this comes to the UK soon....

Try this. Our daughter found this atraction and we went there an afternoon. We had never this things before, and it was fun. Actually we enjoyed it so much, that we went back two times and tried to escape from the others two room they had.

So enjoyable!!!. My boyfriend and I found this to be such a fun experience! The receptionist was very friendly and gave clear instructions(and helped us out with clues too). This really got our adrenaline going and I'm definitely going to advise any friends to go here when they visit prague. I couldn't recommend this more!

Don't do this drunk. Ok so we had done MindMaze earlier in the day and booked the last session of the day here. We had the Bomb Room. We really shouldn't have been drinking and trying to escape a room. Anyhow the escape was not successful but the Bomb Room was pretty good. It was not as authentic as Mind Maze but it was pretty cool.Make sure you look at the address as there are 2 Trap in prague and we of course went to the wrong one first. Drunkards!!!!

Trap Prague. Stumbled on to this and ended up having the most fantastic hour piecing the clues together to escape from the Secret Agent challenge in an hour. It sounds like a lot of time but it's not! Can't give away the clues but the ingenuity of them and the whole concept - especially in a former Eastern bloc capital city - was very clever indeed. Needs team work - I will say that!! - and no ideas about the clues are too daft - often the more ridiculous is the more real! Well worth a visit. Recommended for its difference!

Give your brain a workout!. Took us a while to get into it but the girl on the desk was really helpful. Got out just in time and thoroughly enjoyed the experience, even though it was challenging at times!
Great fun. We were a large party of 4 adults and 3 teens. Great fun had by all. we did take a little longer than the 60 mins but this was not a problem. I would defiantly recommend this activity.
Awesome. The best thing to do whilst in Prague, only an hour and £30. Excellent fun and something a bit different, this is a MUST
go go go. highly recommended! you won't regret it. know that it takes approximately an hour, but it goes by without you even notice.

Brilliant. After doing Trap in Budapest we had to give this a go, only to find it was the same room as Budapest, still took us best part of the hour to escape- had 20 seconds to spare. Great fun. They gave us a card that allowed 150CK off at their other location which we did the following day, escaped with 11 mins to spare- again great fun
Fun experience. The host was definitely quirky and we had a great time solving the puzzles. Such a fun way to spend an hour working as a team and using your brain!

TRAP!. This is the most coolest thing in Prague! The first thing you need to know is that you need a reservation to go there. But its totally worth it! Me and my bf really liked it, its fun and little bit stressful at the same time!
Fabulous City. Beautiful city with all of the main attractions within walking distance. Very good value too, especially if you go slightly further away from the Old Town Squsre.

Do it!!. My friends and I took a girl's trip to Prague and decided to try TRAP Prague after reading some good reviews of it on Trip Advisor. We had not ever heard about something like this until we read the reviews. I am so glad that we decided to try something like this. It is extremely fun yet challenging. We made our reservations the day before our trip for the Secret Agent room. While the game is meant for 2-5 people we had 6 people in our group, but it still worked out well. I am glad that the hostess still allowed our group to play. The object of the game is to try to figure out how to escape the room within 60 minutes. There is no fear factor so don't be worried about being scared or having to do something you are afraid to do. Its totally safe and fun. If you get stuck (which we did several times) the hostess can give you hints as to what you need to be doing. If you do not complete the mission within 60 minutes you can still take more time to finish it. When planning your Prague trip keep in mind that its a 15 minute introduction prior to the game (you find out your mission), at least 60 minutes inside, and probably another 15 after the game talking to the hostess and laughing about the experience. Give yourself about 2 hours for the TRAP.I think this is a great experience for adults and children alike. I plan on taking my two children (ages 9 and 7) to one of these in the future. They will have a great time helping us out. If you have a younger child it can still be fun for them as well. Even if you have a baby, I do not think that the baby will cause any problems during the game. I would still tell you not to pass up this opportunity. Our hostess, Lanka (I believe that is how you spell her name) was absolutely great! She was very sweet and friendly. Such a great hostess and two thumbs up to the owner for hiring such a fabulous person.
Excellent fun. Never done anything like this beforehand loved it. Had to ring for help but the chap made me think for it.

Enjoyable experience, challenging!. My friend booked this for us on our last day in Prague. None of us knew what to expect and we were a bit put off when we turned up to see an apartment style front door, with only a buzzer for 'TRAP'. Once inside however, we were put at ease by the member of staff who made us feel welcome. As this was the first time any of us had tried an activity like this, it took us a wee bit longer to get the general idea, but once we got going, it was very enjoyable. I would definitely recommend doing this if you like puzzles/ trying something different. I think it's perhaps a bit too hard for young children, but for older kids/ teenagers it would be quite fun. I would definitely try another game if i'm in Prague again.

Challenging & great fun!. Me & my husband did the secrets agents trap & had a great time trying to figure out all the clues! Very easy to book online & we had a walk by the day before so we knew where it was so found it easy to find! The man working there was a great help & explained everything really well, the unfortunate thing for us is we were really rubbish & died in there haha!! But u have to do this if your in Prague, a great activity for a good price- an hour well spent!!

So much fun!. We already booked the TRAP Tomb room before coming to Prague and liked it so much that decided to also try the Bomb room (and one of the rooms from Mindmaze)! I love puzzles and these exit games were highlights of our stay in Prague. This was the first time we tried this kind of thing and got hooked right away :) We played all the rooms as a team of two.Tomb room was our favourite from the three rooms we played. Mindmaze maybe had better decorations in their room, but we liked the TRAP puzzles little bit more. Both companies were very nice and all the rooms were different!

Such a disappointment!. My wife and i visited ""Trap prague" two days after going to mindmaze because we enjoyed it so much.Firstly, we got ,on time, to the adress which was given to us on the confirmation E-mail just to fing out that they have two different branches and we need to go to the other one.when we finally got there (1 km) the girl at the front desk was so rude and impatient (unfortunatly i can't remmeber her name).We got inside the "tomb room"- and that's when the reall disappointment hit us.It was a small room with only two different items (i don't want to ruin the "surprise" for those of you that will decide to go anyway).The door was so thin that you can hear EVERYTHING occurs outside!!! somthing that really gets you out of focus! the girl at the front desk kept talking out loud (very very loud) with a french group that just finished one of the other rooms and didn't paid any attention to us!the hints are amaturly made (some of them are notes written in a sloppy illegible hand write).After 15 AGONIZING minutes we asked her to open the door and let us out.When we got out the girl didn't even asked us what's the metter and why we decided to stop at the midle, she just said that in this kind of cases we need to pay for half of the time (500 Czech corunas= 18 euros) ad kept tlking to the french team.I was shocked by her attitude but didn't had the strangte to deal with her. It was such a disapointment because the present themself as a proffesional company when infact they are nothing but a bunch of amatures.This was D worst experience we had in prague!

Lots of fun!. 5 of us did this today and had a great time! We're got out in 52 minutes, but did need some additional clues from Andrew(?) the "guide". Kids (ages 16 and 12) had fun too. Was sorry to see it end. Highly recommend. Can be done with 2, but would be tough.

A lot of fun!. We found it quite difficult to find the venue, but once inside it was a lot of fun. Our friend (who hadn't done anything like this before) found it particularly enjoyable. Helpful tip - it's worth taking the correct money as when we went the guy didn't have any change and we ended up paying 1500czk.
Go there.. The more people, the more fun. Will come back to explore other themes (this time I went for the soviet one)

Trap prague. If you visit prague this is a must my partner and I went not really sure what to expect but the explanations of the game where made very clear by the guide. We had so much fun looking for the clues to escape the room . When we are next in prague we will definitely play another room as the company have two other rooms to try. So much fun thank you
Awesome game! . We highly recommend the Trap game! Our hostess Tereza was very friendly and explained everything before we started. Hour well spent! :)
It was fun!. Nice idea for team building. We were a team of 4 and had a great time. The staff is willing to explain everything, friendly and oh, most importantly... We made a record! :D
Perfect experience. This game is perfect! The atmosphere and concept is great! You have to try it! We did the 3rd best time ever (Tomb game). Great price and lot of fun!!!
Funny. Really funny and original rule play. It was my first time but the staff was really clear to explain us this kind of play and rules. I suggest to live this experience if you are in Prague.
Brilliant fun. What a fantastic concept. We thoroughly enjoyed our hour trying to solve the clues. Highly recommended.

Challenging!. Alright, cards on the table. Our group considered ourselves pretty smart. We needed 2 hints and finished at 57:50, cutting it very close to the hour time limit. I was surprised by how challenging it was and want to do another one to try to beat our time. Definitely a fun experience with a group! We did the "KGB" room and tore the room apart trying to get out. We're still sorry about that. Be sure to leave a tip if you do.Apparently a lot of people don't finish within the hour, if you THINK you're smart enough, give it a shot!

Just OK, great rainy day diversion. These "trap" type puzzle places are all the vogue in europe and this one is well executed and suitably challenging. The "backstory" sets up the "escape" well and the puzzles are quite good and in keeping with Soviet/Communist ERA spying. My only complaint was that the attendant spoke waaaaaay too long at the front and tore into the time available. As it was only my wife and I the time to solve got quite close to the next booked group's arrival time. The attendant called at least 8 times (worried abut the next group) which inevitably was quite distracting and made me just want to leave. If you have 4 (or more folks) the puzzle could be more easily solved, but as it was just my wife and I, the calls and monolog of the attendant really detracted from an otherwise "pretty cool" experience. #1 thing in Prague ? no! worth doing? on a rainy day, yes. Prague has so much more to offer, this was "just ok"

What a great concept. We went as a group to do this activity based on other trip adviser reviews. They were right, this is great fun. Suitable for all ages. We had two 10 year olds with us who could actively participate. (The Tomb Room). We have since tried their competitor and this is definitely better for larger groups. More space and also involves more than one room in the puzzle solving. Great concept and would do it again.

Fun and Games. This is a great way to spend a few hours. The puzzles were challenging and the staff were helpful with clues. I had a great time but I must recommend that you book as a group. I arrived solo and assumed there would be a group I could join. Would have been a much better experience for me with a group and I would recommend it if you would like to try this.

So much unexpected fun!. First of all big thanks to Tripadvisor for having this place so high up in the chart that obliged us to check it out! From then on it was easy booking via internet, easy to follow instructions to get there, Extremely welcoming and cool staff (thanks Lenka) and an hour of fun and excitement.It was awesome!Highly recommended.

AMAZING, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!. Trap is definitely THE attraction to do in Prague. It was a first time experience for my friends and I, and we loved it! Clean place, great staff, immersive atmosphere! Try it!
Great game. I was there with my family aged 19-55 and we all had great fun. We were able to escape the room in 59 minutes so all the time our mind was working and team work helped us to win the game.

Super fun group activity!. Our group of six conquered the Tomb puzzle game with little assistance and with 15 minutes to spare. The puzzles and riddles were great fun and it required teamwork and a lot of trial and error to solve the puzzle. It was a lot of fun and although a bit pricey, one of the best activities during our two week vacation in Europe!

A great activity. Went with two other friends, and we did the bomb room. We didn't m me it out in time, but the staff were great. So ready to give us gentle hints and reminders if we wanted. We had so much fun. If you're in Prague and looking for a fun way to spend an hour, definitely go do this.

Great minds game and adventure. The game is very well designed and it gives an extraordinary experience.Me and my girlfriend had a great time there, the host was very kind and nice, the game was fun and the price was fair.Highly recommended.
Awesome!. This was our third experience at TRAP as we have been making our way through Europe and it did not disappoint. We had heaps of fun and I would go back and do other rooms in a heartbeat!

Our second escape game experience in Prague and it was great!. We were inspired by a visit to a competitor that we had booked on Saturday, as we enjoyed it so much we booked this last minute on the Sunday we were in Prague - as we thought we were 'experienced' enough we went for the hardest room - great fun and really got us thinking. We were a couple and escaped in 54 minutes! Thoroughly recommend!
Fun in Prague. They have now 3 rooms I believe, and it is a lot of fun. On a rainy day in Prague this is the most fun you can have.
Quite awesome for a hour of fun. We had a great time solving mathematical riddles in the "Temple" room. A bit easy as it was done in 45 minutes, but very fun. Nice staff too.

Trap junkies. We visited this venue in all 2 places and managed to finish all 3 rooms.The rooms are well equipped and the puzzles are not too hard, but not easy at all. The staff is very friendly and venues are close to the city center, making them very easy to be reached using public transportation.By far the most intriguing and adventurous was the Tomb Room, but the others are not much behind.Plus the fun you can have in less than hour is unexpected :)If you want to train your brain and get pumped up with adrenaline, just try them!

Trapped. Can't give too much away but this was a great shared experience for the whole family ranging from 11 to 49 years old. We're all so chuffed and relieved to have made it out with 15 seconds to spare. Novel idea which was good fun.

So much fun!!! . We only heard of this from trip advisor when reading 'what to do in Prague' and so glad we did! This escape game exceeded all expectations and was so much fun!! My partner and I made it out with 2 mins to spare and would recommend anyone to play!
Trap Prague. So much fun! I really liked it. Friendly staff. Good place in the center of Prague (Senovazna ulice).

A fun and challenging evening. Was something different. 5 of us went ranging in age from 14 to 45. We all enjoyed solving the puzzles and challenges and working together as a team. Would definitely recommend it to others.
Excellent. If you want to be challenged (and in my case, humbled), I recommend this highly! Solve number puzzles, think laterally and word quizzes with your friends and family!

We did it twice on our three day trip!. This was our first visit to an escape room and we loved it so much we booked a second room for the day we were leaving. Our first room was the spy room, and the gentleman working that night was incredibly friendly and helpful. Even though it was his first day, he did a wonderful job. We then did the bomb room and even though we got confused about our booking time and arrived late, the woman was very kind and understanding. Had a wonderful time in both rooms and would highly recommend. A little bit expensive but worth it in our opinion.

So much fun!. We had such a fun hour doing this! Despite being a little hard to find, the woman on the desk phoned me and came and found us, she was such a great help even though we were late. If we were in Prague for longer we would've tried out on of the other rooms. Had a great time and finished in 36 minutes!

Time is ticking.... I took the whole family, as they all enjoy puzzles and games, and we really had a good time. The staff is ready to provide as much or as little help as is needed and if you let your imagination run wild, you will have a great time, guaranteed. My two elementary-school-aged kids also enjoyed themselves.
Great family outing. Had a blast, loved the time pressure. Book well ahead as we were disappointed how busy it is. Great for all ages.

Really fun and awesome theme.. This was our first escape room game. At first we were a little lost, but the staff was super friendly and helpful. The scold war spy theme was a lot of fun and really got us into the game. We did it with two people and make it out with a bit of help. It was really cool that you get to sign the wall at the end. The price was really nice compared to others we ended up doing in other cities in Europe. Definitely worth the time and price. We were so stimulated after it was over we ended up staying out late drinking recounting the adventure.

Good fun!. We were a group of 5, so we tried the bomb room. It was fun getting our detective minds back on, we had to figure out how to get ourselves out of a room in 1 hour. The clues were fun and difficult enough, we got stuck at the final one. Overall a good entertainer!

Some exercise for your mind. Went with my husband at 9:00am and it was the coffee we needed! It requires of your concentration and open mind to find the puzzles but it's very well explained and it makes sense. Groups can be up to 5 persons if I'm not mistaken but take in consideration that everyone has different opinions and it can make it a bit more stressful. After we finished we were full of energy and ready to start the day, I can definitely recommend you to give it a try!
nice time!. we had a wonderful time with my friends! Lenka, our host was wonderful with a very good sense of humor!

Fun but could be better!. We went to the "dismantle the communist bomb" trap on the opening day, this has to be said.It was predictable that some unexpected stuff could happen, so it did.It's just 2 rooms (other traps have 4 I think) and we arranged to pass to the second one by mistake. When we made it to the second room by the rules the staff guy was still preparing it! It would have been funnier if he was disguised as a communist planting a bomb.See, that's what it lacked, credibility!We didn't feel like we had something important to do or a bomb would explode, we were just messing around with some random clues.So in my opinion that can be easily changed with some background music, bomb related puzzles and so on...But still, it was the first day, we were the second group to ever enter and it was fun!
A great timekiller. This was very fun and you had to use your logic. One hour goes very fast! I would definitely recommend it to everyone.

Mind-blowing!!. By accident I found this activity on Tripadvisor and we decided to book this during our city trip.We booked the Tomb room that was just open for a week (one other room was already open for half a year). We paid 43euros (you pay per room, not per person.)We were warmly welcomed by friendly Adele who instructed us.  We were locked into a room and had to find clues and solve puzzles to find the next tip or hint. With some small hints via the walkie talkie we eventually managed to get out in 58 minutes! It was fun to write on the wall afterwards.It was great fun! You really need to work together to solve it. It is incredible how this all has been madeand set up! Definitely one of our Prague highlights if it isn't the most fun thing we did!I highly recommend this to everyone, if we would visit Prague again we will definitely one of the other two rooms!

Bomb room. Was so good... when first in the room it was difficult to work out how to get started but once you got the hang of it, it was good. We didnt finish in time but was good once we started to work out clues.

Best escape room we have been to. Awesome owners. My wife and I visited Trap and had a blast. While challenging for a group of 2, the owner explained everything very well before hand and gave us hints as needed. I would definitely recommend Trap for those who want a challenge and enjoy escape room games. Thanks again to the owners and third amazing establishment.
Great escape game in Prague. The guys here have done such a great job. We had an amazing time playing this. If you like excape games don't miss it!
Trapped. We brought our business partners from Czech to this fun activity. We enjoyed it so much and recommend it highly!Some parts were difficult, we struggled a little on the first task.

A fun challenge with friends. We'll be back. . There's nothing like this where we're from in England so we were really keen to give this a go during our stay in Prague. We decided to go for the 'tomb' room.We didn't really know what to expect or how many puzzles there'd be and even with 3 of us we had to ask for help via the walkie talkie Monika the host gave us. Once out of the first room we quickly realised we'd spent a bit too long deliberating in the first chamber, so if you're going - and you should if you're into puzzles - don't spend too long or you'll run out of time. You'll enjoy it more if you ask for hints and get the whole thing done. Afterwards Monika chatted to us, took our photo and you can write your names on the wall.Highly recommend, and we're already booked to do the other scenarios.

So much fun!. So nice to do something different- it's unlike anything I've done before. It was the perfect level of difficulty- challenging but not impossible and the rooms were really authentic with a good variety of puzzles! Would recommend to anybody who wants to try something a bit different and enjoys a challenge, for a good price too :) Although it's aimed at tourists, it doesn't feel touristy which is definitely a nice change! And the girl who welcomed us in, Pavlina, was so lovely! We went as a couple but it's good for small groups, and you get the place to yourself. Would go again to something similar!

Hard To Find - But Worth It. It would appear that there are 2 sites for this 'Escape' game (both the same company). My wife and I booked the one in Senovazna (next to the Koala pub - look for a brown door and press the 'Trap' buzzer). Staff were really friendly and helpful and the game was great fun although can't say too much for fear of giving it away. If you have an hour and want a fun experience definitely worth a go.

Bomb room. I did this with a family of four including two kids aged 11 and 8 (which is probably a bit young, although they enjoyed the experience).We didn't quite manage to finish it - despite some hints and some extra time - but had a blast trying. This is a really fun and different way to spend an hour or so in Prague. It won't be my last time.

Great experience!. We played the 'bombroom' game and it was amazing! It was the first time we played a game like this and it was really exciting! You get 60 minutes to disable a bomb and than you also have to escape the room. Teamwork is nessicary to finish the game! The place was easy to find and you get a photo as souvenir afterwards! We really recommend to play this game! :) Price is a bit high (1000Kc for two persons) but definitely worth it!

It is awesome. Trap Game is one of the best attraction of prague which is very close to old town square.I highly recommend it to everybody, me and my girlfriend finished it more than 1 hour with too much help,Also the staff was so helpful so im very thankful to Anna about her smiling face and help in game.Well it was just awesome and if you want to enjoy a couple of hour in prague , just dont miss it

Couldn't get in!. We read the reviews and went early in the morning to try and book a space. No luck! Checked back to see if there was a cancellation but no dice. It was our last day in Prague so we missed it. A bit of advice.......book early to avoid disappointment.

Sensational experience!!!. This was our first "Escape the Room" game and we absolutely loved it. We won't say much about the experience because it would spoil the surprise. The host of the game - Tereza - was very engaging and helpful and made the experience complete. The game lasts a good hour (longer for some...) and you get a souvenir photo at the end. Although some reviews have said it can be hard to find it is only a short walk down Senovazna Street from the Powder Gate. Look for number 8 and head into a small internal courtyard surrounded by apartment buildings. Given its popularity it is best to book online in advance to secure a space.We cannot recommend this enough.

Something different. I visited Prague as part of an interrailing trip with some friends from college and we decided to visit TRAP. I'm glad we did, it was brilliant! We picked the bomb room (the most difficult) and between the 5 of us we finished with time to spare! I'd definitely recommend this if you are in a group of 3-5 and looking for something fun to do for an hour that's a change from the usual attractions of Prague!

Great fun. We thoroughly enjoyed this experience. Staff very pleasant and helpful. With the odd phone call to give us a hint, we made it out in 57 minutes. Great way to spend an hour and within easy walking distance of all of the main tourist areas. One word of warning- entrance is via a doorway which could easily be missed. Look out for the koala restaurant. It is on the same side next to it.

Great Fun. . My wife and I were in Prague for a few days and realised we were going to have a few hours of rain one day so we looked for things to occupy ourselves. TRAP came up as one the top attractions and we decided to book in. We got allocated the "Tomb Room" and on arriving was met by a young guy and girl who were courteous, spoke near perfect English and explained the concept of the game to us. It is brilliant and challenges people of different intelligence.. My wife is cleverer than me and even I felt I contributed!! Try this even if the sun is shining!! 5 stars!

A great way to spend an hour. Great fun. We visited Trap and MindMaze on consecutive days and although both get a very solid five, the consensus family view was that Trap just shaded it. It is a great way to spend an hour (53 minutes in our case) and requires concentration, lateral thinking and some common sense. Teamwork is essential so it is a great exercise/challenge on a family weekend but everyone can play a role. The old phones are there if you need a hint at any stage if only to suggest that the answer has been staring you in the face all along. Excellently thought through, good value, great fun.

Great fun. Wow we had great fun in this place during our stay in Prague this July - August. The staff was very friendly, the room decorations were good and the puzzles were interesting. Thank you for an hour well spent!

And now for something completely different.... I love games and puzzles but my boyfriend doesn't and we both enjoyed the game immensely. We were hemming and hawing ahead of time about whether we should do it at all since it isn't exactly a cultural activity and we didn't want to feel like we were "wasting Prague," but it was heaps of fun, so even if you only have two days in Prague, give it a go. It was just the boyfriend and I and we managed well, so don't let it stop you if you're only two people. My only advice is this: work fast, even if you think you're done with time to spare because you may not be.

Really good . So fun! Never experience anything like this before so it was really good! We only had 2 people but we think if there were more people it would be much more fun! A bit pricey but still fun!

It was amazing!. We were 6 girls and had a lot of fun. There were two different rooms with a lot of tricky puzzles. The staff was very friendly and also helpfully. ;-) We all will do this experience again! Maybe next time in another city...

different and awesome. the two of us (both 18yo girl travellers) booked this in advance to our travels and i'm so glad we did! On a rainy first day in prague, after a sleepless night on the nighttrain from croatia, this was the perfect distraction for an hour or so! Nice central position in town, and the whole game was so fun! I don't want to give anything away, but you really don't need to speak the english language or be mega clever, it's all about the problem solving game thing.Guarantee you'll spend the first 5 minutes being really careful with everything in the room, then get scared and trash the place ;) Have fun, it's worth the time and money :)

Now that was fun!. First words out of my son's mouth when I said we were going to write a review.... After totally messing up in Budapest and arriving a day late to the appointment I set for a similar "game", I rebooked TRAP in Prague and we had a blast. Very fun and the lady that runs it is a total sweetheart. The kids really enjoyed the evening and so did the adults. Fun for everyone was not a lie! It was nice to be able to do something a bit different and something we would all remember. There was no way we could have figured it out on our own, but we got close. In the end we had 3 minutes to spare but we did figure it out. So if you have an extra night in town and want to try something a bit unique, this would be it!

Well worth a visit - great fun!. A group of five of us did the Bomb Room, it was fantastic! The staff were absolutely lovely and very friendly, spoke excellent English. The game itself is frantic and challenging, very well designed and very detailed. An hour very well spent an would recommend it to everybody! Something a bit different to do on a city holiday!

Intense and exciting!. Trap is an absolute must for anyone in Prague. We were a group of 5 that did the Bomb puzzle, which was plugged as their most difficult. We managed to finish with only minutes to spare, which shows how challenging it is. Each one of us thoroughly enjoyed it and were still buzzing for a good while after!

Awesome family fun. We booked online and went the following day to do the tomb room. We are a family of 5 with children aged 15,13 and 9 and it was the best activity ever, according to the kids! We managed to get out in 40 minutes, so did really well, surprising ourselves. More importantly we had great fun, team work is needed, and we all got involved and did our bit. It was really great fun. The staff were great and you can phone them from the room for hints if you need to ( we managed without). It makes for a great activity to break up the sightseeeing and walking and everyone can get involved. If the other room ( bomb diffusing) hadn't have been booked up we would have had a go at that too, kids loved it. Great family activity.

Fabulous!. Having never done one of these type of games before we really didn't have a clue what we were going into... The first test seemed to be finding the venue, but all added to the quirkiness of this place. On arrival we were greeted by the staff who were very welcoming and polite. They explained everything that would happen and want we were to do and then it was into the room and on with it! It's difficult to say anything without giving the game away so please just go for it and get it booked. A great way to spend an hour and we even considered trying to book another one of the rooms immediately afterwards as we'd enjoyed it so much! Makes a change to do something different and this is the thing to do! Highly recommended. If only we could give it 6 stars! ******

Awesome experience!. We had an amazing time at TRAP and are excited to hear that they are opening up two more locations in Prague. It was challenging and gave us a pretty good brain workout. The atmosphere set up in the room (we did the Soviet one) was fantastic.

So much fun.. We had no idea what to expect out of this game but I think it is safe to say that it was amazing. We have a 13 year old and a 6 year old. Our 6 year old could not answer the riddles but we gave her some answers or clues to see if they worked. We tried to keep her involved as much as possible. Great game, I have no complaints.

great fun!. We had a group of five as a team who regularly play "doors and windows" kinds of games. What a great experience to be able to do is first-hand and work out the puzzles to gain the keys. Good challenges, great time. Highly recommend to anyone who is interested in using their brains on holiday...

Great TRAP. TRAP Prague just expanded and open their other traps today. We were the third team ever to play the Tomb here in Prague. I took my twin 10 year old boys with me and we had a great time, but I wouldn't take my younger kids as the games are too complicated for younger kids. To be honest it was a bit too complicated for my 10 year olds as well, as this is geared toward adults and teens. We still had a blast!If you have never done a game like this before you are really missing out. The staff was great, the games are challenging, and the overall experience is well worth the time and money. You leave feeling challenged and accomplished.You must book online, and make sure to use the address they send in the confirmation email. (There are 2 different locations) We had no trouble finding parking right in front. We went at night, so I'm not sure how the parking situation would be during the day.

So much Fun!. This taught us nothing about prague but was probably one of the best things we did there! Great staff, especially when begging for hints... and the game was hard but not impossible. Its pretty much essential that you go! - It's just slightly tricky to find so allow a little time to do so!

Nice mind work out!. Went with 3 of my friends whilst over in Prague for the weekend and had a great time playing TRAP. The puzzles were fun to work out and tricky at times, we needed a couple of clues. We managed to complete it bang on the hour, perhaps being hungover didn't help with the thinking so you should go in with a fresh head!Definitely worth going to if you're in Prague. Was easy to find and our host, Lenka, was nice and friendly.

Great family fun.. We did this as a family of four. It made a welcome change from the usual tourist activities, especially for our son. Staff were very friendly and helpful. A challenge, but we did it! You need to book ahead.

Unlucky, but fun. We had made a reservation, but when we got there the room wasn't ready, so the staff rushed too prepare it. Unfortunately they overlooked one crucial part, which resulted in confusion, and ruined the natural flow of events. Even though we missed some of the puzzles, it was really fun when the chain of events wasn't broken! The staff was really helpful when they realized their mistake, and helped us get back on track. It was probably just a rare mistake. So it was a good experience, and we can imagine it must be really fun when there aren't any disturbance to the game.

wow!. I went there on July 28 at midday with my husband and two teenage children after I read about Trap Prague in Tripadvisor, all the reviews were positive, and mine would be as well.One important tip is that you should stick to the address, which takes you to a building with an intercom that says Trap Prague...press the button and you will be admitted inside.Our experience in Trap Prague was so enjoyable we put our minds together to solve the puzzles to be able to get out..our children were way better than us though.Our hostess was such a sweet young lady, her name was Anna and she helped us when we were really stuck, she also took a pic of all of us at the end, and another pic of my daughter while she was drawing on the wall, which she kindly sent to us later on.We really enjoyed this , but I think they should reconsider the time given, as 60 minutes is not enough time to solve everything.

So much fun!. This was such an exciting time! Me and my girlfriend loved it! It was only 2 of us but we worked great as a team and made it out in 60min and 15sec. The girl who worked there was so nice too us that it just made our experience so much better! I am writing this 2 weeks after we did this and I still smile when i think about our time doing this!The experience and memories are priceless so i didn't think it was too expensive.
TRAPP forces you to work together.. I thought it was a change from old history into something unique that you can do with a group of people.

Great way to cooperate with your husband!. This was right up our alley but the DH didn't have the same sense of urgency I felt! It was harder than I thought it would be but so satisfying to finish. I now heard there are places in NYC...can't wait to take the work colleagues.

Exciting fun. This was our first time experiencing a event like Trap, did it as a couple. The theme was great and the scene suited the story amazingly. As first-timers we noticed that sometimes we did find some clues but over-thought them - so freely try anything you come up with, you don't need any knowledge that is outside the room! Trap is a great way to spend time and test yourself. Absolutely recommending!
go with your friends. a m a z i n g a d v e n t u r e and a m a z i n g g a m e!!!:) Price is high but still it is nice to visit.
Fun if you like challenging puzzles. Went with family, they are more in to puzzles. Well set up. Quite challenging. Friendly staff. Reasonable value for the length of entertainment.

I Was Beaten!. What a fantastic way to spend an hour or so. My 23yr old son and I did it together and found it was a great way to connect. My excuse is that i was a bit jet lagged and so missed a couple of key clues that prevented us from completing things on time but it was still a lot of fun and we will definitely do it again when we have the opportunity.

Nice adventure. We were at Prague trap with my wife and a couple we know. This was very nice change for the usual travel routine. Price was a bit high but service was very friendly. Everything worked out very well.

Awesome, unique activity for small groups!. As a fan of point-and-click adventure games, this was probably the best part of my visit to Prague.During an hour, I got to solve puzzles with my friend and use our imagination and skills to navigate through the clues the team had put together.It's also nice that the clues were practically language-agnostic, so anyone could go through this and enjoy it!
Nice people, great puzzles😉. Fun for the whole family! We were six people from 12 to 41 years old and all of us enjoyed it and felt that we solved something.

Unique, Fun Hour in Prague!. I read about Trap Prague on Trip Advisor while researching ideas for our time in Prague before our tour with Adventures by Disney began. We reserved a 9am time for our family of four (myself, husband, 15 year old daughter and 11 year old son.) Trap was a 5 minute walk from our hotel. We had a bit of trouble finding the location so give yourselves a few extra minutes to locate it. It is in the courtyard at #8 Senovazna but we did not see it listed on the directory. We joked that this was part of the puzzle. The host welcomed us and explained the process of being locked in to the Communist Apartment for one hour. We had so much fun and excitement searching for clues and trying to solve the puzzles. The host will occasionally call to provide a clue, and you can call her as well. Each of us contributed to solving the puzzles in some way. I would not recommend this for families with children younger than 11 but my 11 year old loved it so much he wanted to try some of the other similar venues in Prague. Thank you for this unique experience!
FUN, FUN, FUN!!!. An excellent experience! Enjoyed very much! We entered the atmosphere and the time flies. Highly recommended!

Brilliant Game!. We escaped with 15 seconds to spare. The host was very friendly and made us feel very comfortable. We got stuck a few times and she helped us without giving too much away. Difficult for a couple but is a lot of fun. Definitely worth giving it a go if you are in town.

Most fun ever!. Went here tonight with my boyfriend, it was possibly the highlight of my trip, I had that much fun. It gets intense under time pressure and suspenseful music, but there are always hints available if you get stuck. I would highly recommend to anyone and everyone! Had a fantastic time!

A must do. It was an amazing experience and a fantastic exit game. The clues were tricky, the more the people, the more ideas would be there. The best thing is that its open till late in the evening and one can do it after all the museums and galleries are shut for the day. If you are in Prague, try experiencing it. The hostess was very helpful and accommodating.

Awesome experience. Me and my girlfriend tried this alone and it took us 75 minutes WAY to long. It was nice that they did not rush us and let us finish on our own (with a lot of help). The host was very nice and helpful. We tried the Communist one (they are planning of having more soon according the host). Recommend going in a group of 3 or more to make it less frustrating. Go if you plan on going to Prague

Great exit game!. We visited TRAP with 3 friends and it was just perfect brain training and a lot of fun. Cooperation within the group is crucial, however, the hostess gave us few hints when we were stuck and we managed to get out in time. Exciting experience worth recommending!
TRAP rules!. Got puzzled sometimes, but Anja was more than helpful when we got stuck! She was totally awesome. A MUST when visiting Prague - unique experience.

Loads of fun!! Made our stay in Prague memorable!. TRAP was the perfect end to a memorable day in Prague. There were four of us and everyone enjoyed the challenges and the excitement of finding a clue. Our hostess spoke English and was delightful! She gave us a few gentle hints without giving anything totally away. We would recommend this to anyone looking for something to make your trip memorable!!!
Excellent adventure. Great thinking games..i wish there were more rooms with more riddles.The woman was really nice and the games were good

As advertised. Visited TRAP after seeing it on Trip Advisor and it didn't disappoint. It is as described, with you being locked in a room and having to puzzle your way out. There were only 2 of us and I would suggest that if you go you need a few more to add to the atmosphere.The young lady we saw, was extremely nice, very helpful, and didn't laugh at us poor pitiful folk as we struggled to escape..Which we failed to doOverall a GOOD experience

TRAP has trapped our imaginations forever!. After a week in Prague walking endlessly through the beautiful city and nearby Konratice forest, it was a relief to have an activity that was contained in a small apartment. Having no expectations and no idea on what the puzzles could entail, my husband and 2 children (aged 15 and 11) dove wholeheartedly into clue finding. When we were stalled, we were able to get some hints from Klara, our guide, who spoke excellent English, and was perceptive enough to "suggest" hints when we were close, but also perceptive enough to blurt out a hint with directives when we were completely lost. All in all, we finished the activity (going over 7 minutes), but Klara was sweet enough to emphatically congratulate the kids on finishing in time. When our 11 yr. old pointed out that we went over in our time, she sweetly claimed that we must've finished in time if we made it out alive! It was a fantastic activity, full of creativity and intrigue. The clue finding was not so impossible that our kids were able to figure out many of them. A MUST DO IT!!! A quick word on finding the place: stay true to the address and find the building. Look for the business listing on the wall with the doorbells. The guide was prompt when we pressed the bell, so don't worry. The building has a central outdoor patio leading into other business entrances and there is also a staircase leading into the second story. TRAP is one of the doors on that main floor, don't go up the stairs. Just trying to find it was the start of the intrigue.
Great Fun. Enjoyed not only the game but our hottest who was a great help and friendly! Would do a different puzzle again, easily.

Great fun!. We did this as a group of 5. The time flew and it was such a clever challenge. The staff were lovely and gave us just the right amount of help. Would highly recommend as something a bit different and fun.
An interesting challenge. The expectations were many and it was an amazing experience.The time flies. It's fun to do that with friends and be amazed with them and our own ideas.

SO GREAT!!!. My daughter and I had so much fun at TRAP! In the beginning we were having a difficult time, but got into the groove and finally escaped! The girl who met us and guided us through the experience was fantastic! This is a "must do" while in Prague.
