Very weird but satisfying! . Really enjoyable and good fun to do with a group of friends. The hour passed really quickly and it defiantly makes you think a lot!
Fantastic Few. It was excellent when being their ...we felt amazed to see the plave thanks to friends in prague for suggesting this place.

Wild Hour of Fun. My family and I were in Prague and we saw the high reviews for Trap Prague on Trip Advisor so gave it a try. This is a bargain for the price. My wife and I and our two Daughters are not easily amused. This had us guessing and scrambling for an hour before we escaped with four minutes to spare. I won't go into the specifics about the spy game but it takes a clear mind so watch the pregame drinking. My Daughters essentially saved the team with their insights and quick action. You need a team of four players to maximize your chances of being successful. Don't be afraid to call for help or you will never get out. I'm not sure how people think of this stuff but it sure was fun.

Love me a trap room. We had done 1 trap room previously to this experience. So we had some idea what were getting ourselves into. This room was very fun for the 2 of us and we solved it in time (with a little help). The receptionist was very nice. Even more so after them having double booked us and having to come back the next day. All in all this was our favorite thing we did while in Prague. We have been telling all our friends to go when they are in town.

excellent!. Fun fun fun! Great puzzles that are at a really good level - very stimulating, not too obvious and yet not intimidating at all, brilliantly clever. Staff were great, relaxed atmosphere. Can't wait to visit another location in Berlin.

Brilliant. Brilliant if you enjoy puzzle solving. It was like being a real life Sherlock Holmes. The puzzle was difficult but help is available through the telephone and the clues seem obvious and you kick yourself for missing them when helped. The woman working there was really friendly and made us feel at ease as it can be a little daunting at first. All in all I would definitely recommend it.

Absolutely Brilliant. Can't say enough positive things about this game!! It is just so much fun. The staff were very cool and very friendly and the game itself is great. A real challenge and lot trickier than we ever expected. The hour goes quickly!!Out of all the things that we did in Prague this was hands down our favourite!!

Hour (or more) of fun!. Fantastic thing to do in Prague. Wasn't too sure what to expect but so glad that me and my girlfriend decided to do it. Would recommend to anyone who needs something to do or likes solving puzzles. It can be frustrating but it's worth it to escape in the end!

Very fun.. Wife and I did the 9am escape and had a great time. The place is a little hard to find but definitely memorable. We just barely made it through in the one hour. They will provide hints if they see you getting stuck. There were 2 of us so more might be even more fun.

DO IT!!!. It was THE BEST THING I did in prague.Me and my boyfriend did it and it was ever so much fun.I was completely absorbed in the story and what I had to do.I would do it again and again and again.There is a phone if you get stuck which we used alot!You have to be buzzed into the building and its not very noticeable but it is exactly where it says it is on the map.

Fun experience. Good break from the normal cathedral viewing...especially for our 13 year old. Challenging, but not overly difficult (with a few hints along the way too). Would definitely recommend it.

Brilliant . Truly brilliant experience! We did it as a couple, which was hard but we managed it eventually! Can't say too much without giving anything away, so just go and try it for yourself, you won't be disappointed!

I want more!. This is something I knew my husband would love so I agreed to it. I'm usually shy and a little apprehensive of these sort of things. Thought I'd get claustrophobic and all. But no. This was FUN! It wasn't scary at all and the staff was there for you the whole time. The clues were tricky but solvable and you kept wanting more. Sure it was 1000czk, a little expensive some would say, but totally worth it. I would go again in a heartbeat. Thank you Trap and Anya!

Great experience!. The puzzles are fantastic and challenging to say the least. The fact that you think you are done and get hit with a curve ball made it even more of an exciting game. What a pleasurable experience. I cannot wait to try others. Definitely worth it!

You don't know what to expect, and you can't really do it again, but it's undoubtedly the best attraction in Prague. Great for the creative mind and the problem solver who enjoys fun mind games. A fantastic thing to do when in Prague and would thoroughly recommend to anyone. Anyone can do this if they put their mind to this. Friendly honest staff with many stories to tell and an overall amazing experience. Thank you TRAP!!

Mass concensus...best activity in Prague. Something completely different as well as completely entertaining. Fun to see everyone working together to solve the clues...and thanks for the very pleasant staff.

Great experience!. It was definitely one of my favourite activities which you can do in Prague!! It was fun, logical and interesting!! simply loved it and the girl working there was superhelpful and very nice! Highly recommended!!

What a fun game!. Thanks to Tripadvisor we tried this challenge when we were in Prague last week. It was so fun and very challenging. We enjoyed each minute of it and were pleased to escape the room in 54 minutes with some help.
Just try it by yourself and I will be highly surprised if you say it wasn't fun enough.

MUST DO!!!. It was awesome! You have 1 hour to escape the soviet agent's apartment. The setting looks great, you really get the feeling that you are in a communist apartment, the hint are very cleverly placed and linked. The best experience we had in Prague.

So much fun!. This was our second room escape game, and we thoroughly enjoyed it! Four stars only because a) the rooms use a lot of misdirection to try to make the game challenging -- although this definitely does the job, I feel like it takes away from the overall enjoyment. And, b) the price is a bit steep for only an hour of entertainment.

So Fun!. When visiting Prague, we went to this place not knowing what exactly to expect. But once we got there and Michael (one of the staff) explained it to us we had a really great time. It was challenging enough, but in an amusing kind of way and we got to test our Sherlock Holmes skills. Would definitely recommend this if you're in Prague and looking for a fun and unique activity.

Prague Tour Highlight. I had decided to visit this place after seeing the recommendations in trip advisor and I was not disappointed. It was our first experience to play such a game but it was real fun. It was just me and my wife and we managed to escape in a little over 60 mins but with a little help. Locating the place is a problem but is best to call the staff and they will come to pick you up from wherever nearby you are to this place. This place should surely be on your list of places to visit while in Prague.

A Must Do In Prague. We did this as part of a Hen Do activity in which we spilt into 2 groups of 4.It was a great team activity and the staff at Trap were lovely.Trap was really fun and challenging. It was great as not only was there the challenge of beating Trap but we also were able to compete time wise against the other hen do.Definitely worth a visit - a cheap and fun activity.
AMAZING. The Prague one is better than the Budapest one - we had SO MUCH FUN! :D It is difficult, but you just have to be passionate and persist. Book ahead!
super fun. A great way to pass time in Prague. So fun and exiting. Pavlina was a great help and nice to us......

Fantastic fun!!. Me and my boyfriend saw the reviews before we went, and decided to check it out. So glad we did! Great game, really challenging and fun! We managed to get out with two minutes to spare and only a minimum amount of help. It only takes around an hour, definitely worth doing if you're in Prague and up for a giggle!

Fantastic fun!. My friend and I had some free time during the day and decided to check this out, went into it not knowing what to expect. It's the most insane brain churning, puzzle solving, quick thinking hour you will ever have. It's really challenging which is great because it's so rewarding once you solve a riddle or puzzle and get further to escaping the room. It's affordable, highly entertaining and only takes an hour.... If your smart enough to escape in time ;) I highly recommend it!!

A MUST FOR ALL AGES. Booked online, unfortunately nobody turned up, place was locked up, waited for nearly 1 hour. When we got back to hotel, there was an email to say they where sorry and if we could make it early next morning they would open up for us. Didnt want to miss this due to great reviews, we where not disappointed, great game for all ages. On top of this the girl in charge made us breakfast and let us play for half price due to there no show the day before.

A Unique Puzzle/Game Experience. Puzzles, lateral thinking, numbers, if this is you then this is a must. Take people with you who also have the same passion for a great time. Better 4 or more people but fun for a couple too.
Worth it!. Excellent fun for a small group of friends, friendly staff and surely something you will remember.If you are clever enough you might even find the odd shortcut...

Fun experience. Found this via tripadvisor and so glad I look on here to find things to do on places I visit. The whole experience was excellent from the warm welcome and explanation to entering the game and solving the problems to get out. Managed to get out before time up but needed a little help. The assistant gave us a pointer and we were able to work out the next clue. The game was fun and we were talking about it well into the night. Teamwork is essential and solving the clues very rewarding. Highly recommended for that something a bit different.

Suspenseful and Exciting fun hidden in Prague!. If you are going to do one thing in Prague that's a little out of the ordinary, skip the peddle tours and sex machine museum and go get trapped! Trap is an escape game where you are trapped in a room and need to solve clues in order to escape. There were 5 of us in there and it took us almost the entire hour.The hostess was extremely friendly and welcoming, the facilities are very cool and the overall experience was excellent! I highly recommend it.

GREAT FUN!. My husband, niece and I did Trap shortly after arriving in Prague. WE LOVED IT! The entire concept is fun and unique. We managed to solve the puzzle (apparently, however, according to Klara we cheated on one clue). Had a great time. Especially fun after visiting the Museum of Communism. Entire concept is well-executed and thought out. Great atmosphere. Clues are tough but solvable. Highly recommend this!

Fantastic. A brand new experience for us and we loved every second of this. Helpful hints when needed from the staff member - and sometimes you do because it IS quite tricky. We're planning on visiting TRAP's other locations very soon!

Great fun!. Something different for people to do while visiting Prague. Finding the place was quite difficult, but apparently that's all part of the challenge so if you've booked make sure your going to have enough time to find it! We thoroughly enjoyed the experience and would definetly recommend it to everyone. We done it as a couple but would also be great for a small group of people. Would love to go back in a few months to try out the new rooms!

A great time!. A fun and challenging game with a neat Cold War theme. The makers of the TRAP Prague did a great job making the setting feel like something out of a Cold War spy movie. Make sure you bring CZK to pay with. People there speak fluent English and were very friendly.
Fun!. Great little fun game! We just made it with a few seconds to spare! A little hard to find the place, so make sure you give yourself some extra time!

Unexpectedly great experience. We were quite apprehensive about going to Trap, having never done anything like this before. However it turned out to be really fun once you got into it. Definitely recommend this for anyone, can't imagine anyone who wouldn't find this fun. And it only takes an hour, really good rainy day activity.

Great fun!. It is a fantastic and fascinating game, in a fabulously recreated atmosphere of an old flat full of clues. The staff is very helpful and accommodating and the price is a breeze. However, we found it difficult with two people - too many riddles for the time given. If you have the choice, go with a group (3-5). It is also important that different team members concentrate on different clues in parallel, otherwise too much time is lost brainstorming together on the same lead. All in all, a highly recommended experience!

Fun and clever diversion. This was more fun than expected. We were a group of three and had a great time figuring out the various puzzles and clues to get out of the room. The staff was outgoing and enthusiastic. We managed to get out of the room in 51 minutes. At 1200 czk it was a steal and a great change of pace to standard touristy activities. Highly recommend!
Family Fun. It was difficult to find but once there the staff was great. It was very challenging for our group. We spent 2 hours with several calls for helpful hints and still never escaped!

Better than expected. My girlfriend and I both had a blast playing this game.I will start by saying that we managed to get out in 56 mins with very little help, which I think says a lot about how well organised it is. The challenges are such that they can be done in the amount of time given if you try very hard, but it is also very easy to miss out by only a few short minutes.The atmosphere of the place was amazing, with old moldy books and old paraphernalia really adding to the experience. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend.
Great Activity!. We had so much fun at TRAP! Different from anything I had ever done - great activity to meet up with your group before going out at night.

Out with 3 minutes to spare. Infuriating little game. But fun in an infuriating sort of way. Team work is key. Staff were so helpful when we got stuck. Don't worry, everyone gets stuck at one point. Thanks for a great time. Would definitely recommend. Barnsley boys out with 3 minutes to spare. Hodor.
Great experience. We really enjoyed the Trap Prague experience, even though we needed quite a bit of help to get to the end! The "receptionist", Lenka, was extremely helpful and firendly

TRAP Prague. TRAP was a blast!!! It was a little hard to find and we were a little sketched out with the building but in the end it was no big deal. Staff was very fun and outgoing. The quest itself was exciting! Can't give away any clues so you DEFINITELY have to go see for yourself.

TRAP,PRAGUE. WOW, what a great concept,4 of us were keen to try this game on our last day in beautiful Prague,and we were not disappointed,warm welcome from Michael,the set up of the clues were challenging but the whole game is based on fun,if prompts are needed(which were for us)Michael was there to help you progress.We took an extra 20 mins(doh)but there was no pressure to rush through at any time,we all wanted to complete and the excitement of solving each puzzle was great.DO NOT MISS you will love it.

Really original and fun way to spend an hour. The staff here give you a lovely welcome - Tereza was very chatty and welcoming and even gave us a great recommendation for a restaurant for dinner too. I wont spoil the surprise by saying anything about it but basically you have to work as a team to find and solve clues to help you unlock various locks . We went as a family of 4 and our children of 13 and 11 really enjoyed figuring out the clues and puzzles. It had a great Cold War theme - and the hour went by really quickly! Great fun, would highly recommmend

Teamwork and fun!. My husband and I really enjoyed this. He talked me into it since he loves the puzzles and problem solving. I just thought it was weird that 'we were going to be locked in a room. But, we both had a really great time. There were a few, "I feel really dumb" and "Aha, I feel really smart for figuring it out" moments. I would definitely do something like this again!We signed up for the first time slot. the entrance is located behind a door that you need to be buzzed into.

Great puzzle/mind game. This was our first puzzle/mind game and we had so much fun to solve the puzzles. This is a great team work game, is not all about puzzle but also about open mindness and communication. Well worth the money and the time.

Click & Point Awesomeness in Real Life. One of the best activities I could imagine. We had so much fun looking for hints, combining clues, solving the puzzles. And as we thought we got everything, more was waiting to be discovered. Even though we didn't finish in one hour we were granted more time. Thanks again to the very friendly staff. Looking forward to doing more of these in other cities.
Fun. This is quite difficult but very fun and rewarding. The member of staff were very friendly and helpful!

Surprising and such fun. We saw this on Tripadvisor as the best thing to do in Prague. Was a little skeptical as it sounds quite unusual, but so glad we did it. As there was only two of us, we didn't manage to do it in an hour, but they gave us extra time to complete it which was really kind of them. It it such a good challenge. Won't say anything about it as don't want to give it away, but just to say do this. Well worth the money and will probably be the best thing you do in Prague.

Unique And Entertaining. My wife and I signed up to play based entirely on the reviews from Trip Advisor, and we were not disappointed. It's such a unqiue idea -- I've never seen or heard of anything like it in the U.S. -- and very well done. If you like puzzles, you'll love this game. And the young woman who works there is so friendly and engaging, it made the experience all the better. She'll even give you hints if you need them, so you won't be stuck on anything for longer than you want to be. We failed the time challenge miserably, but still had a blast. I'd definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Prague. Try to book a slot in the late evening; it'll make the experience a little more intriguing.Two things to note: (1) it's located in an apartment behind a locked gate that leads out to the street. There's a sign on the building (and a buzzer to get in), but it can be difficult to find if you don't map it beforehand; (2) allow yourself more than an hour because they'll let you finish the game even if it takes you longer than the alloted 60 minutes. You won't want to quit before you finish, trust me.

So much fun!. This is a very fun activity for vacation. The flat is quite authentic and the puzzles are surprisingly challenging. Definitely a good activity for a small group of any kind. I highly reccomend it.

Excellent city break. Compact town so can walk to all attractions. Friendly people,good food and the weather was great. Really enjoyed the old town and found the best time to visit the Charles bridge was before 9am to beat the crowds.

Affordable, Great Fun & Challenging. I visited TRAP with a friend & was a great experience. We were guided properly before the start of the game.
The game itself is rather challenging and keeps you on the toe till the end.
great work TRAP team!

Fantastic and Intriguing. I booked this as a surprise for my wife whilst visiting Prague. The process is very simple - Plan the date and time you wish to participate and book via the website. You pay nothing upfront as this is done at the end. The cost was around £30 for a couple. The booking is for an hour slot and can cater for a group of people. Finding the location is not too bad if you have a map. I'd advise getting an offline map of Prague. It's not far from the Powder Tower (Prasna Brana). Once you arrive, you are met by your host who explains the rules and general concept. The actual game/ puzzle was very good and is challenging. There are many clues in the game but are not always as obvious. I won't give too much away but there are some surprises and nothing scary or intimidating. There is no physical challenges at all. There is a pub next door but it wasn't very friendly. Overall a thoroughly enjoyable experience.
Fantastic experience!. I loved every moment of this. I recommend anyone going to Prague to try this as it is an experience you'll never forget. It was extremely fun!

Don't Leave Prague Without This Experience!. What fun we had - it was the best and quickest 1 hour spent while in Prague - do not leave Prague without having the Trap experience! Communications with Manager Toth Lukacs were very nice as he sets up the appointment times. When making the reservation online, I suggest to be specific to mention whether you will be more than two persons or a group. Mr. Lukacs will confirm the reservation.The venue is located not too far from the Old Town Square. Once there, you will find the items and "puzzles" retro '70's, challenging, interesting, funny and all very well thought out. You will wish there were more "rooms"..... The experience is not physical as one contributor mentioned, but it you are like my sister, don't hesitate to turn over a piece of furniture to find a potential necessary clue......! The price is worth every penny. A special thank you to Paulina who was our control person. She was a delight and enhanced our experience as she sincerely shared in our joy and helped us get through a couple of stop gappers.Don't forget to take a photo with Stalin and make sure to leave your mark by writing about your experience on the wall.

so much fun. This is a super fun experience...it does not require any physical activity per se...I was 6.5 months pregnant when I did this an din no way did it feel like too much. Go for an experience to remember.
Trap Prague. It`s always pleasant to find something new and unusual in a city you visit. Three words- interesting, exciting and unforgettable!

Completely loved it!. Fantastic to try out. It's nice and different for a holiday and really tests the brain cells! Really well organised and thought out and a great price! I highly recommend this experience.
Awesome idea. Was surprised at how much fun we had. We did it as a couple, think it would be better with more people. Highly recommend. Book in advance

Amazing and very clever. We booked this 3 days before arriving in Prague after reading about the great reviews on TA. This is the first time we have done anything like this, you will not be disappointed. From the welcome we received to the whole experience of the game, it was one we will not forget. Would recommend this to anyone wanting something different to do whilst in Prague
Fun and interesting option. We had no idea what we were in for, but we eventually got out, after a few hints. Very reasonable for what it is!

Clever and interesting game. This was the first time we played this kind of game and we liked a lot! Its very interesting and smart the way you get out of this room. If you have never tryed before you must try this one. Also the staff is very kind!
Excellent place!!. Quite hard for 2 people, but we thoroughly enjoyed it!! :-)I got it as a birthday present and it was one of the best!

Great fun! A must do - definitely!. The reviews tell it all - a great fun experience unlike any other. Trap is basically a mind game where you're put into a room and need to find clues to unlock doors, drawers, and closets. The experience was exhilarating and fun yet very challenging! My advice - ask for help whenever you're stuck and dont let time pass - you'll get the most out of it by moving forward so you can enjoy the entire experience. There's a time limit so make sure you ask for help when you need it!

Fantastic!. Went to Prague for my birthday and my Mum gave me the money for Trap as a birthday present. What a great way to spend an hour on your birthday. Met by a nice girl and shown into the room after a short briefing. We got off to a slow start but got out with 2 mins to spare after quite a bit of help. Found it quite challenging but lots of fun. We did Mindmaze 2 days later and actually preferred that as the setting is a bit more fun and the background music less rousing. Trap was a bit more tricky myself and my husband thought. But I'm very glad we did both. Now seriously hooked. I reckon the cost is good value even when there is only 2 of you. I think a smaller group probably works best. I wouldn't have wanted to do it with 5 people. Fab, fab, fab!
Great city.. So much to see, Great places to eat, and if you like shopping a huge variety of shops for all budgets.

Great fun. My husband and I visited Trap Prague after reading the revues on Tripadvisor, and we were not disappointed. We were taken good care of by Michael who gave us a quick briefing of the mission inside the room.The puzzles was of various difficulties, some easy, and som quite difficult. We did not manage the trap without help, and within the time limit. But luckily we were able to stay a bit over the hour and found our way out.Megafun, warmly reccomended! A tip is to bring some paper and a pencil with you when entering the trap...
Escaped!. I was quite sceptical about Trap but turned out to have a great time. Would highly recommend to anyone. Needed a couple of clues but our group escaped with minutes to spare.

Hidden gem of Prague!. We took part in TRAP as a hen party of 10 girls. We split into two groups and raced against each other. Everyone had a blast - such a clever and fun experience, very different from everything else on offer in Prague and a good break from sightseeing! The staff were great and we will definitely recommend TRAP to friends visiting Prage!

Great fun!. Had a brilliant time at TRAP Prague. There were just two of us and it was fairly challenging whilst not being too difficult. Lenka, the staff member was very friendly, greeted us and explained everything well. Also gave us a few clues along the way when we asked for them without spoiling the puzzle. I'd highly recommend as something a bit different to do un Prague. Was great fun.
different thing to do in cultural city. Very interesting game for people that like solving mysteries. Recommend to everyone. One hour great experience and fun.

Great experience. Really recommend this experience. We enjoyed it and it was fun. The guy from the desk was very helpful and nice. We are willing to go also in Budapest to enjoy the other rooms. The puzzles were interesting. We really didn't know what to expect from the game but it was an hour of pure fun.
A Must Do!!. This is FANTASTIC experience. A definite must do!! Something completely different which you will never find in the UK. The staff are great too.
Klara is a babe. The room was cool but klara makes this place 5 stars. Very helpful and friendly especially for a czech person.

Have to Try!!. Myself and my partner visited here on 26.04.14 after reading the other reviews on here and it was most definitely worth the experience. You have an hour to solve all the clues and 'escape'. We didn't know what to expect but it was so much fun and the time goes by so fast. Our host Tess was so lovely and took some photos for us at the end. Anybody visiting Prague should visit here it is something completely different and gets you thinking. Would love to do something like it again.

Great fun!. It was an awesome experience! Something new and exciting. You are "thrown" into a room and the only hint is "You don't neceserally get out the same way you came in" and you have to find a way out. To make this review more interesting i should write about the puzzles, but that won't happen. You just have to experience this! Highly recommended!And also a very nice staff! Have fun!
Love it. Love the game not only for one thinking it need alot of effort from every one , the best thing was the host she is gr8

Great game to pass an hour. My wife and I went here last Saturday not knowing what to expect as we had never been to anything like this before, it was brilliant fun and challenging. The hour flew by and we made it out with 52 seconds to spare, all be it with a couple of hints. Definitely recommend for anyone visiting Prague, blows away the hangover cobwebs lol

Absolute must-do. My wife and I went to TRAP on the first night of our stay and it was a perfect start to the trip. We opted for the latest spot possible and definitely added to the experience.The hour absolutely flies by but I couldn't recommend it highly enough. What adds to the experience is the helpfulness of the staff. The girl who took care of us (sorry I've forgotten your name) was friendly, helpful and great fun.

so awsome!!! go check it out!. We went as a couple and solved it within 70 minuts. It was really difficult specially while we were hungover. Don't miss out!
cost 1000czk

It was fun to be TRAPped. Wonderfull idea that is very nicely done and prepared! TRAP was a very fun game to do. We went with a bunch of friends and enjoyed every minute of it. Our host Klara was cheerful, welcoming and eager to help us when we needed a clue. I highly recommend this game to everyone. I would love to do it again! Just awesome!

TRAP...in more ways than one. Michael M - Wonderful break from our other fun travels in Prague for my wife and I. A very unique experience, with a well done lay out. Be forewarned that the term TRAP doesn't just apply to the locked room, but also about your mind getting stuck on a singular thought. I still am haunted by a phone ring. As a final comment, our host Pavlina, was wonderful. Highly recommend!!

Best thing to do on vacation. Yes, Prague is beautiful. The palaces, the castles, the bridge and all of the spires. Yet, the pictures will fade away because it was just an image. Trap was an experience that the entire family from grandparent to parent to grandchildren enjoyed. You have one hour to solve the secrets and escape from the room or boiling acid will fall down on you. OK, maybe not boiling acid, but you would not want to suffer the embarrassment in front of your children when you do not escape!The time passed by quickly and we all had fun. It turns out that this is something you can do in other cities, like Berlin. We had so much fun that we will seek this activity in every city that we visit.This worked great with our family and it would work as an excellent corporate team building event. Do not delay, make a reservation and escape the TRAP!
So much fun. It was a lot of fun and a great game to play. Definitely a team effort to get through. Try not to break anything while you play. (We might have)

Amazing interactive experience. I did this with my 20 year old son and had booked it as a surprise for him as this sort of thing is 'right up his street' so to speak - it didn't disappoint. We took over the hour but did solve it in the end (albeit with a few clues from our watcher). It might have been easier with 4 as opposed to 2 of us but we never got bored or frustrated, and surprisingly we didn't come to blows (verbal or physical). I would recommend it to anyone with an hour to spare and I shall certainly be looking up similar games in other cities.
Very Fun. A very interesting and enjoyable experience in the house of a Soviet Spy. The people hosting this event were very nice and accommodating. Would definately recommend.

Great activity in Prague!. Spent a fantastic hour trying to find the solution to get us to the end of the trip. Great to do with kids as well, who actively participated and really enjoyed it. Nice and friendly hosts who helped us out when necessary! Would recommend it to anyone!

Cold war intrigue in modern day prague. My Family and I did this activity yesterday,Our Children are aged 10,13,15,16 years of age . My wife had pre-booked over the internet and we had no specific expectations.It was a great way to spent the hour try to escape the apartment of a pro Stalin agent using our wits to find clues to unlock various other clues to help us escape ,I would highly recommend this activity

Exellent game!. A nice game and not easy at all! Some task were really complex. If you get stuck, you can call for a help. The worker was very nice and gave us 10min extra time so we could finish. If you are looking for something different and interesting, you must come to TRAP!

Brilliant!. You get an hour to solve all the puzzles to get out of a secret agent's flat. It was brilliant but we were not very good to start with. You can call for clues if you get really stuck. The chap in charge was very helpful and kind. He also let us finish the tasks and stay for an extra 45 minutes. We were not rushed which was great. Heartily recommended, make time to do this, don't wait until it's raining!!
Left us wanting more. Definitely recommend checking TRAP out. A really unique experience, and at the end we were left wanting more! If you have an hour to spare in Prague, go along and check it out.
Great experience. After visiting Prague Mind Maze we had a taste for escape games, so we found TRAP Prague. It was a fantastic experience!
Unique activity. We enjoyed our experience at TRAP. It was definitely a unique activity and it only took an hour so it was a quick thing to do.

Great entertainment. Great fun and really difficult puzzles. I am really impressed with how complex some of the tasks were. The host was very friendly and gave us hints when needed. I would say this a must see in Prague.
One hour of fun. Can only agree with the other rewiews. This little game is so much fun and you really need to think in a different way than you usually do. An hour well spend.

A fun break from all the history touring. We usually spend our vacations in the museums, walking all the historic neighborhoods, seeing all the famous sights and eating the local food. Today we did TRAP as an activity that our 16-year old son would enjoy, and what fun it was for all of us !!! Intrigue, detective work and team work all combined. I was so glad that it was not about guns and killing, but rather about using your head to solve a spy mission. FUN !

Lots of fun!. This was the first time we have done something like this, we did it with our 16 year old and it was great to work as a team. Very cleverly designed and executed. It was our sons favorite hour of the trip, or perhaps the Segway tour, but I don't think so, it was the TRAP game.
Very entertaining. A really good fun event. My wife and I took part in this challenge and both enjoyed the game, would recommend it to anyone!
Very fun!. The experience was great. It is like an escape the room puzzle that is popular online, but in real life. The puzzles were challenging yet exciting. Overall, highly recommended.

Wonderful game!!!. TRAP was an amazing experience. It's like a video game becoming real! Very challenging puzzles (couldn't do it without help, that's for sure) and very friendly and helpful staff! Hope these kind of games start to appear in more places, it's a superb concept!

Great experience!. this was our first exit game and for sure not the last one!specific about that one;our guide was great, when she saw we got a little lost once, she called us in our room (didnt wait for us to call) and gave us a small hint - just what we needed, so you can see she really was watching us, paying attention and not fooling around.the game itself is great, i dont want to give too many details.great for the puzzles/ riddles lovers!not easy, not too difficult. I recommend :)

Our family of 5 loved it. I am always looking for something unique and interesting to do that all 3 kids will enjoy including the adults. This isn't easy because if the kids love it, many times we don't or vice versa. While this sounded like so much fun, I thought it might be too challenging for kids in the age range of 10-12. I have boy/girl twins, age 10 and a 12 year old boy. Boy was I wrong!The owners were very friendly and our family felt quite welcomed. I won't reiterate what others have said other than to say the setting is in the communist era and you have to solve various puzzles in order to escape, having just one hour to do it. Similar to who wants to be a millionaire, you get a phone a friend (the owner) when you need it who watches you via camera and I'm sure has a few good laughs.I'm ashamed to admit that my expectations were low for my family to get out but seriously the only hindrance, if there was one, was me (mom) and I'm 54 years old. It was slow going at first as we all raced around having no clue what we were really suppose to do despite the clear instructions given to us beforehand. My younger son got very excited and I had to quiet him down a couple of times.After about 10 minutes with no luck and wondering if we were going to get anywhere, I figured out the first clue. Made me feel a bit superior and I started thinking that the only way we would escape would be if *I* could figure out all the clues in time until it became apparent that finding the first clue would pretty much be my only contribution for the rest of the hour. Well, it's not as if that should have surprised me. I told the owners I wasn't overly bright.After the first clue was found, we were able to go at a little quicker pace. I actually forgot about the time until the last 20 minutes or so. The owner called us once to give us a hint probably because she saw us keep bypassing a clue and then we called twice (I think) for hints but otherwise got out in the nick of time. Okay, my ten year old said we didn't get out in time but the owner said we had a minute to spare and I'm believing the owner. We were in another room away from the clock. Without giving anything away, one of the puzzles caused a delay where we couldn't do anything so that took some time.I was astounded at how much the kids figured out. Between them and my husband who is an engineer, we were able to escape. I truly believe if the kids hadn't been with us, we wouldn't have made it out in time. We needed a couple of hints but I would find it quite amazing if anyone was able to do the entire thing without one hint whatsoever. I think our family taking into consideration the age of our kids, did very well and no thanks to me either.If you are looking for a unique experience that is family friendly, I highly suggest this. Even if you have kids a little younger that cognitively probably wouldn't be able to truly help, the experience of being with their parents and acting as secret agents to try and help their mom and dad escape would be a thrill for them so don't let the fact that you have younger kids deter you. Just know that it will probably be you and your significant other that will have to solve the clues but you never know. You might be really surprised like I was. There were definitely puzzles that my kids could solve and/or help with. It requires cooperation and working together. Because I was off trying to figure out a clue, I didn't pay attention once to what the rest of my family was doing but if I did, I would have been much more of a help so going off in your own little world isn't a good thing.This was quite the family adventure and one of those things that my kids will remember for a long time. They may not remember 5 minutes after you ask them to brush their teeth but they can tell me activities they did with us when they were 4 or 5 years old in vivid detail that even I have forgotten. It is truly amazing sometimes.Afterwards, we chatted with the owners and they let us try and figure out a puzzle box that they are working on that isn't quite completed. Great fun! If this is up your alley, you won't be disappointed.

Highly recommended. Would highly recommend this. A brilliant way to spend an hour and the puzzles are really well thought out. The staff are also great and really helpful when you get a bit stuck! Think my husband is planning trips to the other two countries just so we can complete the other 'TRAPS'! Definitely one of the highlights of our trip!

FUN TIME. After reading the reviews, we decided this would be a fun new activity to try. We made it out with 3 hints in 55 mins and had a blast. From the Powder Tower the location is fairly close and stopping in at the bar next door for a celebratory pint was great.
Amazing!!!!!!!!!!!! 100% recommended . I went with my girlfriend and was the first time we do this kind of games and we really enjoyed every part of the game!!!!!!!At the end we did it on time!!! :-)

An interesting alternative activity on vacation. TRAP Prague was a really interesting idea to us. There's so much sightseeing to do here, that it's nice to do something a bit different for an hour. We went to TRAP on the last night of our trip, and had a really fun time trying to work together to figure out the puzzles as quickly as we could. Our guide was really helpful when we needed a tip and she was very friendly. One word of advice: don't overanalyze everything or spend too long trying to figure one thing out. At some points we should have just moved onto something else. Either way, give this a shot. It's an interesting activity, it's not too expensive, and it's worth the hour it takes.The only reason I gave this 4 stars instead of 5 is that it was a bit hard to find (near old town square but off a side street) and the area seems a little bit shady at night, but it really isn't that far from the main touristy area.

Brilliant experience!!. Would totally recommend anyone who has an hour or so to spare in Prague, you will not be dissappointed!!! Felt like Sherlock Holmes for 75mins!! The guy that runs it (didn't catch his name) was really helpful when we needed hints. He was very patient and seemed to really enjoy his job. Such a great idea!! Please someone start this up in Dublin!!!

Totally awesome. We didn't know exit games before, but we totally loved it. This game makes really a lot fun. The girl who guided us through the game was very friendly and welcoming. She observed us very well, so she always knew which kind of hints are helpful. Even after the game was finished she took some time to chat with us about Prague and gave us tips for sightseeing.We loved it so much that we tried another exit game a day later, but this one was the best.

Loads of fun. This was brilliant. The owner was accommodating and did a great job of explaining things and accommodating our bad jokes. The challenges were varied and interesting. If you enjoy something different give it a go.
Great time!. My husband and I visited TRAP yesterday morning and we're still talking about how much fun we had! I highly recommend this attraction.
a must attraction. really exit games are amazing! and TRAP was phenomenal. They opened just in January so they are still working on a few things, but it doesn't disturb the game experience :)

A brilliant and very different experience. My girlfriend saw this location on Trip Advisor and knew I would love it, but she was hesitant. If you ask her now, after we have been she would say, she loved it.We visited on April 1st 2014 and cannot remember the girls name that welcomes you but she was wonderful and very friendly. We had a good chat about Prague, and comic books before we were sent into the locked flat.That is where the fun begins. Imagine the Crystal Maze, where you are the contestant, and I am sure the guide is sitting watching through the cameras cursing your stupidity just like we all did watching the crystal maze.I won't say anymore in case I give anything away but this is a great way to spend an hour, whether just the two of you, as it was for me and my partner, or in a larger group. You will be tested in many ways! I cannot recommend this place more. So much fun. We completed it in 55 minutes and didn't argue once!

A great time with the (grown) family!. If Prague weren't so beautiful, this would have been the highlight of our trip! My brother in law had arranged it so we had no idea what we were in for. The guide explained everything well and was very friendly which made us feel safe (being locked in a room by him). We even managed to solve the game in the nick of time! (with a few tips from the guide) We were expecting a few more logic puzzles, but felt that it was really well done in order to ensure that it's possible to progress from one clue to the next. A great chance for team work among grown-ups and a very fun birthday present for my father-in-law. I think it would be great fun for teens as well, though they'll need an explanation of how to use the vintage rotary phone. ;-)

Excellent and challenging!. Myself and my partner booked TRAP online before heading to Prague and we were not disappointed! The game itself is very exciting and challenging and really requires you to think in order to move on to the next clue. I was a bit apprehensive as I thought maybe it was going to be a bit claustrophobic but it wasn't at all. Lucas was extremely helpful in giving clues over the phone when we got stuck. We ended up going over the hour mark but there was no one waiting to play after us so Lucas let us carry on until we figured it out eventually!! Great fun for a couple or a small group. Highly recommend anyone going to Prague to check this out.
The beautiful city of Prague. Loved everything about it - a place to visit over and over again, so much to see and do. Culture and history combined.

Best use of an hour, or maybe more.. Me and my fiancée have been in Prague for only two days and have done all we could do on a small budget. After seeing this on the tripadvisor website we knew this had to go onto our itinerary. I'm a huge fan of escape the room style games and the thought of doing it in real life was very intriguing. We have just finished and had to leave a review as it was an amazing hour. It is the perfect level of difficulty. It is very doable with two people and having more than two won't make it any easier. I would definitely recommend it. The staff that work there are lovely and it is great value for money. If you're in Prague, even if you're not here for long, please try and find an hour to visit TRAP. You will not regret it, I promise.

Brilliant logical fun game (I felt like jason bourne when we left). We had a bit of spare time to kill on the last day of our honeymoon before our flight. This looked way more fun than looking at the large cuckoo clock. My new wife was really quite scared that we were going to be involved in something like the film hostel but not at all. Just a fun logical game and she loved it and won't stop talking about it now. It takes you a few minutes to figure out where to start but once you have got started everything seems to fall in to place so that you can escape. Lucas (guy on the desk) is helpful with clues if you get stuck. Would really recommend it. You end up getting quite competitive with each other.

Enjoy a lot!. I enjoy this a lot. The game was fun and it's a great for a group of friends. Normally the time limit is 1 hour for each group, however the host let us play for 1.5 hours to solve all the puzzles. Great Game!
So much fun!. A must when in Prague. I recommend going as a couple, or maximum 4 people. This way everyone gets to contribute. We had so much fun solving the puzzles, it was really exciting.

Great activity for a group of friends. TRAP was a nice mind game. Never done it before, but I liked it. It was fun and a social thing to do for a group of friends. The host/manager of the place was very nice and service minded. We were the last group of people that evening, and the host let us go on for almost 1,5 hours! Usually you only have 1 hour to solve the game.It cost 50 euro for 1 hour game. We were 5 people.

Good Fun!. On our first night in Prague we were looking for an activity which didn't involve late night drinking (shocking I know!). I found TRAP through TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed in the least. Lukas was a great host and we really enjoyed our experience... even if we did have to ask for help!

Great experience. Found out about this place through Trip Advisor and thought would give a go as sounded like something a bit different to do. Was really good fun. Lady who helped us through was very welcoming. Both really enjoyed it, would be great if they come to England!

TRAP - A must when in Prague!!!!. My girlfriend and I took on TRAP last thursday 20th March 2014. We booked the previous day. On arriving we were met by the host Lukas. Both he and his female colleague were extremely welcoming and informative before we played TRAP. I am not going to give away any of the game but for a brain teasing challenge and a bit of "craic" (we are irish) it was quality. Money well spent and great value for money! A must do when visiting prague!!!

Interesting. Didn't know what to expect when I booked this, but read some really good reviews and wasn't disappointed. Would be better if there were more rooms but to be fair myself and my partner didn't do the best... Effects of the Pub Crawl the night before. Would definitely recommend though.

FANTASTIC!. Wow! What an excellent activity! Myself and my boyfriend booked this activity not knowing what to expect. We found it easily with a good map, but if you didn't know about it you would miss it. We were welcomed by the staff and introduced to TRAP! The fun began there! We absolutely LOVED this activity!! It was well organised and staff were very welcoming and friendly. I have recommended this to all my family and friends on return home from Prague. Thanks guys for a great and different experience!!

Amazing experience. We went on a trip with our work group and were not disappointed!If you are in Prague do not miss out on this unique experience that made our day. The thrilling quest against time will test you skills and this is definitely recommended for everyone !

Where did that 1 hour go?!. Booked as something to do on the last day before flying home, two couples. My wife was pretty worried about this, being locked in a room, and when we found the entrance (that's the first tricky bit!) and looked in the "rustic" courtyard, she was even more worried (imagining some horror of an eastern European kidnapping - must cut down on watching the "Hostel"-like films!). I think the location and courtyard really adds to the experience, it gives it that extra air of a hidden secret agent's flat. Once we got inside and started talking to the host, he calmly put all her fears at ease. Very clear English speaking Czech, and a very relaxed handling of our time - there's no rush to leave exactly after the 1 hour as they leave themselves plenty of time to reset the clues and have a chat with you and take a picture.The room you get "locked into" is a retro lounge, and as soon as you start frantically trying to work things out, you get lost in the moment. Our 1 hour passed in a fun-filled flash, so glad we did this - as were our whole party. Not stopped talking about it since!You might think this isn't a very Czech thing to experience while on your short break, but it does have a Czech feel about it, you won't feel like a second of your Prague time here is wasted, believe me!
Excellent mind game. This game feels like you're inside an old quest computer game. Alot of fun and good brain exercise. Very recommended for groups of two and above.

Prague is a city that will leave a lasting impression. Traveled here as part of 21st birthday celebrations and we were not disappointed. The stigma that the Czech Republic get is totally wrong. We had no trouble and it was an amazing city we just didn't have enough time there to explore the vast city it is! A must city to visit.
Fantastic experience. Highly reccommend :). Fast paced problem solving game loved by our whole group. Our ages ranged from 23 to 60 so is suitable for everyone :) definitely worth a visit!
Trap prague. An amazing experience, a tremendous mental effort. Worth the investment. Thanks lucas ,good idea for the trip.Eli

Good laughs. We did this game with 4 friends in total, didnt knew what to expect. After 5 minutes of thinking what kinda weird game is this we begun to be very competive. We think its the best funny attraction to do in Prague.
Secret squirrel fun. My girlfriend and I had a proper fun time today at Trap, although we're definatley not as clever as we thought we were! That aside, Trap is an a awesome must do in Prague.

One of a kind experience. Went to Trap with 2 friends and it was unlike anything we'd ever done. We'd heard about but didn't really know what to expect-but it was the right mix of challenging and fair. The Soviet Union-themed setting was really neat (especially after just having visited the Museum of Communism earlier!). I'd definitely recommend Trap if you like puzzles!

Great Fun. Went here as part of a stag party to Prague and this was great fun. Neither group made it out of the room, although we might have had a few drinks before hand. Either way it was great fun and a nice change of pace from other attractions in Prague.

Couldn't recommend it more. We played as a family (aged 21 to 73) and it was the highlight of our trip to Prague, which we loved. The detail that has gone into planning the game is phenomenal: some very clever people have devised this game and it shows. We didn't quite make it out in time (even with the extra time that the very sweet host gave us) and we needed more hints that I care to admit but I haven't enjoyed anything quite this much in ages... more than anything, it's just really good fun. Go.

Excellent game and so much fun!. We did the trap as couple and it was great. It's just the right level of difficulty and challenges the brain as well as the cleverness. You have to try it! The athmospehere is amazing as the place is furnished with passion for detail. It feels like being transferred into the past.

An entertaining way to spend an hour. On a wet Prague day, we were very entertained by solving clues and escaping from a communist flat. The communist theme was appropriate considering the city's recent history.
Loved it. On a stag weekend with 11 of us and they managed to re arrange some times to fit us in as we needed to do it in two groups. Excellent fun. Would recommend to anyone.

Great fun. We were a family group spanning three generations. We all had a great time trying to escape from the room. We failed despite assistance and extra time but had great fun trying and a sense of achievement for those parts we did manage! Pure enjoyment. Sorry about the clock!

Do NOT miss!. Do I need to say more?And excellent exit strategy game for all who feel Sherlock-y. Your team is locked up in a room, and using the few cleverly hidden clues, you need to escape within an hour.Beware- for you need some unconventional mindwork to find your way out!Yes- they will let u out after an hour, even if you do not manage to escape and are 'dead'.No- it is not your average treasure hunt! This is leagues above!Get creative, and you'll actually enjoy the hour of nerve-wrecking organized (or not) chaos that our team ended up in too.A huge thanks to Lucas & team for the wonderful experience, and accomodating us so late :-)Tip: Call em up and make your reservations at least two days in advance. They are fully booked for the day generally.

A fun way to spend time!. TRAP is an Exit Game which has recently evolved over the past three years in Europe. Basically, you're locked in a room with the theme of communist spies, and are provided clues that you need to work out in order to be able to escape from the room. And all in an hour! A race against the clock. Actually there are two rooms you need to escape from. Lukas, our host, was very helpful, explaining everything we needed to know and providing tips when we were stuck. It really is quite fun and worth spending the money on. There were only 2 of us in our team which was enough, but you can have up to 4 or 5 people. A recommended way to have some fun!

TRAP - the most excitement you can have in an hour. This is probably the best hour I have ever spent. We visited Prague on a city break in February with a group of friends. One of the group booked TRAP as a surprise. It was definitely that. Exciting, thrilling, mind-bending, fun, frustrating (in a good way) and hilarious. Loved every minute of it and I can't wait for more TRAPs to be set around the world.
Awesome experience. Truly amazing..really forced us to use our brain and made us think a lot..had a lot of fun..would love to visit another trap room..

Awesome TRAP!. We tried this type of attraction for the first time and it really surpassed our expectations! All of us did enjoy the puzzles and haven't noticed as the hour had passed, when finally managed to escape the room.I do recommend everyone visiting Prague to try this experience!

SO MUCH FUN!. My girlfriend and I loved the challenge - it was a great opportunity to solve puzzles together as a team and we managed to get through it without having a domestic!I've already recommended this to a group of colleagues coming to Prague in the summer and I'd thoroughly recommend it for anyone looking to do something a bit different for an hour =)

A great idea and a great fun. We were 4 people, for me it was the second time in this kind of a place, for the rest - the first time.We really enjoyed it :) It's a great way to spend an hour, try to cooperate and solve sophisticated puzzles.For me, though, it was a bit too "random". Too many clues and not enough logic in using them.Nonetheless, it's a highly recommended activity.

Great fun if youre in Prague. Me and my boyfriend came to Prague for 4 days and decided on giving this a go. We have never tried anything like this before and we really enjoyed it. We didnt complete it in the time allowed but we were allowed to still complete it after the time ran out. Lucas was a great help and helped us when we got stuck. We really recommend this and it only takes an hour. Great fun we really loved it.
A thrilling experience. If you're a fan of solving mysteries, you must try this. Highly recommended! To add to the mystery of it, I'll say no more... ;)

Loved TRAP!!. We visited Trap with our friends and children and had a GREAT time! So much fun for the whole family! I highly recommend Trap. The mystery and searching for clues makes this game so much fun! We finished with two minutes to spare!

Amazing!!!. One of the funniest things we have ever done! TRAP is the BEST, we had 4 adults, 2 kids (7,9) and 2 infants. The kids had just as much fun as the adults. We walked out already talking about the other cities we would visit just to do TRAP again!

Great Fun. We can only recommend this game! We had a lot of fun during the game and we really felt like a Sherlock Holmes solving really huge problem, to save the world. Staff was very nice, organization perfect and price ok. We payd 1 200 CZK for everybody. So if you are in beautiful Prague and want to strain the your brain between enjoying this city, go for it.

Brilliant idea, highlight of our trip!. Read about this place before my boyfriend and I went to Prague, and decided if we had time, that we would give it a try. So glad we made the time, as it is one of our fondest memories from our 5 days in Prague! Such a brilliant concept, and so well executed! We did have a little difficulty finding it, resulting in us being late (better sign posting would be a plus) but once we arrived we were greeted by the owner who was lovely. The puzzles were slightly frustrating at times, but so enjoyable and rewarding! Unfortunately we didn't manage to make it out on time, but the guys that run it came in and showed us the walkthrough and it really is so clever. Spent a good ten minutes talking to the owner afterward, he seemed genuinely interested in hearing our feedback and was just a really nice guy. Would love to find more of these experiences, if you have the time make sure you go here!!

Chasing your past is fun. We have visited the place two weeks ago.The gameplay: duration is okay though a bit short for us (maybe because we are smarter than average :)The riddles and clues was adequate for the stup and was on par with the tense, so when you are short on time it does not push you on the slope making the whole journey impossible. You have a goal and you will enjoy aprroaching that instead of struggle to reach it.The management is very helpful, they said they have another Trap also in Budapest which, strangely, I was not aware of! Thanks, mister!

WOW, WOW, WOW.... This game surpassed all my expectations! We had the best fun ever! It was different, original, exciting and funny! If you wanna make it, you really gotta be on the ball! Its a must try!

Recommended. A lot of fun for a reasonable price. TRAP makes you constantly switch between laughing in pleasure and screaming in frustration. The theme is also interesting - the apartment used is previously owned by a communist, with authentic furnitures. Communist music is played in the background.TRAP Prague can be recommended for both couples, friends and families.

Unique fun - cannot recommend enough!. Without doubt an absolute highlight of our trip - so glad we found out about TRAP!Time Race Against Puzzles is a cross between a real life point and click puzzle game, crystal maze and finders keepers. When we arrived, Lucas the host explained the idea of the game then let us into the game flat is decked out as a spies apartment. Absolutely loved the decor and communist music! The idea is then to hunt for keys, codes and clues - not only to find objects but then to know what to do with them. I don't want to go into detail as this will spoil the surprise when you play but it was definitely a very entertaining and novel experience. If you enjoy playing games, geocaching or solving puzzles this will definitely appeal - and if you get totally stuck you can call for a cheeky clue. Price 800czk for 2 players or slightly more for a team of up to 5 - great value for an hours entertainment although the time will absolutely fly by!

Nice experiment and good for your brains. We enjoyd. We have visited also Trap Budapest so we knew what to expect. Both my husband and I and our four children (age 13, 12, 11 and 7) were very pleased. We managed to solve all problems with some help.

Perfect escapism mystery game. My partner and I went to Trap in Prague not knowing what to expect. We were put through some testing mental challenges searching for clues and solutions to the problems.It was very enjoyable and excellent value for money. Would recommend it to anyone who likes a puzzle and I would definitely go again. It was very cool!

Try something different!. We didn't know what to expect and that's half the fun! Having to use your wits to solve a number of clues in order to progress through the game. Even if you get stuck, there's help available and when you work out a puzzle its a great feeling!Highly recommended to any groups of 2-5 who want to experience something different when in the fine city of Prague.

Fantastic and original experience. Visited Trap as part of a group of 6 friends. What a brilliant and immersive experience it was. I won't spoil it by giving too much away-suffice to say that the puzzles were very clever, and were pitched at just the right level of trickiness. Help is at hand if you need it too. Our host Lukas was very welcoming and helpful and his English is excellent. Just go - it's a brilliant, unusual, and totally enjoyable way to spend an hour or so. Can't recommend highly enough.

Well worth the entry fee. A great day out! Would recommend to anyone in Prague!Great value for money and a fun hours gamePerfect for groups of 4-5 people, the puzzles aren't ridiculously difficult, nor are they too easy

Teamwork. We were locked inside a room and needed to solve puzzles and find objects to escape. This was very fun because you have to work, think and cooperate to get out before the time runs out (1 hour). If you like solving puzzles and codes, you definitely get one hour of fun for a very reasonable price here.

Definately Recommended! Fantastic Experience!. My boyfriend and I recently attended a TRAP session here and it was brilliant! Our host Lukacs was very friendly & briefly explained what was about to happen! It really does test your creative mind - it is exhilarating when you finally work out the first clue and then your on a roll!! We didn't actually complete the TRAP mind maze within the 60 minutes, but it didn't matter, it was still really fun! Such a unique & different experience! Cost about £30 for the both of us for an hour! Time flies in here!

Great fun!. I discovered the place, I never heard about this kind of game before. My local friends took me there, and it was simply amazing. We traveled back to the 70's and felt the spirit of communism. It was like an adventure we used to play on the computer, but this was for real! I wish I could do it again, without knowing the solutions of the puzzles. A must do in Prague!

Fantastic - A must Do in Prague. After attending a Trap game in Budapest created by the same company, we were sure to visit in Prague. We were not let down and a highlight of our quick city break. We were greeted by a friendly man, who explained the rules and gave us some background information. Once allowed into the room, we started solving the puzzles which requires a surprising amount of thought. All puzzles were creative and dissimilar to the ones found in Budapest; we did not quite finish in time because there were only two of us and was granted a little extra time, a really kind addition as we only had minutes to complete the escape. Thoroughly recommenced experience. Thanks

Great experience....... This was one the highlights of Prague. So much fun and a great attraction. It helped us to work together to solve clues. Everyone was involved even our 17 year old son. We all had an amazing hour but we wish it lasted longer!!!! We would definitely do it again. :) And there is always someone to help you if you pick up the phone!

Fantastic! Book now!. Read about this place and passed by to check out if we could book a session during the weekend. Unfortunately the place was fully booked but the people who were supposed to come when we dropped by didn't show up at all we were offered a session right away! Immediately thrown in a communist-style designed room with the old sovjet anthem coming out from the speakers we started to solve the mystery to get out of the room. We had great fun during the hour (that felt like five minutes).We spoke about this basically the rest of the day. Lucas, the guy who runs the place was really nice and speaks great English. :)

Wish we could've stayed longer!. We went with our young adult daughter and learned a lot about how each other's minds operate. The clues were creative, the puzzles inventive, and the decor fit the 70's ear. We loved Prague but the first thing I told friends about our trip was this adventure. We truly had a wonderful experience!

From mouse-click to hands-on experience. Witty, exciting and challenging! I would wholeheartedly recommend this game to anyone who has ever dreamed of actually doing the stuff you so often see in movies or computer games. You’ll explore a set of rooms, collect clues, try to solve puzzles… but you’d better hurry up: your time is running out! The period furnishings create a great atmosphere reminiscent of the Communist past. And if you ever get stuck, don’t worry, there is always the helpful owner on the line.

Great fun!. My girlfriend and I have just visited Trap, and it was a great experience. I would recommend this to anyone with a love for mystery, puzzles and espionage! Easily the best thing we've visited so far in Prague. Great fun that doesn't swallow up a lot of your time if you're on a short break, with a really friendly host, and all at an affordable price.

If you love Sherlock Holmes you will love this!. Me and my boyfriend stumbled across this on trip advisor whilst having lunch at Prague castle. We love Sherlock Holmes and after reading about this decided to Book,it was available on the same afternoon. It was so much fun and although it wasn't easy you can get clues! I would definitely recommend this to anyone! It's something different and interesting...

Most fun in Prague. We've never played an escape game before and this was mind blowing. The owner was extremely helpful and nice. I wish there had been more time and more rooms. I would have spent a hundred euro for that kind of fun. It was super cheap too. I think for my wife and I, it was only 30 euro and we had a blast. It's easy walking distance from the Old District as well. If you don't do anything else, do this and it will provide amazing memories.

Brilliant fun!. My girlfriend and I had the honour of being one of the first five teams to attempt the puzzle. It was elaborate and challenging, which added to the satisfaction of completing it. The design of the puzzles was almost intricate.Would highly recommend going in a team sized larger than 2 - unless you've had prior experience with the TRAP franchise, or are just plain brilliant logician-types.

Smart and well thought out!. The puzzles were rather challenging, and I had so much fun! We went as a pair in January, and we were suitably impressed with how well thought out the entire setup was. The owner Toth was also really friendly, patient and helpful to us. He's amazing!

Something different and a lot of fun!. We wanted to do something different from the sightseeing and we are so glad we found out about this online! It's not something you would notice from the street, but is easy to get to, by the Powder Tower. The clues were really clever and we definitely needed some help but it was so much fun working them out. The guy running the place is super nice and speaks amazing English. Great value for money too. Would highly recommend to couples or groups.

Fun in Prague. I've been there with my friends and it was absolutely amazing and great fun. The puzzles are witty and most likely totally different to those you have seen before (in case the riddles get too challenging there is always friendly staff to help you out, so don't worry). Definitely most recommendable to anyone who would like to experience Indiana Jones style adventure in the heart of Prague.

a real Sherlock Holmes experience :). The TRAP is perfect for people bored with traditional programmes for evenings in Prague who are looking for an extraordinary experience. You really have to use your brains ... and if that fails, there´s always a little help. I sure recommend the TRAP to everyone, me and my friends loved it!

So strange and so cooool!:-). When my boyfriend suggested that we should go try the Trap, I was a little bit hesitant. I thought these kinds of "fun activities" would not do for me, but I was totally surprised! We had an awesome time with our friends, trying to find our way through the game. It was a hundred times better than visiting a famous cathedral!:-) Thanks for the staff who really made the best of our stay. Greetings from Paola, Luca, Maurizio and Dhana from Torino

such a great, different activity to do!. My boyfriend & I decided to do Trap & we absolutely loved it. We didn't know what to expect but what we encountered was so fun & challenging. I would recommend it to anyone, even families! I will definately be doing this again, but in Budapest or Berlin. The staff were so friendly & gave us hints when we needed them! Go & try it, it is something you will not regret!!

Surprising experience in the downtown. I've been there with my boyfriend. We didn't have too much expectations before, but - luckily - we've been wrong. It was smart and funny. We had to solve puzzles and challenges as a team. The staff was helpful, which was another good point. I would recommend it for everyone who likes challenges.

Great experience. Trap Prague was fun thing to do. It was full of attractive and diverse puzzles that provided us a great hour of pure brain-teaseness!It is definitely a new kind of experience and I recommend it to everybody looking for some refreshing entertainment in Prague.
Fun!. Will not reveal all the secrets :) But experience is amazing! A lot of fun, challenges and totally worth it! Recommend it to everyone who live in Prague or coming to visit!

Great Fun!. I would definitely recommend this game,I visited this place with two of my mates. It's really a unique experience.Puzzles are challenging but not impossible to solve,I liked the set up and the secret agents of the cold war story behind the scheme.It's also a lot of laugh and fun,so well done guys and thank you so much...
So much fun! . A group of 4 of us had a blast at Trap Prauge! It was challenging but very fun! 70s secret agent theme was super cool!
Super. Thank you for this amazing experience, totally worth it!! It was the first time I tried this kind of game, and I would recommend it to everyone.
:D. It was awesome! Extremely funny and exciting - it just blew me away from my everyday threadmill. It was literally the highlight of our trip to Prague.

Wow!. Amazing! It was our first ever experience with a 'real life escape game', but what a fun we had! This experience was so intense it actually changed my way of thought. After we went out of TRAP, I kept looking for clues all around me, noticing every little detail of my surrounding. It was fun and definitely worth the money.

Best event of my trip!. It was really exciting and fun to try this new attraction in Prague! It tests your creativity and is a very unique way of having fun! the puzzles gave us serious headaches, but it made us very proud to find our way out from the world of the '70-s secret agents.:)Definitely worth a try if you want to do something cool and exciting during yoyur trip to Prague!The staff is also very friendly and helpful, they make sure you don't actually get trapped in TRAP!;)

great and exciting game. We were 5 people of mixed nationality (Czech, Slovak, American, Hungarian) and the room worked great for us, since it was very logical, language independent.It was our first escape game, and we found it so much fun! It was challenging, but not unsolvable, very well planned. Robert was a great host, and a place has a cool athmosphere :)I definitely would recommend the game!

excellent game. Visited getaway with my girlfriend ans it was a blast from the beginning. The location is great, in an old bunker and Robert, the host was very welcoming, friendly and attentive. The game was well thought, just the perfect difficulty level, nothing easy, but you can figure out the tricks if you really think. Everything was logical, no misleading information, well recommended!

a must visit place for puzzle lovers. the owner was very kind. we couldn't finish it in time so the owner gave us half an hour more. The game is enjoyable and not too hard. Great team building activity.

Such a nice chalangeable game. If you want to have a lot of fun and use your logical, teamworking skills and understand how much is your brain flexible , I totally recommend to go and play this game, It was my first escape game and I had amazing and exciting time with my friends. We learnt a lot during the process and escaped the room luckly.

High recommendations!. An amazing game, we had loads of fun! Great for everybody, especially toung and adventorous people. Very imaginative, makes you think a lot in a great way! It's awesome, must-do in Prague :)

What an experience!. Me and my boyfriend went and played the prison game with little experience with escape rooms but it was a great experience. Amazing setting for the room in a bunker and would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Prague as it is worth the time and money. It was definitely challenging but with hints along the way where we needed we were okay. Great place great host Robert as well he will make you feel very welcome.

Fantastic game!. We played the Prison room and it was a blast! Such a well thought game, and the atmosphere is really well made! It was really easy to immerse in the game. we just simply forgot about anything else! What is an extra, I should mention Robert who is a great host, he surely knows how to treat costumers. He even took his time to give us recommendations and gave us details about life in Czech Republic. Definitely recomended!
10/10. Excellent escape the room! Challenging and thrilling! Great host would recommend highly. Ex bomb shelter makes this different than the other options available

A brilliant introduction to exit games. I took my two sons aged 14 and 20 with me for our first experience of an exit game. We were warmly welcomed by Robert who has developed the two games available here himself. He explained the essentials to us before taking us down to the room. It was a really atmospheric experience in an authentically sparse cellar. We all loved it and found it appropriately challenging. We were relieved to solve it before our time was up but not so soon that it would have felt too easy. Robert was great in that he debriefed us afterwards telling us about clues we had missed, pointing out red herrings and telling us of places where other people had come unstuck! We enjoyed it so much we are looking forward to our next experience though unfortunately at UK prices!

Totally worth it! . We came here with five friends on our last day in Prague. Really enjoyed it, we played the beginner exit game as it was our first time and got out with 7 minutes left! The way the game was set up was really interesting because it's not just about trying to escape. I'd definitely recommend coming here and also good value for money.
FUN. this is definitely not what you expect and not something I can explain. go and play. get out. cool stuff!
A lot of fun.. We've been there with our stag night. It was a lot of fun! Good rooms, good pricing. Would definitely recommend it.

My first exit game. Did not know what to expect as it was my first exit game, but it was an amazing time spent with my friends, can recommend this to anyone who wants to try something new and is curious to test his ability to use brain effectively and keep on communicating with friends!
Velky Meder-Slovensko. Vynikajuca hra :) každemu by som to doporucila, velmi zaujimava hra plna napätia :) It was awsome, interesting and I recomend for everybody.
Prague. Nagyon jol szorakoztunk! Its awsome game, very good style and atmosphere, nice stuff. I can very recommend
Best evening in Prague. One word: Mindblowing! We spent the most exciting evening at Getaway Prague. Really amazing team builder event. Even better than the beer tasting at the brewery..

Best in Prague!!. Getaway was my fourth Prague's escape room experience and I have to say its far better than the others.The game is very smartly developed, nothing like Ive seen so far. We were 10 ppl when visited, split into two rooms and all of us had a great great fun. We spend the whole evening after discussing the experiences and emotions.The venue has very suitable environment of the cellar which goes perfectly with the games' themes.I cant do anything else than highly recommend as all the others Ive seen so far were just a marketing bubble and not thoughtful at all.Get away with the GETAWAY!! :-)

“Coolest activity to get a BACHELORETTE PARTY started”.
